[[Baojun 530#Chevrolet Captiva|Chevrolet Captiva Second generation]] }} {{Multiple image | align = left | direction = vertical | width = 200 | image1 = Chevrolet S3X.jpg | caption1 = 2004 Chevrolet S3X concept | image2 = Chevrolet Captiva rear.JPG | image3 = Chevrolet Captiva interior.jpg | caption3 = Pre-facelift Chevrolet Captiva }} Captiva is a front-wheel or all-wheel drive SUV; the engines were supplied by [[Holden]] in Australia, the [[Family II engine|Family II]] naturally aspirated four-cylinder petrol or the [[Alloytec]] Holden V6 built in Australia, and later a 2.0-L turbodiesel supplied by [[VM Motori]] in South Korea. Designated C100 by Daewoo and CG in Holden's terminology, the Captiva was launched in 2006.{{cite web |last=Sharma |first=Gautum |date=30 January 2006 |url=http://www.carsales.com.au/news/2006/medium-4x4/holden/holden-suv-closer-516 |title=Holden SUV closer |work=Carsales |accessdate=7 June 2009}}{{cite web |url=http://redbook.com.au/ |title=2006 Holden Captiva |work=Red Book |publisher=Automotive Data Services |accessdate=7 June 2009}} Styling of the Captiva was inspired by the 2004 Chevrolet S3X [[concept car]].{{cite web |last=Tan |first=Paul |authorlink=Paul Tan |date=25 November 2005 |url=http://paultan.org/2005/11/25/chevrolet-captiva/ |title=2006 Chevrolet Captiva |publisher=Paul Tan |accessdate=29 January 2008}} The S3X concept was developed by GM Daewoo's design center in [[Bupyeong-gu, Incheon]] and is based on the [[GM Theta platform]]. It premiered at [[Mondial de l'Automobile 2004|2004 Paris Motor Show]].{{cite web |last=Newton |first=Bruce |date=22 September 2004 |url=http://www.goauto.com.au/mellor/mellor.nsf/story2/55DA35AE97C91E96CA256F17000A233D |title=First look: Holden heads into SUV territory |work=GoAuto |accessdate=7 June 2009}} Another concept car, by Daewoo, the Chevrolet T2X premiered at the 2005 [[Seoul Motor Show]] with its design was based on the S3X, using a shortened platform.{{cite web |date=22 September 2005 |url=http://www.webwombat.com.au/motoring/news_reports/gm-t2x.htm |title=Daewoo's SUV Assault Continues |publisher=Web Wombat |accessdate=8 June 2009}} The T2X is referred to as a ''[[SUV|sport utility]] [[coupe]]'',{{cite web |date=26 April 2005 |url=http://www.edmunds.com/insideline/do/News/articleId=105466 |title=GM's T2X and the Statesman to Debut at the Seoul Motor Show |publisher=[[Edmunds.com|Edmunds]] |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060216092934/http://www.edmunds.com/insideline/do/News/articleId%3D105466 |archivedate=16 February 2006 |url-status=dead |df=dmy-all }} accounting for its rear [[hinge]]d doors, lack of conventional [[Pillar (car)|B-pillars]], and shortened [[wheelbase]]{{cite web |date=16 November 2005 |url=http://media.gm.com/servlet/GatewayServlet?target=http://image.emerald.gm.com/gmnews/viewmonthlyreleasedetail.do?domain=520&docid=21505 |title=Chevrolet T2X Concept Car |publisher=[[General Motors]] |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080305183137/http://media.gm.com/servlet/GatewayServlet?target=http%3A%2F%2Fimage.emerald.gm.com%2Fgmnews%2Fviewmonthlyreleasedetail.do%3Fdomain%3D520&docid=21505 |archivedate=5 March 2008 |url-status=dead |df=dmy-all }}—features that were first revealed on the "Daewoo Oto" (later renamed "Daewoo Scope") concept at the 2002 Seoul Motor Show.{{cite web |last=Newton |first=Bruce |date=21 November 2002 |url=http://www.goauto.com.au/mellor/mellor.nsf/story2/4AC414185F124580CA2572100028B89C |title=Daewoo unveils a concept off-roader which could become a Holden |work=GoAuto |accessdate=8 June 2009}}{{cite web |date=12 March 2003 |url=http://www.autoweb.com.au/cms/newsarticle.html?&A=55460 |title=Daewoo 'Scope': Sporty Off-Road Concept Vehicle |work=AutoWeb |publisher=Web Publications |accessdate=8 June 2009}}{{cite book |last=Newberry |first=Stephen |year=2003 |title=The Car Design Yearbook 2: The Definitive Guide to New Concept and Production Cars Worldwide |location=New York City |publisher=Merrell |page=74 |isbn=1-85894-195-4}} Production was slated for late 2006, but as of 2009 no further announcement has been made.{{cite web |last=Pettendy |first=Marton |date=31 March 2009 |url=http://www.goauto.com.au/mellor/mellor.nsf/story2/61AEEC44C7C64EF7CA25758A0010868F |title=Cruze hatchback to be first cab off the rank for Holden small-car production |work=GoAuto |accessdate=8 June 2009}} For the Captiva, the production version of the S3X, both five- or seven-seat configurations are available.{{cite journal |last=Ponchard |first=Nathan |date=November 2006 |url=http://www.wheelsmag.com.au/wheels/site/articleIDs/5AF5DC88746CD7A0CA25725900163A60?open&template=domWheels |title=At last, Holden finds a Seoul mate |journal=[[Wheels (magazine)|Wheels]] |pages=106–112 |accessdate=24 May 2007 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070927115307/http://www.wheelsmag.com.au/wheels/site/articleIDs/5AF5DC88746CD7A0CA25725900163A60?open&template=domWheels |archivedate=27 September 2007 |df=dmy-all }} Standard safety features include: [[anti-lock braking system|antilock brakes]], [[electronic stability control]] (ESC), front [[seatbelt]] pretensioners and force limiters, and driver and front-passenger [[airbag]]s. Side-curtain airbags are standard on higher luxury-level variants in some markets.{{cite web |date=19 July 2007 |url=http://uk.cars.yahoo.com/car-reviews/car-and-driving/chevrolet-captiva-1004953.html |title=Chevrolet Captiva |publisher=[[Yahoo!]] |accessdate=29 January 2008}} In [[Automobile safety|crash safety]] tests conducted by [[Euro NCAP]], the Captiva was given a four out of five stars crash rating.{{cite web |url=http://www.euroncap.com/tests/chevrolet_captiva_2007/278.aspx |title=Chevrolet Captiva |publisher=[[Euro NCAP]] |accessdate=29 January 2008}} The results from the test were helped by the use of high-strength steel used in the body shell which was designed to spread crash forces over distinct load channels, therefore ensuring the safety of the occupants within the safety cell.{{cite web |last=Fallah |first=Alborz |date=6 October 2006 |url=http://www.caradvice.com.au/947/holden-captiva-suv/ |title=Holden Captiva SUV |publisher=CarAdvice |accessdate=21 May 2007}} The vehicle's optional active [[Four-wheel drive|all-wheel drive]] system is fully incorporated with the ESC and antilock braking systems, consequently improving [[car handling]] and control. When the vehicle detects a loss of [[traction (engineering)|traction]], the all-wheel drive mode is activated automatically. In ordinary driving situations, only the vehicle's [[front-wheel drive|front wheels]] are used. === 2011 refresh === A revised Captiva range was released in the second quarter of 2011. The facelifted Captiva featured a new front fascia reminiscent to that of the [[Chevrolet Aveo (T300)]]. Other noticeable cosmetic differences included LED turn signals on the door-mounted mirrors, redesigned wheels, and revised side air vents. The new [[SIDI]] alloy V6 was supplied from Holden in Australia, with the petrol four-cylinder 2.4-L and [[VM Motori]] 2.2-L turbodiesel engines being made in South Korea. Chevrolet Captiva LT 2.4 2012 (13941783995) (cropped).jpg|Series II Chevrolet Captiva LT (Chile) Chevrolet Captiva LS 2.4 2013 (12163468194) (cropped).jpg|Series II Chevrolet Captiva LS (Chile) The interior of Chevrolet CAPTIVA.JPG|Interior (facelift) === 2016 refresh === [[File:20160805 Chevrolet Captiva 01.jpg|thumb|left|Facelift Chevrolet Captiva]] [[File:20160805 Chevrolet Captiva 02.jpg|thumb|right|Facelift Chevrolet Captiva]] The new 2016 Chevrolet Captiva was unveiled at the Dubai International Motor Show 2015 on 10 November 2015.[https://media.gm.com/media/me/en/chevrolet/press_kits.detail.html/content/Pages/presskits/me/en/2015/chevrolet/2016-Chevrolet-Captiva.html New 2016 Chevrolet Captiva Offers Unsurpassed Connectivity] GM Thailand has also unveiled the facelifted Chevrolet Captiva at the 32nd annual Thailand International Motor Expo on 1 December 2015.[http://media.gm.com/media/th/en/chevrolet/news.detail.html/content/Pages/news/th/en/2015/Dec/1201_Captiva.html New 2016 Chevrolet Captiva Offers Unsurpassed Connectivity, Enhanced Safety, Upgraded Design] A facelifted Holden Captiva was also unveiled a day later in Australia.[http://paultan.org/2015/12/02/chevrolet-captiva-australia-gets-new-holden-facelift/ Chevrolet Captiva - Australia gets new Holden facelift] The new Captiva has been updated with new LED headlamps, grille, bumper, and a redesigned dashboard, but retained its body and dashboard panels. The facelifted Captiva was also launched in Indonesia at the 2016 [[Indonesia International Auto Show|Gaikindo Indonesia International Auto Show]] in [[Jakarta]] on 11 August 2016.[http://otomotif.kompas.com/read/2016/08/11/173858315/chevy.all.new.captiva.banderol.mulai.rp.439.juta Chevy All New Captiva Banderol Mulai Rp 439 juta] The V6 engine was no longer sourced from Australia. {{clear|left}} === Powertrains === The Captiva is powered by the Australian (Holden)-built 3.2-L [[GM High Feature engine|Alloytec]] [[V6 engine]] mated to a five-speed [[automatic transmission]], featuring [[Tiptronic|Active Select]]. This engine is also shared by the Captiva's Opel Antara derivative, which uses a different design, but shares the same [[Automobile platform|underpinnings]] and [[powertrain]] components.{{cite web |date=7 September 2006 |url=http://www.holden.com.au/www-holden/action/news?categoryID=5&articleID=1501&navCategoryId=all |title=Holden to offer four models in all-new Captiva range |publisher=[[Holden|GM Holden]] |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060924185915/http://www.holden.com.au/www-holden/action/news?categoryID=5&articleID=1501&navCategoryId=all |archivedate=24 September 2006}} A four-cylinder [[List of VM Motori engines|VCDi]] [[common rail]] [[turbodiesel]] engine, co-developed with VM Motori, was introduced into the range.{{cite web |date=28 February 2007 |url=http://www.holden.com.au/www-holden/action/news?categoryID=5&articleID=1537&navCategoryId=all |title=Captiva diesel delivers performance and economy |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070901083849/http://www.holden.com.au/www-holden/action/news?categoryID=5&articleID=1537&navCategoryId=all |archivedate=1 September 2007 |publisher=[[Holden|GM Holden]]}} {| class = "wikitable" cellpadding = "0" style = "font-size:90%" |- ! colspan = "6" style = "background:#dcdcdc" | Petrol |- ! style = "background:#dcdcdc" | Model ! style = "background:#dcdcdc" | Displacement ! style = "background:#dcdcdc" | Power ! style = "background:#dcdcdc" | Torque ! style = "background:#dcdcdc" | Transmission ! style = "background:#dcdcdc" | Note |- | 2.4 ''[[Family II engine#D-TEC|Family II]]'' [[inline-four engine|I4]] | 2,405 cc | {{convert|103|kW|hp|0|abbr=on}} | {{convert|220|Nm|0|abbr=on}} | 5-speed manual | 2006–2011 |- | 2.4 ''[[GM Ecotec engine#LAF|Ecotec]]'' [[inline-four engine|I4]] | 2,384 cc | {{convert|123|kW|hp|0|abbr=on}} (AU)
{{convert|127|kW|hp|0|abbr=on}} (Asia) | {{convert|230|Nm|0|abbr=on}} | 6-speed manual
6-speed ''[[GM 6T40 transmission|6T40]]'' automatic | 2011– |- | 3.0 ''[[GM High Feature engine#LF1|SIDI]]'' [[V6 engine|V6]] | 2,997 cc | {{convert|190|kW|hp|0|abbr=on}} | {{convert|288|Nm|lbft|abbr=on}} | 6-speed ''[[GM 6T40 transmission|6T40]]'' automatic | 2011– |- | 3.2 ''[[GM High Feature engine#3.2|Alloytec]]'' [[V6 engine|V6]] | 3,195 cc | {{convert|169|kW|hp|0|abbr=on}} | {{convert|297|Nm|lbft|abbr=on}} | 5-speed automatic | 2006–2011 |- ! colspan = "6" style = "background:#dcdcdc" | Diesel |- ! style = "background:#dcdcdc" | Model ! style = "background:#dcdcdc" | Displacement ! style = "background:#dcdcdc" | Power ! style = "background:#dcdcdc" | Torque ! style = "background:#dcdcdc" | Transmission ! style = "background:#dcdcdc" | Note |- | 2.0 ''[[List of VM Motori engines#RA 420 SOHC|VCDi]]'' [[inline-four engine|I4]] ([[turbocharger|t/c]]) | 1,991 cc | {{convert|110|kW|0|abbr=on}} | {{convert|320|Nm|0|abbr=on}} | 5-speed manual
5-speed automatic | 2006–2011 |- | rowspan = "2" | 2.2 ''[[GM Family Z engine|VCDi]]'' [[inline-four engine|I4]] ([[turbocharger|t/c]]) | rowspan = "2" | 2,231 cc | {{convert|120|kW|0|abbr=on}} | {{convert|350|Nm|0|abbr=on}} | rowspan = "2" | 6-speed manual
6-speed ''[[GM 6T40 transmission|6T45]]'' automatic | 2011–2015 |- | {{convert|135|kW|hp|abbr=on}} | {{convert|400|Nm|0|abbr=on}} | 2011–2015 |- | 2.0 ''[[JTD engine#2.0_Multijet_II|VCDi]]'' [[inline-four engine|I4]] ([[turbocharger|t/c]]) | 1,956 cc | {{convert|126|kW|0|abbr=on}} | {{convert|400|Nm|0|abbr=on}} | rowspan = "2" | 6-speed [[AWTF-80 SC|Aisin AWTF-80]] automatic | 2016-2018 |} === Markets === ==== Asia ==== [[File:20100801 daewoo winstorm 001.jpg|thumb|left|Pre-facelift Daewoo Winstorm LT]] [[File:20110912 daewoo winstorm 1.jpg|thumb|right|Facelift Daewoo Winstorm]] South Korean cars were branded Daewoo Winstorm from 2006.{{cite web |last=Tan |first=Paul |authorlink=Paul Tan |date=10 June 2006 |url=http://paultan.org/2006/06/10/gm-daewoo-winstorm/ |title=GM Daewoo Winstorm |work=[[Paul Tan]] |accessdate=3 June 2009}} From 2006 until early 2011, the Opel Antara became available in the Winstorm range, as the "Daewoo Winstorm MaXX".{{cite web |url=http://pr.hankyung.com/newsRead.php?md=A01&tm=1&no=352343 |title=GM DAEWOO 윈스톰 맥스 vs. 혼다 CR-V 성능 비교 체험 |trans-title=GM Daewoo Winstorm MaXX versus Honda CR-V compariso |language=ko |work=[[Korea Economic Daily]] |date=6 August 2008 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5x8lldeMc?url=http://pr.hankyung.com/newsRead.php?md=A01&tm=1&no=352343 |archivedate=12 March 2011 |url-status=dead |df=dmy-all }}{{cite web|url=http://www.autohome.com.cn/drive/200810/46918.html |title=休旅情致 试驾欧宝Opel Antara 2.0D |trans-title=Opel Antara 2.0D test drive |language=zh |date=5 October 2008 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5x8lsLZFN?url=http://www.autohome.com.cn/drive/200810/46918.html |archivedate=12 March 2011 |url-status=dead |df=dmy }} As part of GM's strategy to phase out the "Daewoo" brand worldwide, since early 2011, the Winstorm has been marketed under the global Chevrolet Captiva name in South Korea. This rebranding came after the March 2011 renaming of GM Daewoo to [[GM Korea]]. At the same time, the Winstorm MaXX disappeared without a Chevrolet-badged equivalent (except Latin America and South America, which is sold outside of South Korea). The Chevrolet Captiva was launched in [[Vietnam]] during 2006. The Captiva in Vietnam was manufactured in [[knock-down kit|complete knock-down]] form by Vidamco ([[GM Vietnam]]), with 20% local parts content. From 2006 to July 2009, 8,500 Captivas have been sold in Vietnam.{{cite web|last=Hung |first=Quoc |date=6 July 2009 |url=http://english.thesaigontimes.vn/Home/business/corporate-news/5301/ |title=Vidamco launches Captiva Maxx SUV |work=[[Saigon Times Daily]] |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/611iFfPdS?url=http://english.thesaigontimes.vn/Home/business/corporate-news/5301/ |archivedate=18 August 2011 |url-status=dead |df=dmy }}{{cite web|last=Ellison |first=Edd |date=15 November 2010 |url=http://wardsauto.com/ar/vietnam_auto_industry_101115/ |title=Vietnam Gearing Up for Rapid Auto Industry Growth |work=[[Ward's|Ward's Auto]] |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/611kEqiqD?url=http://wardsauto.com/ar/vietnam_auto_industry_101115/ |archivedate=18 August 2011 |url-status=dead |df=dmy }} In Thailand, Captivas have been produced at the GM facility in Rayong between 2006-2018. Chevrolet Thailand offered the Captiva in LS and LT variants, with engines comprising either the 2.4-L gasoline or 2.0-L diesel units. Captiva also featured the availability of self-levelling rear suspension, ESC, automatic headlamps, and rain-sensing wipers. Late in 2010, Chevrolet expanded the diesel line-up to include a mid-range LSX and flagship LTZ model. At the same time, Captivas fitted with the 2.4-L gasoline engine benefitted from E20 ethanol support and increased power to {{convert|170|PS|kW|0|abbr=on|order=flip}}. On 23 June 2011, Chevrolet Thailand unveiled the updated the Captiva using the new 2.4-L petrol engine with support of [[E85]] [[ethanol]] fuel. New features include an electric parking brake, climate control commands on the steering wheel; and later, the updated 2.0-L diesel engine rated at {{convert|163|PS|kW|0|abbr=on|order=flip}}. The Captiva entered the Chinese market in early November 2007. The only available engine is the 2.4-L [[GM Ecotec engine#LAF|Ecotec]] inline-four engine mated to a six-speed automatic. GM launched the Chevrolet Captiva in Japan on 30 July 2011, the first GM model to be released there since the [[General Motors Chapter 11 reorganization|company's chapter 11 reorganisation]] in June 2009.{{cite web|url=http://sankei.jp.msn.com/economy/news/110530/biz11053016520015-n1.htm |script-title=ja:ＧＭ、中型ＳＵＶ「キャプティバ」発表　破綻後初めて日本に新車投入 |trans-title=GM releases the Captiva mid-size SUV, the first new model since its collapse |language=ja |work=[[Sankei Shimbun|MSN Sankei News]] |date=30 May 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5z5bAcCNC?url=http://sankei.jp.msn.com/economy/news/110530/biz11053016520015-n1.htm |archivedate=31 May 2011 |url-status=dead |df=dmy }} {{anchor|Holden Captiva}} ==== Australia & New Zealand ==== {{see also|Holden Captiva}} {{multiple image | align = left | direction = vertical | width = 200 | image1 = 2010 Holden Captiva 7 (CG MY10) LX AWD wagon (2018-10-29).jpg | footer = Pre-facelift Holden Captiva }} {{multiple image | align = right | direction = vertical | width = 200 | image1 = 2014 Holden Captiva 7 (CG II MY14) LTZ AWD wagon (2015-07-14) 01.jpg | footer = Facelift Holden Captiva 7 }} Holden in Australia and New Zealand have sold the vehicle under the "[[Holden Captiva]]" name between November 2006-2017, after announcing the model the previous September.{{cite web |last=Pettendy |first=Marton |date=12 September 2006 |url=http://www.goauto.com.au/mellor/mellor.nsf/story2/009A25A10CC69F7ACA2571E70005BB8B |title=Opel Antara to head Holden's Captiva range |work=GoAuto |accessdate=4 November 2009}} The Captiva launched with the 3.2-L V6 and five-speed automatic transmission, but March 2007 had the addition of the 2.0-L diesel engine with five-speed manual or optional automatic.{{cite web |last=Mathioudakis |first=Bryon |date=9 March 2007 |url=http://www.goauto.com.au/mellor/mellor.nsf/story2/04ED90BF5B7B8855CA257299000C12C2 |title=First drive: Good oil on Holden's diesel Captiva |work=GoAuto |accessdate=18 February 2011}} While initially manufactured in South Korea, production was temporarily shifted to Thailand from September 2007 until early 2008 while GM Daewoo upgraded its production facilities in South Korea to cope with global demand.{{cite web |last=Mellor |first=John |date=27 September 2007 |url=http://www.goauto.com.au/mellor/mellor.nsf/story2/2D3080DABB3E68E8CA2573620081B35B |title=Captiva to Thailand |work=GoAuto |accessdate=4 November 2009}} Specification levels were SX, CX, and LX, with a range-topping [[Opel Antara|Captiva MaXX]] variant offered, although this was a rebadge of the closely related [[Opel Antara]].{{cite web |last=Stevens |first=Samantha |date=10 October 2006 |url=http://www.carsguide.com.au/site/news-and-reviews/car-reviews-road-tests/holden_captiva_imported_suv |title=Holden Captiva: imported SUV |work=[[The Daily Telegraph (Sydney)|The Sunday Telegraph]] |accessdate=22 January 2008 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110706102726/http://www.carsguide.com.au/site/news-and-reviews/car-reviews-road-tests/holden_captiva_imported_suv |archive-date=6 July 2011 |url-status=dead }} The Antara-derived MaXX remained on sale in Australia until 2008,{{cite web |last=Newton |first=Bruce |date=6 March 2009 |url=http://news.drive.com.au/drive/motor-news/holden-gives-captiva-a-tweak-20090306-146sz.html |title=Holden gives Captiva a tweak |work=Drive |accessdate=3 June 2009 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110706103546/http://news.drive.com.au/drive/motor-news/holden-gives-captiva-a-tweak-20090306-146sz.html# |archive-date=6 July 2011 |url-status=dead |df=dmy-all }} with New Zealand sales continuing on until the end of 2009.{{cite web |url=http://www.redbook.co.nz/vehicle/vehicles.php?make=HOLD&family=LCCAPTIVA&year=2009 |title=2009 Holden Captiva |work=Red Book New Zealand |publisher=Automotive Data Services |accessdate=4 November 2009}} When Holden resurrected the Antara-based model as a price-leading five-seater "Captiva 5" in December 2009,{{cite web |url=http://www.goauto.com.au/mellor/mellor.nsf/story2/42D3FE9CCA7D35EACA25768C001C6FD3 |title=Overview: 2009 Holden Captiva 5 2.4 2WD 5-dr wagon |work=GoAuto |accessdate=18 February 2011}} the seven-seat only Chevrolet-based models were renamed "Captiva 7".{{cite web |last=Maric |first=Paul |date=17 February 2010 |url=http://www.caradvice.com.au/57444/holden-captiva-review/ |title=Holden Captiva Review & Road Test |publisher=Car Advice |accessdate=18 February 2011}}{{cite web |last=Spinks |first=Jez |date=29 May 2010 |url=http://www.drive.com.au/Editorial/ArticleDetail.aspx?ArticleID=69590&comparisonID=2062 |title=Small 4WDs Mega-test |work=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |accessdate=18 February 2011}} [[File:2017 Holden Captiva (CG MY17) Active 2WD wagon (2018-08-06) 01.jpg|thumb|right|The Holden Captiva's second update occurred in 2016, with the Captiva 5 and 7 being merged into a single Captiva model{{cite web|last1=Stevens|first1=Mike|title=2016 Holden Captiva pricing and specifications|url=http://www.caradvice.com.au/418379/2016-holden-captiva-pricing-and-specifications/|accessdate=25 July 2017}}]] Revisions to the Captiva 7 range were announced in February 2011, designated "Series II", with a March on-sale date.{{cite web |last=Hammerton |first=Ron |date=16 February 2011 |url=http://www.goauto.com.au/mellor/mellor.nsf/story2/FD17A525B4A50D98CA2578380026197E |title=First drive: Holden’s fresh Captiva goes hunting in pairs |work=GoAuto |accessdate=18 February 2011}} Changes included the adoption of the facelifted front-end fascia, as applied to Chevrolet versions, but with a Holden-specific grille and air [[intake]]. New design alloy wheels,{{cite web |last=Stevens |first=Mike |date=16 February 2011 |url=http://www.themotorreport.com.au/51415/2011-holden-series-ii-captiva-5-and-captiva-7-facelift-revealed-on-sale-in-march |title=2011 Holden Series II Captiva on Sale in March |publisher=The Motor Report |accessdate=18 February 2011}} "[[Altezza lights|Altezza]]" tail lamps,{{cite web |last=Beissmann |first=Tim |date=16 February 2011 |url=http://www.caradvice.com.au/105025/2011-holden-captiva-series-ii-on-sale-in-march/ |title=2011 Holden Captiva Series II on sale in March |publisher=Car Advice |accessdate=18 February 2011}} and other trimmings feature, as does a revised interior centre console.{{cite web |last=Pomroy |first=Tim |date=18 February 2011 |url=http://www.mynrma.com.au/motoring/reviews/car-reviews/holden/holden-captiva-series-ii.htm |title=Holden Captiva Series II First Drive |publisher=[[NRMA]] |accessdate=18 February 2011 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110221204232/http://www.mynrma.com.au/motoring/reviews/car-reviews/holden/holden-captiva-series-ii.htm# |archive-date=21 February 2011 |url-status=dead |df=dmy-all }} Equipment-wise, the revised centre console houses a new 7-inch multifunction display in LX trim, which incorporates [[automotive navigation system|satellite navigation]] and a [[backup camera|rear-view camera]]. Revised powertrains also feature on the Series II. The base setup is the SX trim with the 2.4-L petrol using front-wheel drive; the 2.2-L diesel is optional. The CX and LX variants add all-wheel drive and offer the 3.0-L V6 as standard, with the 2.2-L diesel remaining optional. All three engines are paired with a six-speed automatic. Holden announced a minor model year update in July 2012, the centrepiece of which is the addition of [[flexible-fuel vehicle|flex-fuel capability]] for both petrol engines, thus allowing them to accept [[E85]] [[ethanol fuel]].{{citation needed|date=February 2020}} A cut in the official combined fuel consumption of the 3.0-L by 10% has also been achieved, with smaller gains for the 2.4-L petrol and 2.2-L diesel engines. At the same time, the base SX received standard rear [[parking sensors]] and the range-topping LX came additionally equipped with heated front seats and front park assist.{{cite web |last=Costello |first=Mike |date=6 July 2012 |url=http://www.goauto.com.au/mellor/mellor.nsf/story2/67B6EC8C2F68D893CA257A33000E3462 |title=Holden improves Captiva fuel economy |work=GoAuto |accessdate=9 July 2012}} ==== Middle East ==== In the Middle East, the Captiva launched with two basic trims: one with the 2.4-L gasoline engine and another with the 3.0-L V6. Both trims are seven-seaters and offer front-wheel drive. === Discontinuation === On 13 September 2018, Chevrolet announced that it is ending production on the first generation Captiva and will phase it out globally in favor of expanding the Equinox. The move had been in the works since 2017, when GM began replacing the Captiva in Australia with the Equinox for the Holden lineup, followed by South Korea in August 2018, with GM’s Uzbekistan plant ceasing production on 12 September 2018. With the discontinuation of the Captiva, GM will allow dealers to sell off the remaining inventory.[http://gmauthority.com/blog/2018/09/gm-is-phasing-out-the-chevrolet-captiva-crossover-globally/ "GM Is Phasing Out The Chevrolet Captiva Crossover Globally"] from GM Authority (13 September 2018) == Second generation (2019–present) == {{main|Baojun 530}} [[File:Chevrolet Captiva 1.5T LT 2019.jpg|thumb|right|2019 Chevrolet Captiva 1.5T LT]] The second generation Captiva is a rebadged version of [[Baojun 530]]. It was introduced in Colombia in November 2018 and Thailand in March 2019.

{{For|the compact crossover sold in China and North America since 2019|Chevrolet Trailblazer (crossover)}} {{short description|American mid-size sport utility vehicle}} {{Use mdy dates|date=February 2019}} {{more citations needed|date=July 2008}} {{Infobox automobile | name = Chevrolet TrailBlazer | image = Chevrolet TrailBlazer -- 06-05-2010.jpg | manufacturer = [[Chevrolet]] ([[General Motors]]) | production = {{unbulleted list | 1999–2001 (as [[Chevrolet S-10 Blazer|Blazer]] trim line) | 2001–2008 (separate model, North America) | 2012–present (Asia and Brazil) }} 2015-2017 (India) | class = [[Mid-size car|Mid-size]] [[Sport utility vehicle|SUV]] | body_style = 5-door SUV | layout = {{unbulleted list | [[Front-engine, rear-wheel-drive layout|Front-engine, rear-wheel-drive]] | [[Front-engine, four-wheel-drive layout|Front-engine, four-wheel-drive]] }} | predecessor = [[Chevrolet S-10 Blazer]] | successor = {{unbulleted list | [[Chevrolet Traverse]] (North America) | [[Chevrolet Equinox]] (for first generation) }} }}
The '''Chevrolet TrailBlazer''' is an automobile nameplate used by [[Chevrolet]], a division of [[General Motors]] for their lineup of SUVs. The nameplate was first used as a [[Mid-size car|mid-size]] [[Sport utility vehicle|SUV]] that was sold from 2001 to 2009 for the North American market. It was replaced by the introduction of the [[Chevrolet Traverse|Traverse]] in 2009. In 2012, a production of a newly redesigned version of the Trailblazer for Asia and Brazil began.
The model went off line in India, because of low sales and General Motors withdrawal in the country in 2017.
__TOC__
{{clear}}
== Blazer trim line (1999–2001) == [[File:99-02 Chevrolet Blazer TrailBlazer.jpg|left|thumb|1999–2001 Chevrolet Blazer TrailBlazer]]
The TrailBlazer name was first introduced for the 1999 [[model year]] as an upscale trim level of the compact 4-door [[Chevrolet S-10 Blazer]]. It offered additional features on top of the previously top-of-the-line [[Chevrolet S-10 Blazer]] '''LT''' trim level, including an A/M-F/M stereo with single-disc CD player and optional remote cassette player, [[OnStar]], color-keyed front and rear bumpers, side cladding, and front grille, a leather-wrapped steering wheel with cruise control, upgraded alloy wheels, a full-size spare tire and wheel, and upgraded cloth seating surfaces with power front bucket seats. Options such as a [[Bose Corporation|Bose]] premium audio system, leather-trimmed seating surfaces with front seat heating, premium alloy wheels, a power sunroof, and gold accents for the exterior emblems and alloy wheels were all available for the TrailBlazer. While the TrailBlazer trim level was discontinued after 2001 when the all-new, mid-size 2002 TrailBlazer was introduced, production of the standard compact [[Chevrolet S-10 Blazer]] overlapped until the 2005 [[model year]], when it was finally replaced by the [[Chevrolet Equinox]] in the U.S. .
{{clear}}

Trailblazer 2006 product information</ref> }} | wheelbase = {{unbulleted list | Standard: {{convert|113|in|mm|0|abbr=on|order=flip}} | EXT: {{convert|129|in|mm|0|abbr=on|order=flip}} }} | length = {{unbulleted list | Standard: {{convert|74.5|in|mm|0|abbr=on|order=flip}} (2002–2003); {{convert|72.5|in|mm|0|abbr=on|order=flip}} (2004–2009) | EXT: {{convert|77.1|in|mm|0|abbr=on|order=flip}}; {{convert|75.5|in|mm|0|abbr=on|order=flip}} }} | successor = [[Chevrolet Traverse]] (North America) }}
[[File:2002-2005 Chevrolet TrailBlazer rear.jpg|thumb|left|2002–2005 Chevrolet TrailBlazer, with modification to meet Japanese standards.]]
The first generation 2002–2005 TrailBlazer is based on a truck platform called [[GMT360]], with all models having [[four-wheel-drive]] layout as an option with both automatic engagement and the more traditional "2 High", "4 High" and "4 Low" gearings, except the SS model which features an [[all-wheel-drive]] system. The TrailBlazer features an [[independent front suspension]], and a five-link rear suspension. A G80 locking rear differential is available as an option on all models except for the SS which has a G86 LSD standard. An LTZ version, has upgraded interior features (leather), better sound system ([[Bose Corporation|Bose]]), and alloy wheels. All TrailBlazers came factory equipped with a detachable towing hitch.
[[File:06-08 Chevrolet TrailBlazer.jpg|left|thumb|2006–2008 Chevrolet TrailBlazer LT]]
The TrailBlazer was updated in 2005 for the 2006 model year. An updated front fascia on models higher than the base version and new interior trim were included with the refresh. The SS gets trim-specific front and rear fascias plus color-matched side skirts.
=== Engines === The TrailBlazer comes with an all-aluminum 4.2 L ''[[General Motors Atlas engine#LL8|Atlas LL8]]'' [[I6 engine|inline-six]] engine that produces {{convert|203.5|kW|hp PS|abbr=on|0}} and {{convert|277|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on|order=flip}} of torque as standard, or an optional aluminum [[GM small-block engine#5300|small-block]] 5.3 L [[V8 engine|V8]] engine that produces {{convert|225|kW|hp PS|abbr=on|0}} and {{convert|330|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on|order=flip}} of torque with [[Active Fuel Management]]. The inline-six engine option makes the TrailBlazer the most powerful six-cylinder SUV in its class.{{citation needed|date=October 2018}} The Active Fuel Management system on the V8 engine shuts off 4 of the 8 cylinders during highway travel and idle to save fuel. The inline-six versions of the TrailBlazer get up to {{convert|20|mpgus|L/100 km mpgimp}} on highway, according to refreshed [[United States Environmental Protection Agency]] estimates.
The TrailBlazer won the ''[[North American Car of the Year|North American Truck of the Year]]'' award in 2002. The 4.2 L engine appeared on the ''[[Ward's 10 Best Engines]]'' list from 2002–2005 with innovative features such as [[DOHC]], [[variable valve timing]] on the exhaust camshaft and GM's patented [[lost-foam casting]] process.
* 2002–2009 ''[[GM Atlas engine#LL8|LL8]] ''4.2 L [[I6 engine|I6]] * 2003–2004 ''[[GM small-block engine#5300|LM4]]'' 5.3 L [[V8 engine|V8]] * 2005–2009 ''[[GM small-block engine#5300|LH6]]'' 5.3 L V8 * 2006–2009 ''[[GM LS engine#LS2|LS2]]'' 6.0 L V8
=== Trim Levels ===
Throughout its production run, the TrailBlazer was available in several different trim levels:
The '''LS''' was the base trim level of the TrailBlazer, and included a plentiful amount of standard equipment, including aluminum-alloy wheels, four wheel disc brakes, the 4.2L [[Vortec]] Inline Six-Cylinder (I6) gasoline engine, a four-speed automatic transmission, cloth seating surfaces, a full-size, matching spare tire with black-painted steel spare wheel, an A/M-F/M stereo with single-disc CD player, a four-speaker audio system, power windows, door locks, and mirrors, keyless entry, a 65/35 split-folding rear bench seat, cruise control and a Driver's Information Center. Optional features included a combination cassette and single-disc CD player or a six-disc CD player, a power front driver's seat, a security system, satellite radio (later models) and [[OnStar]].
The '''LT''' was the midlevel trim of the TrailBlazer, and added further convenience items to the base '''LS''' trim, including upgraded aluminum-alloy wheels, a power front driver's seat, a security system, and a leather-wrapped steering wheel. Optional features included a [[Bose Corporation|Bose]] six-speaker premium amplified audio system, a combination cassette and single-disc CD player or a six-disc, in-dash CD changer, luxury leather-trimmed seating surfaces, dual heated front bucket seats, a power front passenger's seat, a driver's memory system for front driver's seat, mirrors, and radio preset settings, a power moonroof, a rear DVD entertainment system by [[Panasonic]] (newer models), polished aluminum-alloy wheels, [[OnStar]], a touchscreen GPS navigational radio (later models), and a universal garage door opener system with travel note recorder.
The '''LTZ''' was the top-of-the-line trim level of the TrailBlazer, and added further luxury features to the already well-equipped '''LT''' trim, including a Bose six-speaker premium amplified audio system, a six-disc, in-dash CD changer, luxury leather-trimmed seating surfaces, dual heated front bucket seats, [[OnStar]], a universal garage door opener system with travel note recorder, a power moonroof, and upgraded interior trim. Additional options included polished aluminum-alloy wheels, a touchscreen GPS navigational radio (later models) and a rear DVD entertainment system by [[Panasonic]].
The '''SS''', introduced for the 2006 model year, was the performance-oriented model of the TrailBlazer, and was based on either the '''LT''' or '''LTZ''' trim, depending on the equipment package selected (see the specific models above for standard and optional equipment, which is identical to those trim levels). The differences included unique interior trim, unique polished aluminum-alloy wheels, a unique leather-wrapped steering wheel with an "SS" center emblem, "SS" emblems on the polished wheel center caps, "SS" embroidery for both front bucket seats, unique premium cloth or luxury leather-trimmed seating surfaces, and a 6.0L V8 gasoline engine taken from the [[Chevrolet Corvette (C6)]].
=== EXT === [[File:Chevrolet TrailBlazer EXT -- 12-21-2011 2.jpg|thumb|left|2003–2005 Chevrolet TrailBlazer EXT]]
The TrailBlazer was also available as a 3-row, 7-passenger EXT version. This vehicle was {{convert|16|in|mm|abbr=on|order=flip}} longer and had a higher roofline to allow easier access to the third row of seats. This roof was disguised by standard roof racks. The TrailBlazer EXT platform was given the internal designation GMT370, which was shared with the [[GMC Envoy|GMC Envoy XL]] and [[Isuzu Ascender|Isuzu Ascender LWB]]; long wheelbase versions of the [[Oldsmobile Bravada]], [[Buick Rainier]] and [[Saab 9-7X]] were never offered.
Production of the EXT model was handled by the [[Oklahoma City Assembly]] plant in [[Oklahoma City]], Oklahoma. The last TrailBlazer EXT rolled off the assembly line on February 20, 2006, because GM had reportedly closed that plant, making 2006 the final year for the TrailBlazer EXT.
The EXT could be identified by its much straighter rear doors (which were not inline with the rear wheel arches), as well as by the circular, metal cap on each of the quarter windows where the opening mechanism attaches, on the 2003 models only.
=== SS === [[File:Wikitbss.jpg|thumb|right|250px|2006 Chevrolet TrailBlazer SS]]
An SS model was introduced for the 2006 model year. This was the first time a production SUV wore the [[Super Sport (Chevrolet)|Super Sport]] badge.<ref>"[http://www.tuningnews.net/article.php?date=050328 Tuning News.net article on the Trailblazer SS]", Chevrolet Trailblazer SS 9/23/05. Retrieved September 29, 2006.</ref> The TrailBlazer SS came standard with a 6.0 L ''[[GM LS engine#LS2|LS2]]'' V8 engine, the same engine that came standard in the 2005–2007 [[Chevrolet Corvette (C6)|C6 Corvette]], with different exhaust (more restrictive) and a taller intake that better utilized the torque characteristics of the engine in the heavier body. The suspension was stiffened up and lowered from the factory, it had an added air-leveling system in the rear, and it rode on {{convert|20|in|mm|abbr=on}} wheels and {{convert|255|mm|in|abbr=on}} wide tires — all which contributed to much improved handling. All TrailBlazer SS also came from the factory with 4.10 differentials, improving off-the-line acceleration. They were available in both [[rear-wheel-drive]] and all-wheel-drive configurations. About 1.7% of total TrailBlazer production had the B4U SS-package.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Huizenga |first1=Paul |title=Storm on the Horizon: Tracing Today's Super SUV Origins |url=https://www.drivingline.com/articles/storm-on-the-horizon-tracing-todays-super-suv-origins/ |website=Driving Line |publisher=Nitto Tire |accessdate=19 December 2019}}</ref>
{| class="wikitable" border="1" |- ! Calendar Year ! Total TrailBlazer SS Sales |- | 2006 | 9,361 |- | 2007 | 10,726 |- | 2008 | 5,744 |- | 2009 | 610 |- |}
=== Safety === [[Insurance Institute for Highway Safety|IIHS]] tests in early 2009 gave early TrailBlazers a ''Acceptable<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.iihs.org/ratings/vehicle/chevrolet/trailblazer-4-door-suv/2009|title=2009 Chevrolet TrailBlazer 4-door SUV|website=IIHS-HLDI crash testing and highway safety}}</ref>'' overall rating in the frontal offset test while 2005–2009 models got an ''Acceptable'' rating. For 2008 models side curtain airbags became standard. At that time, the TrailBlazer received a ''Marginal'' overall side impact rating - tested with optional side airbags present. Torso type side airbags were not available then.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.iihs.org/ratings/ratingsbyseries.aspx?id=439 |title=IIHS-HLDI: Chevrolet TrailBlazer |publisher=Iihs.org |accessdate=May 7, 2009 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081206010713/http://www.iihs.org/ratings/ratingsbyseries.aspx?id=439 |archive-date=December 6, 2008 |url-status=dead }}</ref>{{update after|2018|3|21}}
2007 [[National Highway Traffic Safety Administration]] (NHTSA) Crash Test Ratings:<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.safercar.gov/portal/site/safercar/menuitem.94b0130be143aeb342252f0835a67789/?vgnextoid=68adf2905bf54110VgnVCM1000002fd17898RCRD |title=Safercar.gov |publisher=Safercar.gov |accessdate=May 7, 2009 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090429085758/http://www.safercar.gov/portal/site/safercar/menuitem.94b0130be143aeb342252f0835a67789/?vgnextoid=68adf2905bf54110VgnVCM1000002fd17898RCRD |archivedate=April 29, 2009 }}</ref>
* Frontal Driver: {{rating|3|5}} * Frontal Passenger: {{rating|4|5}} * Side Driver: {{rating|5|5}} * Side Rear Passenger: {{rating|5|5}} * Rollover 2wd: {{rating|3|5}} * Rollover 4wd: {{rating|4|5}}
=== Yearly American sales === {| class="wikitable" border="1" |- ! Calendar Year ! Total American sales |- | 2001<ref>{{cite web|url=http://media.gm.com/news/sales/030103_decsales.html |title=mediaOnline |publisher=Media.gm.com |date=January 3, 2003 |accessdate=May 7, 2009 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20090423151018/http://media.gm.com/news/sales/030103_decsales.html |archivedate=April 23, 2009 }}</ref> | 115,103 |- | 2002 | 249,568 |- | 2003 | 261,334 |- | 2004<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.theautochannel.com/news/2006/01/05/205609.html|title=GM Reports December 2005 and Year Results|work=theautochannel.com}}</ref> | 283,484 |- | 2005 | 244,150 |- | 2006<ref>{{cite web|url=http://media.gm.com/servlet/GatewayServlet?target=http://image.emerald.gm.com/gmnews/viewmonthlyreleasedetail.do?domain=6&docid=31596 |title=GM Media Online |publisher=Media.gm.com |date=January 3, 2007 |accessdate=May 7, 2009 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20090423152022/http://media.gm.com/servlet/GatewayServlet?target=http://image.emerald.gm.com/gmnews/viewmonthlyreleasedetail.do%3Fdomain=6&docid=31596 |archivedate=April 23, 2009 }}</ref> | 178,493 |- | 2007 | 151,985 |- | 2008<ref>{{cite web|url=http://media.gm.com/servlet/GatewayServlet?target=http://image.emerald.gm.com/gmnews/viewpressreldetail.do?domain=2&docid=51161 |title=GM Media Online |publisher=Media.gm.com |date=January 5, 2009 |accessdate=May 7, 2009 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20090831002223/http://media.gm.com/servlet/GatewayServlet?target=http://image.emerald.gm.com/gmnews/viewpressreldetail.do%3Fdomain=2&docid=51161 |archivedate=August 31, 2009 }}</ref> | 119,905 |- | 2009 | 22,287 |- |}
=== Discontinuation === The next generation TrailBlazer was to be built on an upgraded version of the current GMT360 platform called the GMT361. It was scheduled to be launched in spring 2007, but in January 2006, GM decided to just refresh the current platform and call the vehicle a GMT360NG. However, in June 2006, GM announced that the GMT360NG program was also canceled due to the large investment. GM decided to keep the current TrailBlazer until the 2009 model year (2008 in Mexico).
[[Buick]] instead got the [[Buick Enclave|Enclave]], a [[GM Lambda platform]]-based [[crossover SUV]] to replace the [[Buick Rainier|Rainier]] (along with the [[Buick Rendezvous|Rendezvous]] and the [[Buick Terraza|Terraza]] [[minivan]]), while [[GMC (automobile)|GMC]] got the [[GM Theta platform]]-based crossover SUV [[GMC Terrain|Terrain]] to replace the [[GMC Envoy|Envoy]]. [[Saab Automobile|Saab]] replaced the [[Saab 9-7X|9-7X]] with the [[Cadillac SRX]]-based [[Saab 9-4X|9-4X]], which was discontinued soon after its introduction in 2011.
The TrailBlazer, along with the [[Chevrolet Uplander|Uplander]] [[minivan]], were replaced by the [[Chevrolet Traverse|Traverse]]. GM had closed the Moraine plant on December 23, 2008, ending production of all GMT360 products.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.autoweek.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20081006/FREE/810069969/1530/FREE|title=GM to shut Ohio SUV plant 2 years ahead of plan|work=autoweek.com|access-date=November 6, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110628232225/http://www.autoweek.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=%2F20081006%2FFREE%2F810069969%2F1530%2FFREE|archive-date=June 28, 2011|url-status=dead}}</ref> The last TrailBlazer rolled off the Moraine line on December 16, 2008, a week before the plant's closure. The closing of the last factory that manufactured the trucks was the subject of a 2009 HBO documentary ''[[The Last Truck: Closing of a GM Plant]]''.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2009/09/07/arts/television/07truck.html|title=HBO Documentary Captures Days in the Death of a General Motors Plant|first=Mike|last=Hale|date=September 6, 2009|via=NYTimes.com}}</ref>
=== Recall === In 2012, [[General Motors]] and [[Isuzu]] recalled more than 258,000 SUVs in the U.S. and Canada to fix short-circuits in power window and door lock switches that could cause fires. The recall covered TrailBlazer, Envoy, Rainier, Ascender and 9-7X SUVs from the 2006 and 2007 model years. The SUVs were sold or registered in 20 U.S. states, Washington, D.C., and Canada, where salt and other chemicals are used to clear roads in the winter.<ref>{{cite web|title=GM recalls SUVs for fire hazard|url=http://www.cnn.com/2012/08/18/business/gm-recall/index.html|publisher=CNN|accessdate=August 18, 2012}}</ref>
== {{anchor|RG}} Second generation (RG; 2012–present) == {{Redirect|Holden Colorado 7|the pick-up truck|Holden Colorado}} {{Infobox automobile | name = Second generation | image = Chevrolet TrailBlazer 01.jpg | aka = {{unbulleted list | Holden Colorado 7 (New Zealand) | Holden Trailblazer (Australia) }} | production = 2012–present | assembly = {{unbulleted list | Thailand: [[Rayong]] ([[General Motors Thailand|GM Thailand]]) | Brazil ([[General Motors do Brasil|GM Brazil]]) }} | designer = | platform = GMT31XX | related = {{unbulleted list | [[Chevrolet Colorado#Second generation (2012–present)|Chevrolet Colorado]] | [[Isuzu D-Max#Isuzu MU-X|Isuzu MU-X]] }} | engine = {{unbulleted list | 3.6 L ''[[GM_High_Feature_engine#3.6|LFX]] [[V6 engine|V6]] (gasoline) | 2.5 L ''[[List of GM engines#Four-cylinder 2|Duramax]]'' [[Inline-four engine|I4]]-[[Turbocharger|T]] ([[Diesel engine|diesel]]) | 2.8 L ''Duramax'' I4-T (diesel) }} | powerout = {{unbulleted list | {{convert|110|–|132.5|kW|hp PS|abbr=on|0}} (2.5 L) | {{convert|132.5|–|147|kW|hp PS|abbr=on|0}} (2.8 L) | {{convert|178|–|208|kW|hp PS|abbr=on|0}} (3.6 L) }} | transmission = {{unbulleted list | 6-speed [[Manual transmission|manual]] | 6-speed automatic }} | wheelbase = {{convert|2845|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | length = {{convert|4887|–|4952|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | width = {{convert|2132|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | height = {{convert|1848|–|1852|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} }}
[[File:Trailblazerjf9867.JPG|thumb|left|Rear quarter view]]
The second generation (stylised as Trailblazer instead of TrailBlazer) was unveiled as a concept at the 2011 [[Dubai Motor Show]], and as a production model at the [[Bangkok International Motor Show|Bangkok Motor Show]] on March 21, 2012.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://en.chevrolet.co.th/cars/trailblazer/model-overview.html|title=The New Trailblazer Z71|website=www.chevrolet.co.th}}</ref> As is the case with the original [[Chevrolet K5 Blazer|K5 Blazer]] (1969–1994), [[Chevrolet Tahoe|Tahoe]] (since 1995), [[Chevrolet Suburban|Suburban]] (since 1935) and [[Chevrolet S-10 Blazer|S-10 Blazer]] (1983–2005), the second-generation Trailblazer is based on a truck frame, namely the second generation [[Chevrolet Colorado#Second generation (2012–present)|Colorado]].
The second generation Trailblazer is built in Thailand and in Brazil.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://exame.abril.com.br/estilo-de-vida/carros-cia/noticias/chevrolet-lanca-trailblazer-por-r-145-450|title=Chevrolet lança Trailblazer por R$ 145.450|author=Vitor Matsubara|date=November 14, 2012|work=Exame|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130329064937/http://exame.abril.com.br/estilo-de-vida/carros-cia/noticias/chevrolet-lanca-trailblazer-por-r-145-450|archivedate=March 29, 2013}}</ref> It is currently being sold in some of the Southeast Asian countries, India, South Africa, Saudi Arabia and sold in Australia as the Holden Colorado 7 from 2013 to 2016, and being rebadged as the Trailblazer in 2017. The [[Isuzu MU-X]] also resembles the second generation Trailblazer.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.goauto.com.au/future-models/holden/colorado-7/holden-tackles-achilles-heel-with-colorado-7-suv/2012-06-15/12485.html|title=Future Models - Holden - Colorado 7|first=GoAutoMedia-HAITHAM RAZAGUI and MIKE|last=COSTELLO|website=GoAuto}}</ref>
=== Engines === The second generation Trailblazer comes with three engine options, two of them are [[Diesel engine|diesel]]s, one featuring a Duramax 2.5 L that produces {{convert|110|–|132.5|kW|hp PS|abbr=on|0}} and {{convert|350|–|440|Nm|lbft|abbr=on}} of torque as standard, and an optional Duramax 2.8 L that produces {{convert|132.5|–|147|kW|hp PS|abbr=on|0}} and {{convert|470|–|500|Nm|lbft|abbr=on}} of torque. For the Brazilian, South African and Saudi markets, the 3.6 L [[V6 engine|V6]] gasoline engine option that produces {{convert|178|kW|hp PS|abbr=on|0}} (in Brazilian market, the 2015 version producing {{convert|208|kW|hp PS|abbr=on|0}}) and {{convert|360|Nm|lbft|abbr=on}} of torque is also available.
The 2.8 L diesel engine have several new parts, namely a new water-cooled variable-geometry turbocharger, a new high-pressure common-rail fuel delivery system, a new [[exhaust gas recirculation]] (EGR) system, a new intake manifold, a new cylinder head, a new cylinder block, a new balance shaft unit and a new Engine Control Module (ECM).<ref name="Chevrolet Trailblazer Specifications">{{cite web|title=Chevrolet Trailblazer in India - Price, Mileage, Reviews, Images, Specs|url=http://www.cartrade.com/chevrolet-cars/trailblazer/#Specifications|publisher=CarTrade|accessdate=October 26, 2015}}</ref>
=== Holden Colorado 7/Trailblazer === [[File:Holden Colorado 7.jpg|thumb|left|Holden Colorado 7]]
Launched in late 2012, the '''Holden Colorado 7''', like the Trailblazer, is based on the same under pinnings as the regular Colorado, however bodywork from the A-pillar back is entirely different. Instead the Colorado 7 takes on the form of a large SUV with an enclosed roof, tailgate and 7-seats. The Colorado 7 is powered by the same [[VM Motori]] 2.8 L [[turbodiesel]] engine and unlike the Colorado, the rear suspension is a five-link system connected to coil springs but retains the live axle.<ref name="Holden Colorado 7 revealed">{{cite web|last=Stanford|first=James|title=Holden Colorado 7 revealed|url=http://www.caradvice.com.au/196538/holden-colorado-7-2/|publisher=Car Advice|accessdate=August 11, 2013}}</ref>
The range consists of two trim levels; LT and LTZ. Standard equipment for all Colorado 7s includes cruise control, body-coloured bumpers, side steps, front fog lights, aluminium roof rails, rear parking sensors (in addition to the rear camera), Bluetooth phone connectivity, USB input, roof mounted climate control vents for second and third rows and a leather-wrapped steering wheel with multifunction controls. The LTZ adds 18-inch wheels, projector headlights, exterior chrome highlights, leather seats, a premium sounds system, a six-way adjustable driver's seat, higher grade interior trim elements and LED tail-lights.<ref name="Holden Colorado 7 revealed"/>
[[File:2018 Holden TrailBlazer (RG MY17) LT 4x4 wagon (2018-11-02).jpg|thumb|left|2017 Holden Trailblazer]]
At its first model update in 2016, the Colorado 7 was renamed to '''Trailblazer'''.<ref>[http://www.themotorreport.com.au/64183/2017-holden-trailblazer-ltz-review-colorado-7-kicked-out-as-holdens-newcomer-blazes-new-trails-with-refinement Brad Leach, 12 October 2016, 2017 Holden Trailblazer LTZ Review: Colorado 7 Kicked-Out... But Holden’s Newcomer Blazes New Trails, www.themotorreport.com.au] Retrieved January 5, 2017</ref>
{{clear}}

{{Infobox automobile | name = Chevrolet Sail | image = Chevrolet Sail 3 01 China 2015-04-06.jpg | caption = 2012 Chevrolet Sail sedan (China) | manufacturer = [[Shanghai GM]] | production = 2000–present | model_years = 2001–present | predecessor = | successor = [[Buick Excelle]] (Buick: in 2003) | class = [[Supermini]] | body_style = | layout = [[Front-engine, front-wheel-drive layout|Transverse front-engine, front-wheel-drive]] | sp = }} The '''Chevrolet Sail''' is a [[supermini car]] produced by the Chinese manufacturer [[Shanghai-GM|Shanghai General Motors]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.chevrolet.com.cn/brandsite/car_sail.html|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120305120110/http://www.chevrolet.com.cn/brandsite/car_sail.html|url-status=dead|title=2011 雪佛兰新赛欧两厢 (Chinese)|archivedate=March 5, 2012}} Launched in 2001, it was sold as the [[Buick]] Sail, both in sedan and wagon form which were both based on [[Opel Corsa#Corsa B|Opel Corsa B]]. Since 2005, as the brand [[Chevrolet]] was officially introduced in China, the car received a facelift and its name was changed to Chevrolet Sail and Sail SRV. In 2010, the new Sail was completely redesigned. The new model offers sedan and hatchback variations. The latest Chevrolet Sail has been exported to Chile,{{Cite web|url=http://www.chevrolet.cl/vehiculos/modelos-showroom/autos/sail/caracteristicas.html|title=Chevrolet Sail - auto sedán compacto (Chile, Spanish)}} Peru, also has been produced in Ecuador,https://www.gmobb.ec/portal/es/web/gmobb/productos and other developing countries in North Africa and the Middle East. Starting from 2013, this model is manufactured by [[GM Colmotores]] in Bogotá, Colombia, for domestic and regional markets.{{Cite web|url=http://www.portafolio.co/negocios/gm-colmotores-sera-fabricante-partir-del-2012|archiveurl=https://archive.today/20130117000305/http://www.portafolio.co/negocios/gm-colmotores-sera-fabricante-partir-del-2012|url-status=dead|title=Página no encontrada | Portafolio.co|archive-date=2013-01-17}} A third generation made its debut in November 2014, at the [[Guangzhou Auto Show]].{{Cite web|url=https://media.gm.com/content/media/cn/en/cadillac/news.detail.html/content/Pages/news/cn/en/2014/Nov/1120_autoshow.html|title=Chevrolet, Buick and Cadillac Take Center Stage at Guangzhou Auto Show|date=November 20, 2014|website=media.gm.com}} ==First generation (2001–2009)== {{Infobox automobile | name = First generation | image = Buick Sail China 2012-04-28.JPG | caption = Buick Sail (2001–2004) | production = 1993–1996 (Jiangbei Meilu)
2000–2009 (Buick and Chevrolet) | aka = Jilin Jiangbei Meilu JJ7090

[[Yantai, Shandong]] (2003–2009) | body_style = 4-door [[sedan (car)|saloon]]
5 door [[station wagon|estate]] | layout = | platform = | related = [[Opel Corsa]] B | engine = 1.2 L ''[[Daewoo S-TEC engine|LMU]]'' [[Inline-four engine|I4]] ([[Petrol engine|petrol]])
1.4 L ''[[Daewoo S-TEC engine|LCU]]'' [[Inline-four engine|I4]] ([[Petrol engine|petrol]])
1.6 L ''BPR6EY'' [[Inline-four engine|I4]] ([[Petrol engine|petrol]]) | transmission = 5-speed [[Manual transmission|manual]]
5-speed [[Automatic transmission|automatic]]
4-speed [[Automatic transmission|automatic]] | wheelbase = {{convert|2500|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | length = {{convert|4300|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | width = {{convert|1735|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | height = {{convert|1504|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} }} [[File:Buick Sail SRV China 2012-04-14.JPG|thumb|left|Buick Sail S-RV (2001–2004)]] ===Buick Sail=== On 12 December 2000, the first Chinese-made Buick rolled off the production line as part of trial production. Series production commenced in June 2001.{{cite book | title = World of Cars 2006·2007 | publisher = Media Connection Sp. z o.o. | location = Warsaw, Poland | page = 237 | year = 2006 }} This car was the first compact car produced by the SAIC-GM [[joint-venture]], and was aimed squarely at young families. The Buick Sail was based on [[Opel Corsa#Opel Corsa B|Opel Corsa B]], and the body design is shared with the Brazilian Chevrolet Corsa Classic and India's Opel Corsa Joy. This four-door saloon bodywork was never offered in Europe, instead being intended for developing markets. The only engine choice is a 1.6 litre, {{convert|92|PS|kW|0|abbr=on}} [[inline-four engine]], coupled to a five-speed manual transmission.{{Cite web|url=http://www.people.com.cn/GB/channel3/22/20001212/346562.html|title=别克赛欧今日下线  三种配置售价10—12.5万元|website=people.com.cn}} The price was under 100,000 [[RMB]]. The car went on sale in June 2001. [[File:Shanghai GM Saibao panel van rear China 2012-04-08.JPG|thumb|left|Shanghai Auto Saibao SAC6420]] In December 2001, the wagon version, Buick Sail S-RV, was also introduced to the Chinese consumers. Basically this vehicle is also a body variation of the Opel Corsa B. The engine is the same as the Sail sedan. In June 2002, [[SAIC Motor|SAIC]] subsidiary SAIC-Yizheng introduced a locally built version of the Corsa-based [[Opel Combo#B|Opel Combo]] glazed tallboy van as the "Shanghai Auto (Shangqi) ''Saibao'' SAC6420" (上汽赛宝). Equipped with the same 1.6 litre engine and five-speed manual transmission as the [[Buick Sail]] (albeit only with {{convert|90|PS|kW|0|abbr=on|disp=or}}), it was produced in fairly small numbers (2,053 cars in 2004, for instance) until 2005. "Saibao" has sometimes been anglicized as "Sabre". There was also a Saibao DeLuxe version available, with alloy wheels and other extras. The Saibao could reach {{convert|160|km/h|mph|abbr=on}}.{{cite web | url = http://www.carnewschina.com/2011/12/08/spotted-in-china-shanghai-auto-saibao-panel-van/ | publisher = CarNewsChina.com | first = Tycho | last = De Feyter | date = 2011-12-08 | title = Spotted in China: Shanghai Auto Saibao panel van }} ===Chevrolet Sail=== {{Multiple image | align = left | direction = vertical | width = | image1 = Chevrolet Sail China 2012-04-14.JPG | image2 = Chevrolet Sail rear China 2012-04-15.jpg | caption2 = Chevrolet Sail (China) }} {{Multiple image | align = left | direction = vertical | width = | image1 = Chevrolet Sail Wagon 01 China 2012-04-22.JPG | image2 = Chevrolet Sail Wagon 02 China 2012-04-22.JPG | caption2 = Chevrolet Sail wagon (China) }} In February 2005, the Chevrolet brand was introduced to China, where it was described as a "younger" brand than Buick. As part of an endeavour to redefine the brand image of Buick, the Sail became the first Chinese-built Chevrolet passenger car.''World of Cars 2006·2007'', p. 238 The Chevrolet Sail (SGM7165) received a locally upgraded design. The interior was also refined. Both sedan and wagon (now the SGM7166) forms were kept, although production of the Saibao Van ended. While sharing the original's wheelbase, the new wagon version (at 4,097 mm) is 71 mm longer than the old one's 4,026 mm. The 90 PS, 1.6 litre-engine option remained unchanged, while the transmission options originally were limited to a five-speed [[manual transmission|manual]] but were later joined by a four-speed [[Automatic transmission|automatic]]. Claimed top speed for the manual versions is {{convert|177|km/h|mph|0|abbr=on}}.''World of Cars 2006·2007'', p. 395 In the autumn of 2006, the Chevrolet Sail was exported to Chile as the '''Chevrolet Corsa Plus'''. The Corsa Plus includes dual front airbags, anti-lock brakes, air conditioning, electric windows and central locking as standard equipment.{{Citation needed|date=April 2016}} The production in Shanghai-GM ceased at the beginning of 2009, but at the same time the '''[[Chevrolet Classic]]''' and its wagon version '''Chevrolet Classic SW''' adopted the design of the Chevrolet Sail and were released in Latin America as the 2010 model year. The sedan version has been produced in Argentina until the October 2016, but it was equipped with different engines. In Argentina, the Classic was powered by a 1.4 L 8V 69 kW engine. The model offered in Brazil had a 1.0 L Flexpower engine, of which the output is 56.7 kW when fueled with gasoline, or 57.4 kW with alcohol.[http://www.chevrolet.com.ar/vehiculos/modelos-showroom/autos/classic-4-puertas/detalle-motor.html Chevrolet Classic 4 Puertas (Argentina, Spanish)]{{Cite web|url=http://www.chevrolet.com.br/veiculos/todos-os-modelos/carros/classic/Ficha-Tecnica/motorizacao-freios.html|title=Chevrolet Classic (Brazil, Portuguese)}}{{Clear}} ==Second generation (2010–2014)== {{Infobox automobile | name = Second generation | image = Chevrolet Sail II hatch China 2012-06-02.JPG | production = 2010–2014
2012–2017 (India) | aka = Springo EV
