1.4 L ''[[Daewoo S-TEC engine|LCU]]'' [[Inline-four engine|I4]] ([[Petrol engine|petrol]])
1.3 L [[Inline-four engine|I4]] ([[Diesel engine|diesel]]) | transmission = 5-speed [[Manual transmission|manual]] | wheelbase = {{convert|2465|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | length = {{convert|3946|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} (hatchback)
{{convert|4249|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} (sedan) | width = {{convert|1690|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | height = {{convert|1503|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | weight = {{convert|1065|-|1124|kg|lb|abbr=on}} | related = }} [[File:Chevrolet Sail II hatch rear China 2012-04-28.JPG|thumb|left|Chevrolet Sail hatchback (China)]] [[File:2012 Chevrolet Sail sedan rear 8.2.18.jpg|thumb|left|Chevrolet Sail sedan (China)]] On 11 January 2010, Shanghai-GM introduced the all-new Chevrolet Sail.{{Cite web|url=https://media.gm.com/content/media/cn/en/chevrolet/news.detail.html/content/Pages/news/cn/en/2010/January/11.html|title=Shanghai GM Introduces Chevrolet New Sail Small Car|date=January 11, 2010|website=media.gm.com}} The car was designed and engineered by the [[Pan-Asia Technical Automotive Center]] (PATAC). A 1.2-litre [[Daewoo S-TEC engine|S-TEC II]] 64 kW engine and a 1.4-litre 76 kW S-TEC III engine are available. The transmission options include a five-speed manual and a five-speed electronic manual transmission (EMT). It is said that this car was engineered to achieve 4 stars in China New Car Assessment Program (C-[[Euro NCAP|NCAP]]). Airbags, central locking, AUX in / USB input and power steering are standard equipment. The pricing begins from 56,800 RMB. At the 2010 [[Auto China]] in Beijing, GM unveiled the Sail hatchback. This car is about 3947 mm long, but its trunk area has up to 1,215 liters of space. Engines and transmissions are shared with the Sail sedan. On 21 October 2010, the first new Sails were exported to Chile and [[Libya]].{{Cite web|url=http://auto.sina.com.cn/news/2010-10-25/1022667230.shtml|title=雪佛兰新赛欧实现批量出口 首批订单近万辆_新浪汽车_新浪网|website=auto.sina.com.cn}} The local Chevrolet dealers take care of the Sail servicing. ===Other markets=== ====India==== In [[India]], the Chevrolet Sail U-VA hatchback was showcased for the first time at the [[Auto Expo|New Delhi Auto Expo 2012]] and launched nationwide on November 2, 2012. It features Chevrolet’s signature dual port chrome grille, Hawk Wing styled headlamps and is available in 7 colors. Its 25+ storage spaces, along with ‘Flex Flat’ & 60:40 Folding Rear Row seats, make it one of the most spacious cars in the hatchback segment. The engineers at the GM Technical Center – India, in Bangalore, participated in localization of the vehicle to meet local requirements. The Chevrolet Sail U-VA is available in the 1.3 l [[Multijet|Smartech]] turbocharged DOHC diesel and 1.2 l Smartech petrol engine variants. The 1.3 l diesel engine delivers 22.1 km/l while the 1.2 l petrol engine delivers a mileage of 18.2 km/l Chevrolet Sail is a recently launched sedan from one of the leading automobile manufacturers in the world - Chevrolet. The car, which shares its platform with the successful Chevrolet Sail Sedan was launched in India on February 1, 2013. Now its competes with Tata Zest. The car, even before its launch, was quite a buzz with experts and automobile enthusiasts because of its attractive looks that are based on the Dynamic Sculpture Design Philosophy. The Corvette inspired Dual-Cockpit interiors are also quite famous among those who understand car design philosophy. Various auto magazines and journals have also touted its ‘Safe Cage’ Design as one of the safest in the segment. The Chevrolet Sail is available in the 1.3 l Smartech turbocharged DOHC diesel and 1.2 l Smartech petrol engine variants. The 1.3 l diesel engine delivers 22.1 kmpl* while the 1.2 l petrol engine delivers a mileage of 18.2 kmpl* General Motors launched the new '''Chevrolet Sail''' {{Cite web|url=https://www.carkhabri.com/carmodels/chevrolet/chevrolet-sail|title=Chevrolet Sail India - Chevrolet Sail Price, Review, Mileage, Specs|website=https://www.carkhabri.com/}} in India in sedan and hatchback forms, with petrol and diesel versions, in four trim levels. The petrol version uses a 1.2L S-Tec II engine which is also seen in the India spec Chevrolet Beat. The 1.2L petrol motor has power and torque figures of 86 PS at 6,000 rpm and 113 Nm at 5,000 rpm. The 1.3L diesel engine is GM's version of the Fiat 1248cc MultiJet motor, with figures of 78PS at 4,000 rpm and 205Nm at 1,750 rpm. The MultiJet engine is an outcome of alliance between GM and Fiat. GM offers a 5-speed manual gearbox for both the petrol and diesel variants. The various fuel trims in Chevrolet Sail are priced differently. The Petrol trims are priced between Rs. 5,79,864/- to Rs. 7,21,176/-. The Diesel trims of Chevrolet Sail start at Rs. 7,11,316/-.{{cite web|url=http://www.cartrade.com/chevrolet-cars/sail|title=Chevrolet Sail in India - Price, Mileage, Reviews, Images, Specs|publisher=Staff|date=|accessdate=2015-08-18}} The model came out of line in India, because withdrawal of General Motors in the country in 2017. The Sail was a bestseller, but the GM decided to get out of the country. ====South America==== The Sail is also marketed on the Pacific coast of South America, in [[Chile]], [[Colombia]] and [[Ecuador]]. It is assembled from CKD-kits by [[:es:General Motors OBB|General Motors of Ecuador]], and also manufactured at least of 90% in Colombia by [[GM Colmotores]] in his factory on the [[:es:Zona Franca de Bogotá|Free Zone of Bogotá]]. ====Philippines==== Chevrolet have decided to unleash their new compact sedan in at the upcoming 2016 Manila International Auto Show. This entry level car is the manufacturer’s newest voyage to capitalize on the heavy demand for sedans in the Philippines.{{Cite web|title = Chevrolet All Set To Entice Philippines at MIAS|url = http://www.carbay.ph/en/car-news/chevrolet-all-set-to-entice-philippines-at-mias-21149696|website = CarBay Philippines|accessdate = 2016-03-31}} ===Springo EV (electric version)=== [[File:Springo EV 001 (cropped).jpg|thumb|Springo EV front]] [[File:Springo EV 002 (cropped).jpg|thumb|Springo EV rear]] At the 2010 [[Auto Guangzhou|Guangzhou International Automobile Exhibition]], GM showed an [[Electric vehicle|EV]] version of the Sail Hatchback called the Springo EV. Although this concept car does not wear a Chevrolet badge, it is still a part of Chevrolet's worldwide electric vehicle strategy. According to GM's press release this car has a 65 kW motor which has a maximum torque of 220 Nm. Top speed is about 130 km/h and the driving range with full battery is claimed as 150 km. It was also reported that this car had reached the electric vehicle safety requirements set by SAE and ISO. [[Shanghai General Motors]] introduced the Sail Springo EV at the 2012 [[Auto Guangzhou]]. The [[electric car]] is scheduled to be sold in [[Shanghai]] in 2013 as part of a trial program, and initially only a limited number of cars will be available. The Springo EV has a [[all-electric range|range]] of {{Convert|130|km|abbr=on}} and up to {{Convert|200|km|abbr=on}} at a constant speed of {{convert|60|km/h|abbr=on}}. The electric car will be sold for RMB 258,000 ({{USD|41,460}}), before incentives of up to RMB 60,000 ({{USD|9,642}}) from the central government and RMB 40,000 ({{USD|6,428}}) from the Shanghai government. In addition, the car will qualify for a free local Shanghai license plate exclusively for electric vehicles.{{cite web|url=http://www.greencarcongress.com/2012/11/springo-20121126.html|title=Shanghai General Motors introduces Sail SPRINGO EV at Auto Guangzhou 2012; green technology strategy to 2020 |author=Shanghai General Motors Press Release|publisher=Green Car Congress|date=2012-11-26|accessdate=2012-11-27}} The Sail Springo EV was developed as joint-venture between Shanghai General Motors and partner [[SAIC Motor]]. {{clear}} ==Third generation (2015–present)== {{Infobox automobile | name = Third generation | image = Chevrolet Sail 3 01 China 2015-04-06.jpg | caption = Chevrolet Sail sedan (China) | aka = [[Chevrolet Aveo]] (Mexico){{cite web|title=Chevrolet Aveo 2018 a prueba|url=https://noticias.autocosmos.com.mx/2017/11/23/chevrolet-aveo-2018-a-prueba|publisher=Autocosmos.com|accessdate=2017-11-23|date=2017-11-23}}{{cite web|title=Aveo 2020® Auto sedán ideal para la ciudad Chevrolet Mex|url=https://www.chevrolet.com.mx/autos/aveo-auto-sedan|publisher=chevrolet.com.mx|accessdate=2019-12-10|date=2019-12-10}} | model_years = 2015–present | production = 2014–present | assembly = [[Yantai, Shandong]], [[China]] ([[Shanghai GM]]) | body_style = 4-door [[sedan (car)|sedan]] | layout = | platform = | wheelbase = {{convert|2500|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | length = {{convert|4300|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | width = {{convert|1735|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | height = {{convert|1504|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | engine = 1.3 L ''LEW'' [[Inline-four engine|I4]] ([[Petrol engine|petrol]])
1.5 L ''[[Daewoo S-TEC engine|L2B]]'' [[Straight-4|I4]] ([[Petrol engine|petrol]]) | transmission = 5-speed [[Manual transmission|manual]]
4-speed automatic }} [[File:Chevrolet Sail 3 002 China 2016-04-13.jpg|thumb|left|Chevrolet Sail 3 rear]] The third generation Chevrolet Sail was presented for the first time in November 2014, at the [[Guangzhou Auto Show]] and commenced production in December 2014. It is based on a new small car platform developed by [[Shanghai GM]],{{Cite web|url=http://www.mostreliablecarbrands.com/the-new-chevrolet-sail-comes-to-peru/|title=The new Chevrolet Sail comes to Peru | Most Reliable Car Brands}} and adopts Chevrolet's new design language, with the dual-port grille and the eagle eye-shaped headlamps. With a length of {{convert|4300|mm|in|1|abbr=on}},{{Cite web|url=https://www.chevrolet.cl/cars/2019-sail/specs|title=Sail Especificaciones | Sedán | Chevrolet|website=ChevroletChile}} larger by {{convert|45|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} than the previous generation, and a wheelbase of {{convert|2500|mm|in|1|abbr=on}}, extended by {{convert|35|mm|in|1|abbr=on}}, it now provides a roomier interior space. The boot has a total of {{Convert|366|l|cuft}} of space. The powertrain range consists of two petrol engines: a 1.3-litre VVT unit and a 1.5-litre DVVT one, both equipped with [[start-stop function]] and delivering improved performance compared to the previous generation. The 1.3-litre engine offers a maximum power of {{convert|76|kW|PS|0|abbr=on}} and a peak torque of {{convert|127|Nm|1|abbr=on}}, having a fuel economy of {{convert|5.3|l/100 km|abbr=on}}. The 1.5-litre engine generates a maximum power of {{convert|83|kW|PS|0|abbr=on}} and a peak torque of {{convert|141|Nm|1|abbr=on}}, having a fuel economy of {{convert|5.4|l/100 km|abbr=on}}.{{Cite web|url=https://media.gm.com/content/media/cn/en/gm/news.detail.html/content/Pages/news/cn/en/2014/Dec/1218_chevrolet.html|title=Shanghai GM Launches Chevrolet Sail 3|date=December 18, 2014|website=media.gm.com}} It was developed by Shanghai GM and Pan Asia Technical Automotive Center (PATAC) engineers, and is available only as a four-door saloon.{{Cite web|url=https://www.chevrolet.com.cn/|title=雪佛兰Chevrolet中国官方网站-雪佛兰官方网站|website=chevrolet.com.cn}} It is exported to markets such as Chile, Philippines, Peru,{{Cite web|url=https://media.gm.com/content/media/cn/en/gm/news.detail.html/content/Pages/news/cn/en/2015/july/0720_chevrolet-export.html|title=SAIC GM Begins Chevrolet Sail 3 Family Sedan Exports|date=July 20, 2015|website=media.gm.com}} Mexico (sold as Aveo), and [[Myanmar]] {{clear}} ==References== {{Commons category|Chevrolet Sail}} {{reflist|refs= {{cite web |url= http://www.chevrolet.cl/sail-auto-sedan.html |title=2013 Sail | Auto Sedán | Chevrolet | language=Spanish |work=chevrolet.cl |year=2013 |accessdate=1 October 2013}} {{Cite web|url=http://media.gm.com/media/intl/en/chevrolet/vehicles/spark/2009.detail.html/content/Pages/news/intl/en/2011/CHEVROLET/10_12_spark_ev_all-electric_vehicleChevrolet|title=to Produce Spark EV All-Electric Vehicle}} {{cite web |url=http://media.gm.com/content/media/ec/es/chevrolet/vehicles/AUTOS/sail/2012.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131004225344/http://media.gm.com/content/media/ec/es/chevrolet/vehicles/AUTOS/sail/2012.html |url-status=dead |archive-date=4 October 2013 |title=Chevrolet - Ecuador - Sail |language=Spanish |work=media.gm.com |year=2013 |accessdate=1 October 2013 }} {{Cite web|url=https://media.gm.com/content/media/cn/en/gm/news.detail.html/content/Pages/news/cn/en/2010/December/1220.html|title=General Motors Participates in Guangzhou Auto Show|date=December 20, 2010|website=media.gm.com}} {{cite web |url = http://media.gm.com/content/media/co/es/chevrolet/vehicles/sail/2013.html |archive-url = https://archive.today/20131001145257/http://media.gm.com/content/media/co/es/chevrolet/vehicles/sail/2013.html |url-status = dead |archive-date = 1 October 2013 |title = Chevrolet - Colombia - Sail |language = Spanish |work = media.gm.com |year = 2013 |accessdate = 1 October 2013 }} {{cite web |url= http://media.gm.com/content/media/co/es/chevrolet/vehicles/sail-co/2013.html |title=Chevrolet - Colombia - SailCo |language=Spanish |work=media.gm.com |year=2013 |accessdate=1 October 2013}} {{cite web|url=http://www.hybridcars.com/news/gm-shows-first-domestically-made-ev-china-63360.html|archive-url=https://archive.today/20130126062725/http://www.hybridcars.com/news/gm-shows-first-domestically-made-ev-china-63360.html|url-status=dead|archive-date=2013-01-26|title=GM Shows First Domestically Made EV in China|author=Jeff Cobb|publisher=HybridCars.com|date=2012-11-26|accessdate=2012-11-27}} }} {{Chevrolet vehicles}} {{Buick China timeline}} {{Buick Vehicles}} [[Category:Chevrolet vehicles|Sail]] [[Category:Subcompact cars]] [[Category:Cars introduced in 2001]] [[Category:2000s cars]] [[Category:2010s cars]]

{{Infobox automobile | name = Chevrolet Traverse | image = 2018 Chevrolet Traverse LT, front 8.11.18.jpg | caption = Chevrolet Traverse (second generation) | manufacturer = [[Chevrolet]] ([[General Motors]]) | production = 2008–present | model_years = 2009–present | assembly = [[Spring Hill, Tennessee]], [[United States]] (2009 only)
[[Delta Charter Township, Michigan]], [[United States]] (2010–present) | class = [[Full-size]] [[crossover SUV]] | related = [[GMC Acadia]] (first generation)
[[Buick Enclave]]
[[Saturn Outlook]] (formerly)
[[Cadillac XT6]] | layout = {{ubl | [[Front-engine, front-wheel-drive layout|Front-engine, front-wheel-drive]] | [[Front-engine, four-wheel-drive layout|Front-engine, all-wheel-drive]] }} | predecessor = [[Chevrolet TrailBlazer]] (first generation)
[[Chevrolet Uplander]]
[[Saturn Outlook]]
[[Chevrolet Orlando]] (first generation)
[[Chevrolet Astro]] }} The '''Chevrolet Traverse''' is a seven or eight seat [[full-size]] [[crossover SUV]] built by [[General Motors]]. It is built on the same platform as the [[GMC Acadia]] and [[Buick Enclave]] ([[GM Lambda platform|Lambda]] for first generation, [[GM Epsilon Platform#C1XX|C1XX]] for second generation). It is the successor to the [[Chevrolet TrailBlazer]] SUV and [[Chevrolet Uplander|Uplander]] minivan. Originally marketed as a [[Full-size SUV|full-size]]{{cite web|url=https://www.chevrolet.com/suvs/traverse-mid-size-suv|title=Chevrolet Traverse: Mid Size Crossover SUV}} crossover SUV, the Traverse was built at GM's Spring Hill, Tennessee, assembly plant during 2009, but then production of the Traverse had moved to GM's Delta Township, Michigan, assembly plant in 2010. The 2009 Chevrolet Traverse debuted at the 2008 [[Chicago Auto Show]] and the Traverse had arrived at every Chevrolet dealer in October 2008. The second generation model debuted in showrooms in the summer of 2017. Starting with the 2019 model year, the Traverse was slotted above the new mid-size [[Chevrolet Blazer (crossover)|Chevrolet Blazer]] as part of Chevrolet's plans to expand its CUV lineup.[http://media.chevrolet.com/media/us/en/chevrolet/home.detail.html/content/Pages/news/us/en/2018/jun/0621-2019-blazer.html “BOLD DESIGN DEFINES 2019 CHEVROLET BLAZER”] from Chevrolet (June 21, 2018) == Powertrain == The Chevrolet Traverse features the [[GM High Feature engine#LLT|LLT]] engine, a {{convert|3564|cc|L cuin||abbr=on}} [[Overhead camshaft#Double overhead camshaft|DOHC]] [[V6 engine|V6]] with [[Variable valve timing|VVT]] and [[Gasoline direct injection|direct injection]].{{cite press|url=http://archives.media.gm.com/us/chevrolet/en/product_services/r_trucks/r_c_traverse/09index.html#specs |title=2009 Chevrolet Traverse |publisher=GM |date=2008-06-09 |accessdate=2009-10-16}} The other Lambda-based vehicles also have this powertrain in the 2009 model year. A 6-speed [[automatic transmission]] gives power to the front or all wheels.{{cite press|publisher=GM|title=2009 Chevrolet Traverse, with Enhanced Powertrain, Delivers Efficient, Responsive and Safe Driving Experience|url=http://archives.media.gm.com/us/gm/en/news/events/autoshows/08chicago/brands/chevrolet080206/08_Chicago_09_Chevrolet_Traverse%20Driving_R.html|date=February 6, 2008 }} The Traverse delivers {{convert|281|hp|abbr=on}} with the torque at 266 lb·ft. in the LS and LT models. The LTZ model, with dual exhaust, delivers {{convert|288|hp|abbr=on}} and the torque comes in at 270 lb·ft.{{citation needed|date=October 2011}} The Traverse received a 2.0L 4-cylinder Turbo engine for the 2018 model year (RPO code LTG), available only on the RS trim level.{{Cite web|url=http://gmauthority.com/blog/2019/04/gm-discontinues-2-0l-turbo-engine-in-chevrolet-traverse/|title=GM Discontinues 2.0L Turbo Engine In Chevrolet Traverse|website=GM Authority|access-date=2019-05-29}} The 2.0L 4-cylinder Turbo engine was short-lived, with Chevrolet discontinuing the engine for the Traverse in April 2019. 2018 also saw an updated 3.6L V6 engine (RPO code LFY). The updated 3.6L engine features increased power, and engine start-stop technology.{{Diff|en:GM_High_Feature_engine|diff=|oldid=897151647|label=en:GM_High_Feature_engine, oldid 897151647}}{{Circular reference|date=March 2020}} Starting for the 2018 model year, A 9-speed 9T65 transmission was used across all trim levels and engine options.{{Cite web|url=https://media.gm.com/content/media/us/en/chevrolet/vehicles/Traverse/2018.tab1.html|title=2018 Chevrolet Traverse Crossover|website=media.gm.com|language=en|access-date=2019-05-29}} {| class=wikitable |- !Year!!Exhaust!!Engine!!Power!!Torque!!Transmission |- |2009–2017||Single||3.6 L ''[[GM High Feature engine#LLT|LLT]]'' [[V6 engine|V6]]||281 hp (210 kW)||266 lb·ft (361 N·m)||rowspan=2|6-speed ''[[GM 6T75 transmission|6T75]]'' |- |2009–2017||Dual||3.6 L ''[[GM High Feature engine#LLT|LLT]]'' [[V6 engine|V6]]||288 hp (215 kW)||270 lb·ft (366 N·m) |- |2018-2019 |Dual |3.6L LFY V6 |310 hp (231 kW) |266 lb·ft (360 N·m) | rowspan="2" |9-speed 9T65 |- |2018-2019 |Dual |2.0L LTG 4-cylinder Turbo |257 HP (192 kW) |295 lb·ft (400 N·m) |} == Design == The Traverse name was originally used for a [[concept car]] at the 2003 [[North American International Auto Show]] in Detroit, but that concept gave way when the [[Chevrolet Equinox]] launched for the 2005 model year. The production Traverse's design was inspired by the 2005 [[Chevrolet Sequel]] concept, and has a [[chevron (insignia)|chevron]]-shaped grille similar to the 2008 [[Chevrolet Malibu]]. The Traverse has unique sheet metal different from the other Lambda crossovers, with the exception of the doors. == Marketing == The Traverse was part of a [[product placement]] by GM in the NBC drama ''[[My Own Worst Enemy (TV series)|My Own Worst Enemy]]'', along with the new [[Chevrolet Camaro]]; the show was cancelled in mid-November 2008. The vehicle also appears on the remake of ''[[Hawaii Five-0 (2010 TV series)|Hawaii Five-0]]'' and ''[[The Mentalist]]''. The Traverse is also used in the Minnie Van Service in conjunction with [[Lyft]] at the [[Walt Disney World]] Resort in Florida. Gothic black colors of the Chevrolet Traverse are commonly used by federal agencies, such as Secret Service. == {{anchor|1}} First generation (2009–2017) == {{Infobox automobile |name=First generation |image=2009 Chevrolet Traverse.jpg |production=2008–2017 |model_years=2009–2017 |assembly=[[Spring Hill, Tennessee]], [[United States]] (2009)
[[Delta Township, Michigan]], [[United States]] (2010–2017) |platform=[[GM Lambda platform]]/GMT561 (Series GMT960) |related=[[Buick Enclave]]
[[GMC Acadia]]
[[Saturn Outlook]] |engine=3.6 L “[[GM High Feature engine#LLT|LLT]]”  V6 |transmission=6-speed [[GM-Ford 6-speed automatic transmission|6T75]] [[automatic transmission|automatic]] |wheelbase={{convert|118.9|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} |length=2009-2012 models: {{convert|205.0|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}
2013-2017 models: 203.7 inches (5174 mm) |width={{convert|78.4|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} |height=2009 models: {{convert|69.7|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}
2010-2012 models: {{convert|70.4|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}
2013-2017 models: 72.8 inches (1849 mm) |weight=4700 lbs (2136 kg) }} ===2010=== On the LT models, the early 2010 update removed the "TRAVERSE" badges on the front doors. Beginning on late 2010 models, the GM logos were removed from the vehicle's front doors. === 2013 facelift === A [[facelift (automobile)|facelift]] of the Chevrolet Traverse was unveiled at the 2012 [[New York International Auto Show]]. The 2013 Traverse receives a new grille and front fascia, a redesigned rear liftgate, and reworked [[Camaro]]-inspired tail lights, and the transmission has been reworked for improved shift quality and timing. Pictures were released by GM on March 28, 2012. Chevrolet's new color [[touchscreen]] and [[MyLink]] [[radios]] are standard, as well as wood interior trim. Both [[cloth]] and [[leather]] seating surfaces will be available, depending on the model. Cloth is standard on the LS and 1LT models, and leather is standard on the LTZ. Both are available on the 2LT model. Some new wheels will be available, and models will continue to be offered in both [[front-wheel drive]] and [[all-wheel drive]] versions, ranging from the base LS to the top-of-the-line LTZ. Base price for the 2013 Traverse LS is at $30,510. A [[Bose Corporation|Bose]] audio system will be standard on 2LT and LTZ models.{{cite web|url=http://blogs.cars.com/kickingtires/2012/03/2013-chevrolet-traverse-at-2012-new-york-auto-show-.html#more |title=2013 Chevrolet Traverse at the 2012 New York Auto Show - KickingTires |publisher=Blogs.cars.com |date= |accessdate=2012-04-09}}{{cite web|author= John Neff RSS feed |url=http://www.autoblog.com/2012/03/28/2013-chevy-traverse-debuts-with-new-face-minor-tweaks/ |title=2013 Chevy Traverse debuts with new face, minor tweaks |publisher=Autoblog.com |date= |accessdate=2012-04-09}} ===2014=== While there were no cosmetic changes made for the 2014 model year, Chevrolet did add new features to the Traverse: Forward Collision Alert and Lane Departure Warning. Also, the audio system feature was updated, with a dual charge USB port now located at the rear of the center console.[http://gmauthority.com/blog/2013/06/2014-chevrolet-traverse-gets-one-new-feature-rpo-central/ "2014 Chevrolet Traverse Gets One New Feature: RPO Central"] from GM Authority (June 18, 2013) ===2015=== No cosmetic changes. Only two new features, a revised 18-inch wheel appearance and Siri Eyes Free, were added. Siren Red Tintcoat, Sable Metallic, and Blue Velvet Metallic became available as exterior colors, while Ebony/Saddle Up became available as an interior color option.[http://media.gm.com/media/us/en/chevrolet/vehicles/Traverse/2015.html 2015 Chevrolet Traverse] from GM Media (Posted August 2014) ===2016=== The 2016 Traverse received minor changes. The trim level were reduced to LS, LT1, LT2, and LTZ. New features include OnStar 4G LTE connectivity with Wi-Fi hotspot, Iridescent Pearl and Mosaic Black Metallic as color palettes, Leather and Driver Confidence Packages for the LT trims, and 20-inch aluminum wheel designs, painted and machined finishes. ===2017=== For the 2017 model year, the Traverse LTZ trim is renamed to Premier. However, most of the features from the 2016 model year Traverse had been carried over to the 2017 Traverse models. ===Safety=== {| class="wikitable" |+2016 Chevrolet Traverse on [[National Highway Traffic Safety Administration|NHTSA]]{{cite web|url=http://www.safercar.gov/Vehicle+Shoppers/5-Star+Safety+Ratings/2011-Newer+Vehicles/Vehicle-Detail?vehicleId=10053 |title=2016 Chevrolet Traverse SUV AWD |publisher=[[National Highway Traffic Safety Administration]] |accessdate=30 September 2015}} |- |Overall: |{{rating|5|5}} |- |Frontal Driver: |{{rating|5|5}} |- |Frontal Passenger: |{{rating|5|5}} |- |Side Driver: |{{rating|5|5}} |- |Side Passenger: |{{rating|5|5}} |- |Side Pole Driver: |{{rating|5|5}} |- |[[Vehicle rollover|Rollover]] AWD: |{{rating|4|5}} 15.5% |} {| class="wikitable" |+2015 Chevrolet Traverse on [[Insurance Institute for Highway Safety|IIHS]]:{{cite web|url=http://www.iihs.org/iihs/ratings/vehicle/v/chevrolet/traverse-4-door-suv?print-view |title=2015 Chevrolet Traverse Large SUV / 2008 GMC Acadia SLE 4-door 4wd |publisher=[[Insurance Institute for Highway Safety|IIHS]] |accessdate=30 September 2015}} ! Rating |- |Moderate overlap frontal offset |style="background: green"|Good |- |Small overlap frontal offset |style="background: grey"|Not tested1 |- |Side impact |style="background: green"|Good |- |Roof strength |style="background: green"|Good2 |} :1 vehicle structure rated "Good" :2 strength-to-weight ratio: 4.00 File:09 Chevrolet Traverse.jpg|Front File:2011 Chevrolet Traverse LS 3.6L rear 6.13.18.jpg|Rear File:Chevrolet Traverse LT 2014 (10193577664) (cropped).jpg|Front File:2015 Chevrolet Traverse LT 3.6L rear 6.9.18.jpg|Rear =={{anchor|2}} Second generation (2018–present)== {{Infobox automobile |name = Second generation |image = 2018 Chevrolet Traverse front 3.17.18.jpg |production = 2017–present |model_years = 2018–present |assembly = [[Lansing Delta Township Assembly]], [[Lansing, Michigan]] |platform = [[GM Epsilon platform#C1XX|C1XX]] |related =[[Buick Enclave#Second generation (2018–present)|Buick Enclave]]
[[Cadillac XT6]]
[[GMC Acadia#Second generation (2017–present)|GMC Acadia]] |engine = {{unbulleted list| 3.6 L ''[[GM High Feature engine#LFY|LFY]]'' [[V6 engine|V6]] ([[gasoline]]) | 2.0 L ''[[GM Ecotec engine#LTG|LTG]]'' turbo [[I4 engine|I4]] ([[gasoline]]) (RS 2WD) }} (2017-2019 models) |transmission = 9-speed 9T65 [[automatic transmission|automatic]] |wheelbase={{convert|3071|mm|in|1|abbr=on|order=flip}} |length = {{convert|204.3|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} |width = {{convert|78.6|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} |height = {{convert|70.7|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} |weight =≥ {{convert|4,362|lbs|kg|0|abbr=on}} }} [[File:2018 Chevrolet Traverse rear 3.15.18.jpg|thumb|left|Rear]] On January 9, 2017, General Motors unveiled the second generation Traverse at the 2017 [[North American International Auto Show]] in [[Detroit]]. Introduced as a 2018 model, it went on sale in July 2017.[http://www.autoblog.com/2017/01/09/2018-chevy-traverse-crossover-detroit/ "The 2018 Chevy Traverse is roomier and looks stronger"] from Autoblog (January 9, 2017) While Chevrolet is making the vehicle available in North America, plans include expanding the Traverse to the Middle East, and selected South American countries.[http://gmauthority.com/blog/gm/chevrolet/traverse/2018-chevrolet-traverse/ 2018 Chevrolet Traverse information, specs, details] from GM Authority (January 31, 2017) The Traverse was launched to the Russian market in 2018,{{cite web |url=https://wroom.ru/news/7551 |title=Объявлены российские цены большого кроссовера Chevrolet Traverse |author= |date=4 April 2018 |website=Wroom.ru |publisher= |access-date=4 April 2018 |quote=}} and was sold in [[South Korea]] in the second half of 2019, where it is touted as a "Super SUV" and its largest Crossover SUV in that region.[http://gmauthority.com/blog/2019/09/gm-launches-chevrolet-traverse-in-south-korea/ "GM Launches Chevrolet Traverse in South Korea"] from GM Authority (September 26, 2019)[http://gmauthority.com/blog/2018/06/chevrolet-traverse-heading-to-south-korea/ “Chevrolet Traverse Heading To South Korea”] from GM Authority (June 29, 2018)[http://gmauthority.com/blog/2019/04/gm-to-launch-chevrolet-traverse-colorado-in-korea/ "GM to Launch Chevrolet Traverse, Colorado, In Korea"] from GM Authority (April 5, 2019) The updated Traverse abandoned the egg-shaped design and now adopts a more truck-like design, similar to the [[Chevrolet Tahoe|Tahoe]], while taking some cues from the now mid-size Acadia, with the Chevrolet front grille design. It is similar in dimension to the first generation model, adding an extra 2.0 inches of wheelbase and 0.7 inch more overall length, and it loses {{convert|111|lb|kg}} to come in at a weight of {{convert|4362|lb|kg}}. It remains an 8-seat (or 7-seat optional) passenger vehicle. As part of GM's plans to expand its range of crossovers by size in order to be competitive within the segments, Chevrolet re-positioned the Traverse as a full-size crossover SUV this time around due to the launch of the mid-size [[Chevrolet Blazer (crossover)|Blazer]] that debuted in 2019.[https://www.autoblog.com/2018/02/28/chevy-blazer-midsize-suv-spy-photos/#slide-7259783 Is this a new Blazer? Chevy midsize SUV spied inside and out] from Autoblog (March 1, 2018)[http://gmauthority.com/blog/2018/04/2019-blazer-spy-shots-show-new-chevy-crossover-will-be-very-similar-to-gmc-acadia/ “Spy Shots Show New Chevy Crossover Will Be Similar To GMC Acadia”] from GM Authority (April 5, 2018) There are 5 trim levels available for the 2nd generation Traverse: L, LS, LT, Premier, and High Country (see below for trim level content). All the trim levels are available in either Front Wheel Drive (FWD) or All Wheel Drive (AWD) drive type configurations except for the L trim level which is only available in FWD and the High Country trim level which is only available in AWD. In an addition, there are 2 types of AWD system available for this generation of Traverse: the standard AWD system that allows user to disconnect the prop-shaft until rear traction is needed and the twin-clutch Twinster version (available only with High Country trim) with two rear clutches to more directly apply torque to the rear wheel that needs it most, both are developed by [[GKN Driveline]].{{cite web|url=http://www.motortrend.com/cars/chevrolet/traverse/2018/2018-chevrolet-traverse-first-look-going-truckier-look/ |title=2018 CHEVROLET TRAVERSE FIRST LOOK: GOING FOR A TRUCKIER LOOK |author=Priddle, Alisa |date=8 January 2017 |website=Motortrend.com |publisher=MotorTrend Magazine |access-date=12 April 2018 }} At introductory period, the new 310-horsepower 3.6L V6 gasoline engine will be the only available engine option, mated to a nine-speed automatic transmission with either Front Wheel Drive or All Wheel Drive. Additionally, a turbocharged four-cylinder engine will also become available in early 2018 with the introduction of the RS model. The new Traverse gains some new technology, some of which is currently available on other models such as the [[Chevrolet Equinox]], [[Chevrolet Tahoe]], and [[Chevrolet Suburban]]. Some of this technology includes: a hands-free power tailgate, the latest-generation [[Chevrolet]] [[MyLink]] infotainment systems with standard [[Apple CarPlay]] and [[Android Auto]], a power-folding 60/40 split third-row rear bench seat, and standard keyless access with push-button start. === Trim levels === The second-generation Chevrolet Traverse is offered in several different trim levels (all of which are available in [[front-wheel drive]] (FWD) or [[all-wheel drive]] (AWD), except for the base L, which is only available with FWD, and the top-of-the-line High Country, which is only available with AWD), and each offering their own distinct level of standard equipment:{{cite web|url=https://www.chevrolet.com/suvs/traverse-mid-size-suv/build-and-price/trim|title=Traverse for Sale: 2019 Traverse Pricing - Chevrolet|website=www.chevrolet.com|accessdate=27 June 2019}} '''L''': The L is the least expensive trim level of the Traverse. It offers the following standard equipment: a 3.6L V6 gasoline engine with Stop-Start Technology, a nine-speed automatic transmission, a dual-outlet exhaust system, Traction Mode Select, StabiliTrak Electronic Stability and Traction Control System, dual frontal and front and rear SRS side-impact airbags, tire pressure monitoring system with Tire Fill Alert, [[OnStar]], LATCH system for rear child safety seats, Teen Driver Technology, a rear vision camera, LED daytime running lamps, High-Intensity Discharge (HID) headlamps, black power-adjustable and manually-folding exterior side view mirrors, exterior color-keyed door handles, a seven-inch [[Chevrolet]] [[MyLink]] infotainment system with [[Apple CarPlay]] and [[Android Auto]], Bluetooth with streaming audio, steering wheel-mounted audio system controls, six standard USB ports, a driver information center with a 3.5-inch monochrome display screen, a digital compass, keyless access with push-button start, a tri-zone automatic climate control system, interior lighting with theater dimming, premium cloth seating surfaces, eight-passenger seating, and ten standard cup holders. '''LS''': The LS is the second least expensive trim level of the Traverse. It adds deep-tinted glass and optional AWD to the base L. '''LT Cloth''': The LT Cloth adds comfort and convenience features to the LS, such as: eighteen-inch Bright Silver-finished aluminum-alloy wheels, exterior color-keyed heated, power-adjustable, and manually-folding exterior side view mirrors, front fog lamps, roof rails, [[SiriusXM]] Satellite Radio, seven-passenger seating with second-row rear captain's chairs, an eight-way, power-adjustable front driver's bucket seat with power lumbar support, a three-spoke, leather-wrapped steering wheel, and power windows with front driver's express up/down and front passenger's express up functionality. '''LT Leather''': The LT Leather adds luxury features to the LT Cloth, such as: Surround Vision with Bird's-Eye View, side blind zone and rear cross-traffic alert, rear park assist, twenty-inch machined aluminum-alloy wheels, an eight-inch Chevrolet MyLink infotainment system with GPS navigation, Apple CarPlay, and Android Auto, a ten-speaker [[Bose Corporation|Bose]] premium audio system, leather-trimmed seating surfaces, an enhanced driver information center with a 4.2-inch color display, a six-way, power-adjustable front passenger's bucket seat with power lumbar support, heated dual front bucket seats, a 120-volt AC rear power outlet, and HomeLink. '''Premier''': The Premier is the "luxury" model of the Traverse, and adds the following features to the LT Leather: a dual-outlet exhaust system with rectangular exhaust tips, LED "D-Optic" projector-beam front headlamps, exterior color-keyed, power-adjustable, heated manually-folding exterior side view mirrors, exterior color-keyed body side molding with chrome inserts, chrome exterior door handles, twenty-inch Argent Metallic-finished aluminum-alloy wheels, a hands-free power tailgate with Chevrolet emblem projection, a driver's memory system, a power tilt-and-telescopic steering column, a heated leather-wrapped steering wheel, perforated leather-trimmed seating surfaces with heated and ventilated dual front bucket seats, heated second-row rear captain's chairs, and wireless charging for compatible devices. '''High Country''': The High Country is the top-of-the-line Traverse trim level, and adds the following features to the Premier, such as: standard All Wheel Drive, a tow package, IntelliBeam automatic front high beam assist, forward collision warning and lane departure warning, adaptive cruise control with autonomous emergency braking, twenty-inch polished aluminum-alloy wheels, a SkyScape panoramic moonroof, and a power-folding third-row 60/40 split rear bench seat. There are also two appearance packages available on the 2nd generation Traverse: '''RS''': Based on the LT trim with leather seating adds black bowties, Black Ice grille and foglamp bezel, 20 inch Dark Android-painted aluminum wheels, Gloss Black window trims, and Black roof rails. The RS also has a turbocharged four-cylinder engine instead of the 3.6L V6 gasoline engine vs other trim levels. Beginning mid-way through the 2019 model year, the 3.6L V6 gasoline engine will be standard on all trim levels as the turbocharged four-cylinder engine (exclusive to the RS trim level) will be discontinued. '''Redline Edition''': Available on the Premier in the following exterior colors only (Iridescent Pearl Tricoat, Mosaic Black Metallic, Silver Ice Metallic, and Summit White), adds Driver Confidence II package, dual SkyScape panoramic moonroof, black-chromed mirrorcaps and door handles, 20 inch gloss black wheels with red stripes, black bowties with red and black badging, Black Ice grille and foglamp bezel, gloss black window trim, black roof rails, smoked dark tailamps, and black-painted lower moldings with black ice inserts.[http://gmauthority.com/blog/2017/02/2018-chevrolet-traverse-revs-up-with-redline-edition/ "2018 Chevrolet Traverse Revs Up With Redline Edition"] from GM Authority (February 9, 2017) At time of introduction, the 2018 Chevrolet Traverse is available exclusively with a 3.6L V6 gasoline engine with Stop-Start technology, and a nine-speed automatic transmission. Future engine and transmission options (one of which includes a turbocharged four-cylinder engine) may become available for the Traverse in the future. The '''RS Model''' will also be available after introduction, based on one of the LT trim levels, as will a new '''Redline Edition''' based on the Premier trim level (see above for appearance package content). ===MY 2019=== There were no major changes. The Saddle Brown Metallic color will be replaced by Havana Brown Metallic and the Roadside Assistance package is available on all trim levels. The Blackout Package is added as an available option on LS, LT, and Premier trim levels. The 2019 model year Traverse will also be the final year that the 2.0L I-4 LTG turbo engine is being offered for this vehicle.[http://gmauthority.com/blog/2019/04/gm-discontinues-2-0l-turbo-engine-in-chevrolet-traverse/ “GM Discontinues 2.0L Turbo Engine In Chevrolet Traverse”] from GM Authority (April 21, 2019) ===MY 2020=== The 2.0L I-4 LTG turbo engine (which is exclusive on the RS trim level) will be discontinued for the 2020 model year (starting midway through the 2019 model year) and will be replaced by a 3.6L V6 gasoline engine which is already standard on other trim levels. Also the MyLink system will be replaced by Infotainment 3 system and buckle-to-drive feature will also be added to the teen driver system standard on all trim levels.https://cars.usnews.com/cars-trucks/chevrolet/traverse Three new colors (Stone Gray Metallic, Black Cherry Metallic, and Midnight Blue Metallic) were also added to the color palette for the 2020 model year.https://www.chevrolet.com/suvs/traverse ===2021 refresh=== For the 2021 model year, Chevrolet gave the Traverse a refreshed look, adopting a grille similar to the Suburban/Tahoe, and featuring thin LED headlights and taillights, and new daytime running lights with integrated LED turn signals. Also new are interior seating options, wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto, and a new available eight-inch infotainment display. Several safety features are now standard: Automatic Emergency Braking, Front Pedestrian Braking, Forward Collision Alert, Lane Keep Assist with Lane Departure Warning, IntelliBeam auto high beams, and a Following Distance Indicator. Advanced Adaptive Cruise Control is added to the 3LT, RS and Premier trims, while GM's Safety Alert Seat is now standard on Premier and High Country models. These changes were based on feedback from consumers. The 2021 Traverse will go on sale in late 2020.[https://gmauthority.com/blog/2020/03/refreshed-2021-chevrolet-traverse-makes-official-debut/ “Refreshed 2021 Chevrolet Traverse Makes Official Debut”] from GM Authority (March 13, 2020) The 2021 Traverse is expected to retain the 3.6-litre V6 gasoline engine from the outgoing model with a 9-speed automatic transmission.{{cite web|url=https://www.autodevot.com/2020/03/2021-chevrolet-traverse-refreshed-safety-tech/|title=Chevrolet Traverse gets refreshed with safety tech|website=www.autodevot.com|accessdate=18 March 2020}} {{clear}} == Sales in the United States == {| class="wikitable" |- ! {{short description|subcompact SUV}} {{For|the 2007 [[concept car]]|Chevrolet Trax (concept car)}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2019}} {{Infobox automobile | image = 2013 Chevrolet Trax 1.7 Automatic.jpg | name = Chevrolet Trax | manufacturer = [[General Motors]] | class = [[Subcompact]] [[crossover SUV]] | production = 2012–present | aka = [[Holden Trax]] ([[Oceania]])

[[Suzuki Ignis#Chevrolet Cruze|Chevrolet/Holden Cruze]] (for Suzuki Ignis rebadges, Australasia) | successor = [[Chevrolet Tracker (China)|Chevrolet Tracker]] (China) | length = {{convert|4248|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} - {{convert|4280|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | width = {{convert|1766|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} - {{convert|1775|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | height = {{convert|1674|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | body_style = 5-door [[SUV]] | platform = [[GM Gamma platform|Gamma II platform]] | layout = [[FF layout]], [[F4 layout]] | related = [[Opel Mokka]]
[[Buick Encore]]

[[San Luis Potosí, San Luis Potosí]], [[México]] ([[San Luis Potosí Assembly]])
Shanghai, China ([[SAIC-GM]], from 2014 to 2020)
Asaka, Uzbekistan ([[GM Uzbekistan]], from 2018-present) }} The '''Chevrolet Trax''' is a [[subcompact]] [[crossover SUV]] manufactured by [[Chevrolet]] since 2013. The car is based on the [[GM Gamma platform|GM Gamma II platform]], which is shared with the [[Chevrolet Aveo|Chevrolet Aveo/Sonic]], as well as the [[Opel Mokka|Opel Mokka/Buick Encore]]. ==History== [[File:Chevrolet Trax LS+ 1.4 4WD – Heckansicht, 11. August 2013, Wuppertal.jpg|thumb|left|Chevrolet Trax LS+ (Germany; pre-facelift)]] ===2012=== The concept was first unveiled at the [[2012 Paris Motor Show]], with the final model unveil having happened at the 2013 North American International Auto Show. It was then available for test driving at the 2013 [[Montreal Auto Show]], with four essay models shown. ===2013=== During 2013 and early 2014, it was only sold in Canada, Mexico, Germany, South Korea, [[Lebanon]], [[United Arab Emirates]] and Europe. It was also marketed as the '''[[Holden]] Trax''' in Australia, and as the '''[[Chevrolet Tracker]]''' in Russia and South America. In Canada, the Trax was the first compact Chevrolet crossover SUV since the discontinuation of the Tracker (read below).[http://www.gm.ca/gm/english/vehicles/chevrolet/trax/feature-2013-Chevrolet-Trax 2013 Chevrolet Trax – GM Canada] The vehicle started shipping on April 2, however pre-sales began as early as the fourth quarter of 2012 for both Mexico (1.8L) and Canada (1.4L Turbo).[http://blog.caranddriver.com/chevrolet-trax-to-join-global-lineup-will-debut-in-paris/ Chevrolet Trax to join global lineup, will debut in Paris] – [[Car & Driver]] (Retrieved 2012-05-15) Korean sales started at late February 2013. ===2014=== In late 2014, the Trax was marketed to more countries adding China, [[Indonesia]] and [[Philippines|the Philippines]]. ===2015=== The Trax came to the United States as a 2015 model, buoyed by the success of the [[Buick Encore]] (the Trax and Encore share the GM Gamma II platform) and possible competition from the [[Jeep Renegade (BU)|Jeep Renegade]].{{cite news|last=Colias|first=Mike|title=Chevy enters small crossover segment with the Trax|url=http://www.autonews.com/article/20140415/OEM04/140419889/chevy-enters-small-crossover-segment-with-the-trax?cciid=email-autonews-blast&r=1916C1413689E1U|accessdate=April 15, 2014|newspaper=Automotive News|date=April 15, 2014}} The US-market Trax is largely unchanged from the global version, but has some US-specific features including [[OnStar]] with [[AT&T Mobility|AT&T]] 4G [[LTE (telecommunication)|LTE]] and [[SiriusXM]] satellite radio. The US version is powered by the 1.4-liter turbocharged inline-4 with {{convert|138|bhp|kW PS|0|abbr=on}} at 4,900 rpm and {{convert|148|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} at 1,850 rpm. Trailer towing is not recommended. Only the 6-speed automatic transmission is available. Three trim levels, both available with front-wheel-drive and all-wheel-drive, are available: LS, LT and LTZ. Standard features on all trims include air conditioning; power windows; split-folding rear seat; tilting and telescoping steering-wheel; ABS; ESP; front, front and rear side, side-curtain airbags, and knee airbags; tire-pressure monitor; emergency communication system and parking assist. ===2017 facelift=== [[File:2018 Chevrolet Trax LT 1.4L front 3.15.19.jpg|thumb|left|MY17 facelift]] [[File:2018 Chevrolet Trax LT 1.4L rear 3.15.19.jpg|thumb|right|MY17 facelift]] Chevrolet performed a mid-cycle update on the Trax for the 2017 model year, first unveiled at the 2016 [[Chicago Auto Show]] on February 12, 2016.{{cite web|url=http://gmauthority.com/blog/2016/02/hot-or-not-2017-chevrolet-trax/|title=Hot Or Not: 2017 Chevrolet Trax|last=Szymkowski|first=Sean|work=GM Authority|date=February 12, 2016|accessdate=February 13, 2016}} The updated Trax carried Chevrolet's Corvette-inspired design cues from the [[Chevrolet Malibu|Malibu]] and [[Chevrolet Volt|Volt]], including new halogen projector headlights, LED daytime running lights, dual taillights and a new grille design. A set of 18-inch aluminum wheels are offered on the Premier model trim. The interior is also redesigned with a new dashboard and center instrument panel. Overall, the 2017 facelift improves the Trax's perceived quality.http://motoringuru.com.au/car-reviews/2017-holden-trax-lt-review/ The 2017 Trax went on sale in the fall of 2016.{{cite web|url=http://gmauthority.com/blog/gm/chevrolet/trax/2017-trax/|title=2017 Chevrolet Trax|work=GM Authority|accessdate=February 13, 2016}} {{clear left}} ===Continuation in North America=== The Trax will continue unchanged for the 2020 model year in North America. While a replacement was expected, it will instead be joined by a slightly larger model, the [[Chevrolet Trailblazer (crossover)|TrailBlazer]] (no relation to the previous North American or international mid-sized SUVs of the same name). Debuting in early 2020 for the 2021 model year, it will slot between the Trax and Equinox in Chevrolet's small SUV lineup.https://autoweek.com/article/family/2021-chevrolet-trailblazer-here-tread-trails-blazer-too-big-take On March 2, 2020, Chevrolet confirmed that the Trax will return for the 2021 model year, but will see the Premier level deleted from the offering trims.[https://gmauthority.com/blog/2020/03/chevrolet-trax-to-stick-around-for-2021-model-year-with-changes/ “Chevrolet Trax To Stick Around For 2021 Model Year With Changes”] from GM Authority (March 2, 2020) In China, the Trax was replaced by the new [[Chevrolet Tracker (China)|Tracker]] in 2019. It is the same size as the Trax, but built on a new platform (GEM) for emerging markets and not intended for North America. ==Name variations== ===Holden Trax (2013–2020)=== In Australia and the overall [[Oceania]] market, the Chevrolet Trax is offered under the [[Holden]] brand, as Holden is the Australian GM subsidiary. It went on sale in 2013. ===Chevrolet Tracker=== In Russia and South America, the Trax is instead named the '''Chevrolet Tracker''', which was the name used in [[North America|North]] and [[Latin America]] from 1989–1991 and 1999–2008 for a Chevrolet/Geo version of the [[Suzuki Sidekick]]. File:2014 Holden Trax (TJ MY14) LTZ wagon (2015-07-09) 01.jpg|2014 Holden Trax LTZ File:2017 Holden Trax (TJ MY18) LS wagon (2018-10-22) 01.jpg|2017 Holden Trax LS ==Engines== The Trax is offered in different markets with different choices of drivetrains. In Latin America the Trax is only available with the 1.8 liter gasoline engine. In Canada and the US, only the 1.4 liter turbocharged gasoline engine is offered. In Mexico and Australia (from 2015) it is available both in 1.8 liter and 1.4 liter turbocharged engines. European customers can choose between the 1.4 liter turbo gasoline engine, a 1.6 liter gasoline engine, and a 1.7 liter diesel engine. {| class = "wikitable" cellpadding = "0" style |- ! colspan = "5;" style = "background:#e8e8e8;" | Gasoline |- ! style = "background:#e8e8e8;" | Type ! style = "background:#e8e8e8;" | Power ! style = "background:#e8e8e8;" | Torque ! style = "background:#e8e8e8;" | Emissions {{co2}} ! style = "background:#e8e8e8;" | Years |- |{{convert|1364|cc|cuin|1|abbr=on}} I4 turbo ([[GM Family 0 engine#Turbo|A14NET]]) || {{convert|140|PS|kW bhp|0|abbr=on}} at 4,900 rpm ||{{convert|200|Nm|lbft|0|abbr=on}} at 1,850–4,900 rpm || 139 g/km || 2013– |- |{{convert|1598|cc|cuin|1|abbr=on}} I4 ([[GM Family 1 engine#DCVCP|A16XER]]) ||{{convert|115|PS|kW bhp|0|abbr=on}} at 6,000 rpm ||{{convert|155|Nm|lbft|0|abbr=on}} at 4,000 rpm || 153 g/km ||2013– |- |{{convert|1796 |cc|cuin|1|abbr=on}} I4 ([[GM Family 1 engine#DCVCP|A18XER]]) ||{{convert|140|PS|kW bhp|0|abbr=on}} at 6,300 rpm ||{{convert|175|Nm|lbft|0|abbr=on}} at 3,800 rpm || n/a ||2013– |-
! colspan = "5;" style = "background:#e8e8e8;" | Diesel |- ! style = "background:#e8e8e8;" | Type ! style = "background:#e8e8e8;" | Power ! style = "background:#e8e8e8;" | Torque ! style = "background:#e8e8e8;" | Emissions {{co2}} ! style = "background:#e8e8e8;" | Years |- |{{convert|1686|cc|cuin|1|abbr=on}} I4 turbo ([[Circle L engine|CDTI]])||{{convert|130|PS|kW bhp|0|abbr=on}}at 4,000 rpm ||{{convert|300|Nm|lbft|0|abbr=on}} at 2,000–2,500 rpm || 120 g/km || 2013–2014 |- |{{convert|1598|cc|cuin|1|abbr=on}} I4 turbo ([[GM Medium diesel engine|CDTI]])(Korea)||{{convert|136|PS|kW hp|0|abbr=on}} at 3500-4000 rpm||{{convert|320|Nm|lbft|0|abbr=on}} at 2000–2250 rpm|| 129 g/km ||2015– |- |} ==Production== The Trax is being produced by both GM Korea and General Motors Mexico for most global markets. [[Shanghai GM]] will also be producing the model for the Chinese market from the 2015 model year onward. GM Uzbekistan will also be producing this model, starting from the end of 2018. ==Marketing== The Trax is positioned below the [[compact car|compact]] [[Chevrolet Equinox]] and [[Chevrolet Captiva]] (depending on country) in the current Chevrolet line-up. In Europe, some dealers started branding it as a "compact SUV". However, in Canada, where the [[Chevrolet Orlando]] is positioned as "mid-size CUV" and the Equinox is the "compact CUV", the Trax is branded as "subcompact CUV" instead. ==Sales== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! revision.text:
{{Unreferenced|date=July 2012}} {{Infobox automobile | name ='''Chevrolet Chevy Malibu''' | production = 1968-1982 | manufacturer = [[Chevrolet]] ([[General Motors]]) | assembly = [[San Martín(Buenos Aires)|San Martín]],
[[Buenos Aires]], Argentina | Type = [[Passenger car]] | class = [[Executive car]] | body_style = [[Sedan (automobile)|sedan]] four doors. | layout = Front engine, rear-wheel drive | related = [[Chevrolet Nova]] }} The '''Chevrolet Chevy Malibu''' was a [[compact car]] made by [[Chevrolet]] in Argentina from 1968 to 1982. Successor to the [[Chevrolet 400]], the Chevy Malibu offered a more modern body style with better safety features and updated mechanicals. The car was based on the U.S. market 1968 Chevy II Nova. Only the 4-door sedan version was manufactured in the country, although U.S. versions included a two door coupe in addition to the sedan. ==History== Although the Chevy 400 sold well in the Argentine market, General Motors decided on offering an updated model with more modern styling and up-to-date mechanicals. The Chevy 400 was based on the 1962 Chevy II, and by 1968, was already out of date. While the equivalent U.S. Market Chevy Nova featured changes in safety and emissions equipment during its relatively short 1968-1974 run (it had a total restyle for 1975), the Argentina version retained the 1968 car's features throughout its entire run, including a dash-mounted ignition switch and smaller side marker lights. {{Chevrolet cars timeline 1950-1979}} [[Category:Chevrolet vehicles|Chevy Malibu]]

{{Use mdy dates|date=June 2019}} {{Infobox automobile | name = Chevrolet Spin | image = 2013 Chevrolet Spin 1.5 LTZ (20190616).jpg | manufacturer = [[General Motors]] | production = 2012–present | assembly = [[São Caetano do Sul]], [[Brazil]] ([[GM do Brasil]])
[[Bekasi]], [[Indonesia]] (February 2013-June 2015) | class = [[Mini MPV]] | body_style = 5-door [[multi-purpose vehicle|MPV]] | platform = [[GM Gamma platform|GM Gamma II platform]] | engine = 1.2 L ''[[GM Family 0 engine#Generation III|Family 0]]'' [[Straight-4|I4]] ([[petrol engine|petrol]], Indonesia)
1.5 L ''[[Daewoo S-TEC engine#S-TEC III|S-TEC III]]'' [[Straight-4|I4]] ([[petrol engine|petrol]], Indonesia)
1.8 L ''[[GM Family 1 engine#N18XFH|N18XFH]]'' [[Straight-4|I4]] ([[petrol engine|petrol]]/[[ethanol]], Brazil)
1.3 L ''[[JTD engine#1.3 Multijet|SDE]]'' [[Straight-4|I4]] ([[Turbo-diesel engine|diesel]], Indonesia) | transmission = 5-speed [[manual transmission|manual]]
6-speed [[automatic transmission|automatic]] | wheelbase = {{Convert|2620|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | length = {{Convert|4360|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | width = {{Convert|1735|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | height = {{Convert|1664|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | predecessor = {{ubl |[[Opel Meriva#Meriva A|Chevrolet Meriva]]|[[Opel Zafira|Chevrolet Zafira]]|[[Chevrolet Tavera]] (Indonesia)}} [[Daewoo Tacuma]] | successor = [[Wuling Hongguang S1|Wuling Confero]] (Indonesia) | related = [[Chevrolet Agile]]
[[Chevrolet Onix]]
[[Chevrolet Montana]] | designer = Matt Noone (exterior)
Dagoberto Tribia (interior) }} '''Chevrolet Spin''' is a [[mini MPV]] engineered and produced by [[Chevrolet]] in Brazil since 2012 and in Indonesia. GM announced in 2012 that it will market the car globally in developing countries and assemble it also at [[General Motors|GM Autoworld Indonesia]]'s [[Bekasi]], [[West Java]], plant. Production in Indonesia has started in February 2013. In February 2015, GM announced they will close the Bekasi plant by the end of June due to slow sales of the Spin. It was subsequently replaced in the Indonesian market by the Wuling Confero / [[Wuling Hongguang S1]]{{cite web |url=http://paultan.org/2015/02/27/general-motors-close-indonesia-plant/ |title=General Motors to close Indonesian plant in June, stop Chevrolet Sonic production in Thailand |author=Tan, Jonathan James |publisher=[[Paul Tan|paultan.org]] |date=February 28, 2015 |accessdate=March 2, 2015}} The Spin was also produced since 2012 at the [[General Motors do Brasil]] plant in [[São Caetano do Sul]], Brazil. ==Markets== ===Indonesia=== As of 2014, Spin for the Indonesian market consisted of 3 models depends on engine type and displacement. The three models were :{{Cite web |url=http://www.chevrolet.co.id/cars/spin/features-and-specs/models-specs.html |title=Archived copy |access-date=February 11, 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150211063151/http://www.chevrolet.co.id/cars/spin/features-and-specs/models-specs.html |archive-date=February 11, 2015 |url-status=dead }} * The 1.2l Gasoline engine model came with 2 trims, LS and LT, available in 5 speed manual transmission only * The 1.3l Turbocharged Diesel engine model also had 2 trims, LT and LTZ, also with manual transmission only * The 1.5l Gasoline engine had more trims than others : 4 trims (LS, LT, LTZ and Activ) available in manual and 6 speed automatic transmission. The Indonesian version offered 7 seats and third row ventilation in all models. On April 2014, General Motors Indonesia introduced a new trim in the 1.5l model, called Activ, only available with automatic transmission. Based on the LTZ trim, the Activ added new design elements like a larger front bumper with skid guards, 16-inch alloy wheels, roof rails, black plastic cladding for the lower part of the front and rear bumpers with silver skid plates, silver inserts for the side lower body and reflectors on the rear bumper, with ‘Activ’ embossed on it.http://indianautosblog.com/2014/11/chevrolet-spin-activ-crossover-in-images-156783 The car received black body paneling, and smoked headlamps were also part of the package. Inside, The full black interior color theme, was fitted with dual airbags and the steering gained audio controls.http://indianautosblog.com/2014/04/chevrolet-spin-activ-128085 ===Brazil=== [[File:Silver chevrolet spin.JPG|thumb|left|Rear view]] In Brazil, the Spin replaced the [[Chevrolet Meriva|Meriva]] as [[GM do Brasil]] phased out the [[badge engineering]] of Opels as Chevrolets and vice versa. While the original '''Meriva A''' was developed jointly by GM do Brasil and Opel, the second generation [[Opel Meriva#Meriva B (2010–present)|'''Meriva B''']] had been developed exclusively by Opel and marketed only as Opel and [[Vauxhall Motors|Vauxhall]]. The LTZ trim of the Spin offered seven seats, and could thus also replace in Brasil the [[Chevrolet Zafira|Zafira]], whose global successor was split between [[Opel Zafira#Zafira Tourer C (2011–present)|Zafira]] and [[Chevrolet Orlando|Orlando]], both being based on the [[GM Delta II platform|GM's global Delta II platform]]. The Brazilian market received the Activ trim in November 2014; the differences from the Indonesian Activ were an exposed spare wheel and 1.8-liter EconoFlex engine capable of 108 bhp and 171 Nm of torque.http://indianautosblog.com/2014/11/chevrolet-spin-activ-crossover-in-images-156783 == Sales == {| class=wikitable style="text-align: right;" |- ! Calendar Year ! Thailand ! Indonesia |- | 2013 | | 10,941http://files.gaikindo.or.id/ |- | 2014 | 1,131{{cite web |url=http://www.headlightmag.com/salesreport_total2014/ |title=Thailand cars sales report 2014 |work=HeadlightMag.com |location=Thailand |access-date=October 24, 2018}} | 7,475http://files.gaikindo.or.id/ |- | 2015 | 728{{cite web |url=http://www.headlightmag.com/salesreport_total2015/ [[List of General Motors factories#Closed or sold factories|GM Belgium]], [[Antwerp, Belgium]] | predecessor = [[Chevrolet Series AC International]] | successor = [[Chevrolet Series AE Independence]] | class = | body_style = 2-door [[coupe]]
2-door [[Roadster (automobile)|roadster]]
4-door [[Coach (carriage)|coach]]
2-door [[van]] | layout = [[FR layout]] | platform = [[GM A platform]] | engine = {{convert|194|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} 6-cylinder | transmission = | wheelbase = {{convert|107|in|mm|1|abbr=on}} | length = | width = | height = | weight = {{convert|2195|-|2625|lb|kg|0|abbr=on}} | related = [[Oakland (automobile)|Oakland]]
[[Pontiac]] | designer = | sp = us }} The '''Chevrolet Series AD Universal ''' or '''Chevrolet Universal AD''' is a [[Chevrolet]] car which began sales in 1930. Available in a variety of body types including as a 2-door coupe, 4-door sedan and a delivery van. ==History== [[File:1930 Chevrolet Wrecker.jpg|thumb|left|1930 Chevrolet Truck]] The Series AD was launched as replacement for the 1929 Series AC models. Sales dropped by over 200,000 to 640,980 vehicles for the year.{{cite web|title=1930 Chevrolet Series AD Universal|url=http://auto.howstuffworks.com/1930-chevrolet-series-ad-universal.htm|work=How Stuff Works|accessdate=3 January 2013}} The AD retained the new "stovebolt" {{Convert|194|CID|L|1}} [[Chevrolet straight-6 engine|six-cylinder engine]] from the Series AC, but with bigger intake valves and smaller exhaust valves, along with a new manifold, raised power from {{convert|46|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} to {{convert|50|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}}. The suspension now included hydraulic shock absorbers and the fuel gauge was moved from the tank to the dash panel. ==References== {{reflist}} {{commonscat|1930 Chevrolet automobiles}} {{commonscat|Chevrolet trucks}} {{commonscat|GMC trucks}} {{Chevrolet Vehicles}} [[Category:Chevrolet vehicles|Series AD Universal]] [[Category:Vehicles introduced in 1930]] [[Category:1930s cars]] [[Category:Rear-wheel-drive vehicles]]

[[List of General Motors factories#Closed or sold factories|GM Belgium]], [[Antwerp, Belgium]] | predecessor = [[Chevrolet Series AB National]] | successor = [[Chevrolet Series AD Universal]] | class = | body_style = | layout = | platform = [[GM A platform]] | engine = {{convert|194|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} 6-cylinder | transmission = 3-speed manual | wheelbase = {{convert|107|in|mm|1|abbr=on}} | length = | width = | height = | weight = {{convert|2175|-|2585|lb|kg|0|abbr=on}} | related = [[Oakland (automobile)|Oakland]]
[[Pontiac]] | designer = | sp = us }} The '''Chevrolet Series AC International''' is an American vehicle manufactured by [[Chevrolet]] in 1929 to replace the 1928 [[Chevrolet Series AB National|Series AB National]]. In all, 847,053 Series ACs were manufactured in a range of ten body styles. The Series AC was the first six-cylinder engine from Chevrolet since 1915, and was advertised as "A Six in the price range of the Four", and was only $10 more than the outgoing four-cylinder Series AB (Around $146 today, accounting for inflation).{{cite web|title=1929 Chevrolet Series AC International|url=http://auto.howstuffworks.com/1929-chevrolet-series-ac-international.htm|work=How Stuff Works|accessdate=3 January 2013}} ==Specification== [[File:1929 Chevrolet LQ Series flat bed truck (1).jpg|thumb|left|1929 Chevrolet truck]] The Series AC was powered by Chevrolet's new {{convert|194|cuin|cc|abbr=on}} [[Chevrolet straight-6 engine|six-cylinder engine]], producing {{convert|46|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} @ 2400 rpm. The engine became known as the "Stovebolt Six".{{cite web|title=Chevrolet "Stovebolt" Six|url=http://www.drivingtoday.com/greatest_cars/stovebolt/index.html#.UOXAHKVKorg|work=Driving Today|accessdate=3 January 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120208052329/http://www.drivingtoday.com/greatest_cars/stovebolt/index.html#.UOXAHKVKorg|archive-date=8 February 2012|url-status=dead}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{commonscat|1929 Chevrolet automobiles}} {{commonscat|Chevrolet trucks}} {{commonscat|GMC trucks}} {{Chevrolet Vehicles}} [[Category:Chevrolet vehicles|Series AC International]] [[Category:Vehicles introduced in 1929]] [[Category:1920s cars]]

[[List of General Motors factories#Closed or sold factories|GM Belgium]], [[Antwerp, Belgium]] [[ Holden Coach Bodies,Woodville,South Australia]] | predecessor = [[Chevrolet Series AA Capitol]] | successor = [[Chevrolet Series AC International]] | class = | body_style = | layout = | platform = [[GM A platform]] | engine = {{convert|171|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} 4-cylinder | transmission = 3-speed manual | wheelbase = {{convert|107|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} | length = | width = | height = | weight = {{convert|2030|-|2435|lb|kg|0|abbr=on}} | related = [[Oakland (automobile)|Oakland]]
[[Pontiac]] | designer = | sp = us }} The '''Chevrolet Series AB National''' (or Chevrolet National) is an American vehicle manufactured by [[Chevrolet]] in 1928 to replace the 1927 [[Chevrolet Series AA Capitol|Series AA Capitol]]. Over three-quarters of a million Series ABs were manufactured in a variety of body styles. ==Specification== [[File:1928 Chevrolet Truck (3091955218).jpg|thumb|left|1928 Chevrolet truck]] Looking very similar to the 1927 Series AA Capitol, the wheelbase of the Series AB was increased by four inches to {{convert|107|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}. The updated look was one of the first projects from GM's Art & Colour studio.{{cite web|title=1928 Chevrolet National Series AB|url=http://auto.howstuffworks.com/1928-chevrolet-national-series-ab.htm|work=How Stuff Works|accessdate=3 January 2013}} The Series AB was powered by Chevrolet's old {{convert|171|cuin|cc|abbr=on}} four-cylinder engine, but with minor modifications to produce {{convert|35|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} at 2,200 rpm. Four-wheel braking was also now provided. ==References== {{reflist}} {{commonscat-multi|1928 Chevrolet automobiles|Chevrolet trucks}} {{Chevrolet Vehicles}} [[Category:Chevrolet vehicles|Series AB National]] [[Category:Chevrolet trucks|Series AB National]] [[Category:Cars introduced in 1928]] [[Category:Vehicles introduced in 1928]]

[[List of General Motors factories#Closed or sold factories|GM Belgium]], [[Antwerp, Belgium]] | predecessor = [[Chevrolet Superior|Chevrolet Superior Series V]] | successor = [[Chevrolet Series AB National]] | class = | body_style = | layout = | platform = [[GM A platform]] | engine = {{convert|171|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} 4-cylinder | transmission = 3-speed manual | wheelbase = {{convert|103|in|mm|1|abbr=on}}[https://www.gmheritagecenter.com/docs/gm-heritage-archive/vehicle-information-kits/Chevrolet/1927-Chevrolet.pdf 1927 Chevrolet dimensions] | length = {{convert|146.06|in|mm|1|abbr=on}} | width = {{convert|44.16|in|mm|1|abbr=on}} | height = | weight = {{convert|1895|-|2275|lb|kg|0|abbr=on}} | related = [[Oakland (automobile)|Oakland]]
[[Pontiac]] | designer = | sp = us }} The '''Chevrolet Series AA Capitol''' (or Chevrolet Capitol) is an American vehicle manufactured by [[Chevrolet]] in 1927. Launched in the year Ford changed from the [[Ford Model T|Model T]] to the [[Ford Model A (1927–1931)|Model A]], Chevrolet sold 678,540 Series AA cars,{{cite web|title=1927 Chevrolet Series AA Capitol|url=http://auto.howstuffworks.com/1927-chevrolet-series-aa-capitol.htm|work=How Stuff Works|accessdate=3 January 2013}} and would help Chevrolet challenge Ford’s dominance in the market internationally.{{cite web|title=The New ’27 Chevrolets: Putting It to Ol’ Henry [Chevrolet Centennial, 1920s Edition]|url=http://blog.caranddriver.com/the-new-27-chevrolets-putting-it-to-ol-henry-chevrolet-centennial-1920s-edition/|work=Car and Driver|accessdate=3 January 2013|date=31 October 2011}} ==Specification== [[File:1927 GMC (7647274284).jpg|thumb|left|1927 GMC commercial series truck]] [[File:1927 Chevrolet Truck 2.jpg|thumb|left|1927 Chevrolet truck]] Available in eight body styles, the bodywork was very similar to the 1926 Chevrolet Superior Series V and 1925′s Superior Series K. The chassis and platform were also used to build Chevrolet and [[GMC (automobile)|GMC]] trucks. {{Clear}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{commons category|1927 Chevrolet automobiles}} {{commons category|Chevrolet trucks}} {{commons category|GMC trucks}} {{Chevrolet Vehicles}} [[Category:Chevrolet vehicles|Series AA Capitol]] [[Category:Vehicles introduced in 1927]] [[Category:1920s cars]]

[[General Motors South Africa]], [[Port Elizabeth]], [[South Africa]]
[[List of General Motors factories#Closed or sold factories|GM Argentina]], [[Buenos Aires, Argentina]]
[[List of General Motors factories#Closed or sold factories|GM Belgium]], [[Antwerp, Belgium]] | predecessor = [[Chevrolet Series AD Universal]] | successor = [[Chevrolet Series BA Confederate]] | class = | body_style = | layout = [[FR layout]] | platform = [[GM A platform]] | engine = {{convert|194|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} 6-cylinder | transmission = | wheelbase = {{convert|109|in|mm|1|abbr=on}} | length = | width = | height = | weight = {{convert|2275|-|2725|lb|kg|0|abbr=on}} | related = [[Pontiac]] | designer = | sp = us }} The '''Chevrolet Series AE Independence''' (or Chevrolet Independence) is an American vehicle manufactured by [[Chevrolet]] in 1931 to replace the 1930 [[Chevrolet Series AD Universal|Series AD Universal]]. Production slipped by about eight percent to 619,554 cars as the [[Great Depression]] continued, but as [[Ford Motor Company|Ford]]'s output plummeted by nearly two-thirds, Chevrolet reclaimed first place in the American car sales table.{{cite web|title=1931 Chevrolet Series AE Independence|url=http://auto.howstuffworks.com/1931-chevrolet-series-ae-independence.htm|work=How Stuff Works|accessdate=3 January 2013}} ==Specification== [[File:1931 Chevrolet Truck.jpg|thumb|left|1931 Chevrolet Truck]] The main change between the Series AE and the outgoing AD was two-inch increase to the wheelbase, which was now {{convert|109|in|mm|1|abbr=on}}. It remained powered by the "Stovebolt Six" {{convert|194|cuin|cc|abbr=on}} [[Chevrolet straight-6 engine|six-cylinder engine]], now producing {{convert|50|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}}. The 2-door Cabriolet, of which just over 23,000 were produced, could reach a top speed of {{convert|85|mi/h|km/h|1|abbr=on}}.{{cite web|title=1931 Chevrolet Independence|url=http://www.lemaymuseum.org/vehicles.php?vid=532|work=LeMay Museum|accessdate=3 January 2013|archive-url=https://archive.is/20130415064242/http://www.lemaymuseum.org/vehicles.php?vid=532#|archive-date=2013-04-15|url-status=dead}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{commonscat|1931 Chevrolet automobiles}} {{commonscat|Chevrolet trucks}} {{commonscat|GMC trucks}} {{Chevrolet Vehicles}} [[Category:Chevrolet vehicles|Series AE Independence]] [[Category:Cars introduced in 1931]] [[Category:1930s cars]]

{{Infobox automobile | name = Chevrolet Series BA Confederate | image = 1932 Chevrolet Confederate BA 4-Door Sedan OKP156.jpg | caption = | manufacturer = [[Chevrolet]] ([[General Motors]]) | aka = | production = | model_years = 1932 | assembly = [[Oakland Assembly]], [[Oakland, California]]

[[General Motors South Africa]], [[Port Elizabeth]], [[South Africa]]
[[List of General Motors factories#Closed or sold factories|GM Argentina]], [[Buenos Aires, Argentina]]
[[List of General Motors factories#Closed or sold factories|GM Belgium]], [[Antwerp, Belgium]] | predecessor = [[Chevrolet Series AE Independence]] | successor = [[Chevrolet Eagle]] and [[Chevrolet Mercury|Mercury]] | class = | body_style = | layout = [[Front-engine, rear-wheel-drive layout|Front-engine, rear-wheel-drive]] | platform = [[GM A platform]] | engine = {{convert|194|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} [[Inline-six engine|I6]] | transmission = 3-speed [[Manual transmission|manual]] | wheelbase = {{convert|109|in|mm|1|abbr=on}} | length = | width = | height = | weight = {{convert|2410|-|2850|lb|kg|0|abbr=on}} | related = [[Pontiac|1932 Pontiac]] | designer = | sp = us }} The '''Chevrolet Series BA Confederate''' (or '''Chevrolet Confederate''') is an American vehicle manufactured by [[Chevrolet]] in 1932 to replace the 1931 [[Chevrolet Series AE Independence|Series AE Independence]]. Production slipped significantly from over 600,000 cars to 313,395 as the [[Great Depression]] continued, but was still sufficient for Chevrolet to retain first place in the American car sales table.{{cite web|title=1932 Chevrolet Series BA Confederate|url=http://auto.howstuffworks.com/1932-chevrolet-series-ba-confederate.htm|work=How Stuff Works|accessdate=3 January 2013}} Sales were also affected by cross-town rival Ford introducing the [[1932 Ford|Ford V8]] coupe and sedan. == Specifications == [[File:1932 Chevrolet Confederate BA (33153386550).jpg|left|250px|thumb|Coupe]] The Series BA carried over much from the Series AE and the main external differences were the sloping of the windshield and the removal of the external visor above. On either side of the hood the previous louvers were replaced by opening vents, finished in a distinctive chrome on DeLuxe models It remained powered by the "Stovebolt Six" {{convert|194|cuin|cc|abbr=on}} [[Chevrolet straight-6 engine|six-cylinder engine]], but now upgraded with a downdraft carburetor and a higher compression ratio to produce {{convert|60|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}}. A three-speed synchro-mesh transmission was fitted and a "Free Wheeling" mode was standard, which permitted the car to coast when the driver's foot was lifted from the accelerator. The electrical system was 6 Volt Negative ground, dual front (referred to as "Town and Country") horns and a passenger side Brake and Parking lights were options that could have been added on at either the dealership or factory. Turn signal systems had not yet been implemented, the generator used a "Cut-out" relay which only used 1 wire for its generating system. Voltage regulators weren't implemented until 1935. == References == {{reflist}} {{commonscat|1932 Chevrolet automobiles}} {{commonscat|Chevrolet trucks}} {{commonscat|GMC trucks}} {{Chevrolet Vehicles}} [[Category:Chevrolet vehicles|Series BA Confederate]] [[Category:Cars introduced in 1932]] [[Category:1930s cars]]

35,845 (Mercury or Standard) | model_years = 1933 | assembly = [[Oakland Assembly]], [[Oakland, California]]

[[List of General Motors factories#Closed or sold factories|GM Belgium]], [[Antwerp, Belgium]] | predecessor = [[Chevrolet Series BA Confederate]] | successor = [[Chevrolet Master]] and [[Chevrolet Standard Six|Standard]] | class = | body_style = | layout = [[FR layout]] | platform = [[GM A platform]] | engine = {{convert|206|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} 6-cylinder | transmission = | wheelbase = {{convert|110|in|mm|1|abbr=on}} | length = | width = | height = | weight = {{convert|2675|-|2880|lb|kg|0|abbr=on}} | related = [[Chevrolet Mercury]]
[[Chevrolet Suburban#First generation (1933–1934)|Chevrolet Suburban]] | designer = | sp = us }} The '''Chevrolet Eagle''' (Series CA) is an American vehicle manufactured by [[Chevrolet]] in 1933 to replace the 1932 [[Chevrolet Series BA Confederate|Series BA Confederate]]. The Eagle was produced early in the 1933 production year. When it was joined by the cheaper [[Chevrolet Mercury|Mercury]] later in 1933 the Eagle name was changed to Master to provide Chevrolet with a two-car range, and the first time in ten years they manufactured two models on different wheelbases. The Mercury was also known as the Standard series. {{cite web|title=1933 Chevrolet Eagle and Mercury|url=http://auto.howstuffworks.com/1933-chevrolet-eagle-and-mercury.htm|work=How Stuff Works|accessdate=3 January 2013}} Total the earlier Eagle and later Master combined sold 450,435 vehicles, an increase of nearly 140,000 the previous year's Series BA sales of 313,395, and ensured that Chevrolet was able to retain their number one spot in American car sales. The Eagle saw the end of two-seater cars from Chevrolet, and the new Town Sedan included an integral trunk. There are several differences between the Eagle and Master. The easiest to identify is the post between the front door [[wing window]]s and the roll down windows. On the Eagle the chrome divider between these two windows goes down as the window goes down, where as on the Master this divider remains fixed and does not go down with the window. ==Specification== The Eagle and Master's wheelbase increased an inch to {{convert|110|in|mm|1|abbr=on}} compared to the Series BA, and was three inches longer than the new Mercury. It was powered by a larger version of the "Stovebolt Six", {{convert|206|cuin|cc|abbr=on}} [[Chevrolet straight-6 engine|six-cylinder engine]], producing {{convert|65|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}}.{{cite web|title=1933 Chevrolet Master Eagle Series CA Cabriolet|url=http://www.bonhams.com/auctions/20582/lot/339/|work=Bonhams|accessdate=3 January 2013}} A smaller {{convert|181|cuin|cc|abbr=on}} six-cylinder was used in the Mercury, producing {{convert|60|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} ==Trucks== [[File:1933 Chevrolet trucks.jpg|thumb|left|1933 Chevrolet trucks at Yellowstone]] GM also used the Eagle chassis and platform for trucks branded as both Chevrolet and GMC. {{-}} ==References== ;Notes {{reflist}} ;Sources [https://www.gmheritagecenter.com/docs/gm-heritage-archive/vehicle-information-kits/Chevrolet-Trucks/1933-Chevrolet-Truck.pdf GM Heritage Center 1933 Chevrolet Passenger car and Truck specifications] {{commonscat}} {{Chevrolet Vehicles}} [[Category:Chevrolet vehicles|Eagle]] [[Category:Cars introduced in 1933]] [[Category:1930s cars]]
