{{convert|109.0|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}(1936){{cite web|url=http://www.oldcarbrochures.com/static/NA/Chevrolet/1936_Chevrolet/1936_Chevrolet_Brochure/1936%20Chevrolet-15.html |title=Directory Index: Chevrolet/1936_Chevrolet/1936_Chevrolet_Brochure |publisher=Oldcarbrochures.com |date= |accessdate=2011-11-20}} | platform = [[GM A platform]] | name = Chevrolet Standard Six |aka = Chevrolet Mercury (1933 only) | manufacturer = [[Chevrolet]] ([[General Motors]]) | production = 1933 (Mercury)
1934–1936 (Standard) | predecessor = [[Chevrolet Series BA Confederate]] | successor = [[Chevrolet Master]] | class = | body_style = 2-door [[coupe]]
2-door [[rumble seat]] [[coupe]]
4-door [[Coach (carriage)|coach]] | engine ={{convert|181|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} [[Straight-six engine|I6]]
{{convert|206.8|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} I6 | transmission = 3-speed manual{{cite book|last=Kimes|first=Beverly|title=standard catalog of American Cars 1805-1942|year=1996|publisher=Krause publications|isbn=0-87341-428-4}} | layout = [[FR layout]] | related = [[Chevrolet Master]] }} The '''Chevrolet Standard''' (Series DC) was launched in 1933, initially as the '''Chevrolet Mercury''', by [[Chevrolet]] as a lower priced alternative to the 1932 [[Chevrolet Series BA Confederate]] that became the [[Chevrolet Eagle|Eagle]] in 1933{{cite web|title=1933 Chevrolet Eagle and Mercury|url=http://auto.howstuffworks.com/1933-chevrolet-eagle-and-mercury.htm|work=How Stuff Works|accessdate=3 January 2013}} and [[Chevrolet Master|Master]] from 1934.{{cite web |url=http://www.gmheritagecenter.com/gm-heritage-archive/docs/Chevrolet/1933-Chevrolet.pdf |title=GM Heritage Center 1933 information sheet |format=PDF |accessdate=2011-11-20 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111015145329/http://gmheritagecenter.com/gm-heritage-archive/docs/Chevrolet/1933-Chevrolet.pdf |archivedate=2011-10-15 }} It was advertised as the cheapest six-cylinder enclosed car on the market.The Tuscaloosa News - Mar 12, 1933 pg11 The Standard was offered in three body styles all on a 107-inch wheelbase: [[Coach (carriage)|coach]], [[coupe]] and coupe with [[rumble seat]]. All bodies were by [[Fisher Body|Fisher]] and featured 'no-draft ventilation'. All models were powered by a {{convert|181|cuin|cc|abbr=on}} [[Straight-six engine|six-cylinder]] valve-in-head engine producing {{convert|60|bhp|kW PS|0|abbr=on}} at 3,000 rpm and {{convert|125|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} of torque{{cite web |url=http://www.gmheritagecenter.com/gm-heritage-archive/docs/Chevrolet/1935-Chevrolet.pdf |title=GM Heritage Center 1935 information sheet |format=PDF |accessdate=2011-11-20 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111015115241/http://gmheritagecenter.com/gm-heritage-archive/docs/Chevrolet/1935-Chevrolet.pdf |archivedate=2011-10-15 }} giving the car a top speed of between 65–70 mph. This engine had first appeared in Chevrolet's 1929 models, introduced in 1928. The car had full instrumentation.{{cite web|url=http://chevy.oldcarmanualproject.com/chevyowner/34om15.htm |title=1934 Chevy Owner's Manual |publisher=Chevy.oldcarmanualproject.com |date= |accessdate=2011-11-20}} A clock, heater and a radio were options. For 1934, sedan, roadster and touring body styles were added to the catalog. In 1935, a larger {{convert|206.8|cuin|cc|abbr=on}} six-cylinder engine was offered in lieu of the {{convert|181|cuin|cc|abbr=on}}, producing {{convert|74|bhp|kW PS|0|abbr=on}} at 3,200 rpm and {{convert|150|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} of torque. A sedan delivery was also available this year. For 1936, the Standard Six received a wide range of improvements and a wider choice of body styles including [[cabriolet]] and [[sports sedan]] versions. It was built on a new box-girder frame with a wheel base of 109 inches.{{cite web |url=http://www.gmheritagecenter.com/gm-heritage-archive/docs/Chevrolet/1936-Chevrolet.pdf |title=GM Heritage Center 1936 information sheet |format=PDF |accessdate=2011-11-20 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111015143707/http://gmheritagecenter.com/gm-heritage-archive/docs/Chevrolet/1936-Chevrolet.pdf |archivedate=2011-10-15 }} With an increase of compression ratio from 5.6:1 to 6:1, the standard {{convert|206.8|cuin|cc|abbr=on}} engine now produced {{convert|79|bhp|kW PS|0|abbr=on}} at 3,200 rpm and {{convert|156|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} of torque which was now shared with the Master Six.{{cite web|author=the Auto Editors of Consumer Guide |url=http://auto.howstuffworks.com/1936-chevrolet-standard-and-master-deluxe.htm |title=How Stuff Works |publisher=Auto.howstuffworks.com |date= |accessdate=2011-11-25}} The spare wheel moved from its external rear trunk location to a new compartment under the trunk. Brakes were 11-in drums. The steel roof was new.{{cite web|url=http://www.oldcarbrochures.com/static/NA/Chevrolet/1936_Chevrolet/1936_Chevrolet_Brochure/1936%20Chevrolet-14c.html |title=Directory Index: Chevrolet/1936_Chevrolet/1936_Chevrolet_Brochure |publisher=Oldcarbrochures.com |date= |accessdate=2012-05-31}} The Standard Six was discontinued for 1937 when the Master range was joined by the new Master Deluxe.{{cite web|author=the Auto Editors of Consumer Guide |url=http://auto.howstuffworks.com/1937-1939-chevrolet1.htm |title=How Stuff Works |publisher=Auto.howstuffworks.com |date=2007-09-19 |accessdate=2011-11-20}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{Chevrolet Vehicles}} [[Category:Chevrolet vehicles|Standard]] [[Category:Cars introduced in 1933]] [[Category:1930s cars]] [[Category:Rear-wheel-drive vehicles]]

{{Distinguish|Toyopet Master}}{{More citations needed|date=April 2019}}{{Infobox automobile | name = Chevrolet Master and Master Deluxe | image = 1937 Chevrolet Master Coupe NWR786.jpg | caption = 1937 Master Coupe | manufacturer =[[General Motors]] | aka = Series CA (1933)

[[List of General Motors factories#Closed or sold factories|GM Belgium]], [[Antwerp, Belgium]] | predecessor = [[Chevrolet Eagle]] | successor = [[Chevrolet Deluxe]] | class = | body_style = 2-door coupe
4-door sedan
2-door pickup truck | layout = [[FR layout]] | platform = [[GM A platform (1936)|"A" body]] | engine = {{convert|206|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} 6-cylinder | transmission = | wheelbase = {{convert|113|in|mm|1|abbr=on}} | length = | width = | height = | weight = | related = [[Chevrolet Standard Six|Standard]]
Pontiac Deluxe
[[Chevrolet Suburban#Second generation (1935–1940)|Chevrolet Suburban]] | designer = | sp = us }} The '''Chevrolet Master''' and Master Deluxe are American passenger vehicles manufactured by [[Chevrolet]] between 1933 and 1942 to replace the 1933 [[Chevrolet Eagle|Eagle]]. It was the more expensive model in the Chevrolet range at this time, with the [[Chevrolet Mercury|Mercury]] and [[Chevrolet Standard Six|Standard]] providing a cheaper and smaller range between 1933 and 1937. From 1940 a more expensive version based on the Master Deluxe was launched called the '''Special Deluxe'''. ==Model years== The Master name was used on a number of different versions, and the Series name changed each year. ===1933 (Series CA)=== The Series CA Master replaced the 1933 [[Chevrolet Eagle|Eagle]] midway through the model year when the 1933 Standard model (Series CC) was introduced. Several changes were made to the Eagle when the name was changed to Master. The easiest to identify is the post between the front door wing windows and the roll down windows. On the Eagle the chrome divider between these two windows goes down as the window goes down, where as on the Master this divider remains fixed and does not go down with the window. ===1934 (Series DA)=== [[File:1934 Chevrolet Master Sedan.jpg|thumb|left|1934 Master Sedan]] The Series DA Master replaced the 1933 [[Chevrolet Eagle|Eagle]], with an increased wheelbase of {{convert|112|in|mm|1|abbr=on}}. This increased the difference with the cheaper Standard wheelbase to {{convert|5|in|mm|1|abbr=on}}. Powered by an upgraded version of the "Stovebolt Six", {{convert|206|cuin|cc|abbr=on}} [[Chevrolet straight-6 engine|six-cylinder engine]], now producing {{convert|80|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}}. ===1935 (Series EA and ED)=== The Master underwent a redesign, utilising a new "Turret Top" construction method.{{cite book|last=Gunnell|first=John|title=Standard Catalog of Chevrolet, 1912-2003: 90 Years of History|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=3IkU1UjnG6QC&pg=PA30&lpg=PA30&dq=chevrolet+series+ca+eagle&source=bl&ots=NFqsVIT4JX&sig=AeWn93cBwZrL7NUt2BhtV166KC8&hl=en&sa=X&ei=sxPmULHgJenO0QWHnoD4BA&ved=0CG0Q6AEwCg#v=onepage&q=chevrolet%20series%20ca%20eagle&f=false}} ===1937 (Series GA and GB)=== [[File:1937 Master De Luxe Chevrolet Sedan, Chevrolet dealers since 1916, proven, reliable, and... (NBY 6129).jpg|thumb|1937 Master Deluxe]] [[File:Witold Rychter Polska 06 1937.jpg|thumb|right|A license-built Chevrolet Master Sedan from factory in Poland (1936-1939)]] The Master now replaced the lower priced [[Chevrolet Standard Six|Standard Six]], while the more luxurious new '''Master Deluxe''' edged the range upwards. The bodies were shared with the [[Pontiac#1926–1942|Pontiac Deluxe]]. ===1938 (series HA and HB)=== The Master (HB) and Master Deluxe (HA) sold well, with 162,430 and 302,728 respectively.{{cite web|title=1938 Chevrolet Master and Master DeLuxe|url=http://auto.howstuffworks.com/1938-chevrolet-master-and-master-deluxe.htm|work=How Stuff Works|accessdate=4 January 2013}} ===1939 (series JA and JB)=== [[File:1939 Chevrolet Master Town Sedan, rear.jpg|thumb|left|1939 Master Deluxe Town Sedan]] The Master returned for 1939. The Master Deluxe was now the JA, while the base model was renamed the '''Master 85''' (JB). A station wagon was offered, though its construction had been contracted to Mid States Body Corp.Odin, L.C. ''World in Motion 1939, The whole of the year's automobile production''. Belvedere Publishing, 2015. ASIN: B00ZLN91ZG. ===1940 (series KA and KB)=== The Master continued to be available in Master 85 (KB) as well as the more upscale "Master Deluxe" model (KA). The even better equipped "Special Deluxe" also appeared for the 1940 model year. {{Clear}} ==Trucks and buses== This was the last series of trucks and medium-duty vehicles that shared an appearance with Chevrolet passenger coupes and sedans, and were replaced with the [[Chevrolet AK Series|AK Series]] trucks. File:Chevrolet CG 1937.jpg|1937 Chevrolet CG chassis-cowl with third-party van body. File:1940 GMC Truck.JPG|1940 GMC Truck with factory cab. File:193X Chevrolet Pickup.jpg|1930s Chevrolet Commercial truck with third-party cab. File:1937 Chevrolet Carryall Suburban (front).jpg|Chevrolet Carryall Suburban File:Chevrolet QD z roku 1939.jpg|1939 Chevrolet bus == Interesting facts == * Chevrolet Master Deluxe GA was a personal auto of [[Janka Kupała]].[https://nina.nn.by/?c=ar&i=198592&lang=be «Маўр захапляўся спірытызмам, а Гарэцкі — расповедамі прастытутак» — цікавыя факты пра літаратараў] // [[Nasha Niva]] {{in lang|be}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category|Chevrolet Master}} * [http://www.secondchancegarage.com/public/chevrolet-masters.cfm Masters history at secondchancegarage.com] * [https://www.gmheritagecenter.com/docs/gm-heritage-archive/vehicle-information-kits/Chevrolet-Trucks/1938-Chevrolet-Truck.pdf GM Heritage Center 1938 Chevrolet Master] {{Chevrolet Vehicles}} {{General Motors platforms}} [[Category:1940s cars]] [[Category:Chevrolet vehicles|Master]] [[Category:Cars introduced in 1934]] [[Category:Sedans]]

{{Infobox automobile | name = Chevrolet Series FB | image = | caption = 1919 Chevrolet Series FB on display at LeMay Museum | manufacturer = [[Chevrolet]] ([[General Motors]]) | aka = Royal Mail (Roadster)

[[Arlington Assembly]], [[Arlington, Texas]]
[[Oshawa Truck Assembly|Oshawa Assembly]], [[Oshawa, Ontario]] [[Canada]] | predecessor = [[Chevrolet Series FA]] | successor = [[Chevrolet Superior]] | class = | body_style = 2-door roadster (FB-20)
2-door coupe (FB-30)
4-door sedan (FB-40)
4-door tourer (FB-50). | layout = | platform = [[GM A platform]] | engine = {{convert|224|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} 4-cylinder | transmission = 3-speed manual | wheelbase = {{convert|110|in|mm|1|abbr=on}} | length = | width = | height = | weight = {{convert|2160|-|2950|lb|kg|0|abbr=on}} | related = | designer = | sp = us }} The '''Chevrolet Series FB''' (or Chevrolet FB) is an American vehicle manufactured by [[Chevrolet]] from 1919 to 1922. It was a slightly larger replacement to the 1918 [[Chevrolet Series FA]], sitting on a wheelbase of {{convert|110|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} compared to {{convert|108|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}. It was replaced by the 1923 [[Chevrolet Superior]]. The FB was the largest model in the Chevrolet range at the time following the demise of the V8 [[Chevrolet Series D|Series D]], and complemented the smaller [[Chevrolet Series 490]]. ==Model names== The Series FB was advertised as the FB-12 and FB-20 (roadster), FB-22 and FB-30 (coupe), FB-40 and FB-42 (sedan) and FB-32 and FB-50 (touring).{{cite web|title=Chevrolet Data Sheets 1921|url=http://www.oldcarbrochures.com/static/NA/Chevrolet/1921_Chevrolet/1921_Chevrolet_Data_Sheets/1921%20Chevrolet-03.html|work=The Old Car Manual Project|accessdate=4 January 2013}}{{cite web|title=1920 Chevrolet|url=http://www.gmheritagecenter.com/docs/gm-heritage-archive/vehicle-information-kits/Chevrolet/1920-Chevrolet.pdf|work=GM Heritage Center|accessdate=4 January 2013}} The roadster was also sometimes known as the "Royal Mail" and the tourer as the "Baby Grand", but these names were officially dropped during 1919.{{cite web|title=Chevrolet's Classic|url=http://www.hemmings.com/hcc/stories/2005/08/01/hmn_feature12.html|work=Hemmings|accessdate=4 January 2013}} During 1922 the model was sometimes referred to as the "Superior", which is the name given to the 1923 replacement. ==Specification== Available in four body styles; two-door roadster and coupe and four-door tourer and sedan. The FB continued in production without many changes, the most significant in 1922 with a change to steel wheels in lieu of wood spoke ones, and larger 10gal fuel tank. All model years were powered by the same {{convert|224|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} 4-cylinder overhead valve engine, producing {{convert|37|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} @ 2000rpm, as used in the previous Series FA; this had been developed from the short-stroke {{convert|171|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} version with {{convert|24|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} used in the [[Chevrolet Series H|Series H]] before it. ==References== {{reflist}} {{Chevrolet Vehicles}} [[Category:Chevrolet vehicles|Series FB]] [[Category:Cars introduced in 1919]] [[Category:1920s cars]]

{{main|Chevrolet Deluxe}} {{Infobox automobile |image = Flickr - DVS1mn - 47 Chevrolet Stylemaster.jpg |caption = 1947 Chevrolet Stylemaster Coupe |name = Chevrolet Stylemaster |manufacturer = [[Chevrolet]] ([[General Motors]]) |platform=[[GM A platform]] |model_years = 1946–1948John Gunnell, Standard Catalog of American Cars 1946 to 1975, Revised 4th Edition, pages 156 to 159 | assembly = [[Oakland Assembly]], [[Oakland, California]]

[[Flint Truck Assembly|Flint Assembly]], [[Flint, Michigan]]

[[St. Louis Truck Assembly|St. Louis Assembly]], [[St. Louis, Missouri]]
[[Arlington Assembly]], [[Arlington, Texas]]
[[Oshawa Truck Assembly|Oshawa Assembly]], [[Oshawa, Ontario]] [[Canada]]
[[Australia]]Norm Darwin, 100 years of GM in Australia, page 76
[[Buenos Aires]], [[Argentina]] |predecessor = Chevrolet Master Deluxe |successor = Chevrolet Special |class = |layout = [[FR layout]] |body_style = 2-door [[Sedan (car)|sedan]]
4-door [[Sedan (car)|sedan]]
2-door [[coupe]]
2-door [[sedan delivery]] [http://www.oldcarbrochures.com/static/NA/Chevrolet/1948_Chevrolet/1948_Chevrolet_Specifications/1948%20Chevrolet%20Specs-07.html Chevrolet 1948 Specifications page 7, www.oldcarbrochures.com] Retrieved on 22 February 2012
2-door [[coupe utility]] ([[Australia]]) |engine = {{convert|216.5|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} [[Straight-six engine|I6]] |transmission = 3 speed [[Manual transmission|manual]] |wheelbase = {{convert|116|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} |length = {{convert|197.75|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} |related = [[Chevrolet Fleetmaster]] }} The '''Chevrolet Stylemaster''' is an automobile which was produced by [[Chevrolet]] in the [[United States]] for the 1946, 1947 and 1948 model years. ==1946== The Series DJ Stylemaster was introduced as the base trim level model in the 1946 Chevrolet range, along with the top level Series DK [[Chevrolet Fleetmaster]]. The Stylemaster, which was essentially an updated 1942 Chevrolet Master Deluxe, was powered by a {{convert|216.5|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} [[Straight-six engine]] driving through a 3 speed [[manual transmission]]. It was offered in 2-door Town Sedan, 4-door Sport Sedan, 2-door Business Coupe and 2-door 5-Passenger Coupe models,[http://www.oldcarbrochures.com/static/NA/Chevrolet/1946_Chevrolet/1946_Chevrolet_Brochure/dirindex.html 1946 Chevrolet sales brochure, www.oldcarbrochures.com] Retrieved on 22 February 2013 the Business Coupe differing from the 5-Passenger Coupe in having a front seat only. ==1947== The 1947 Series 1500 EJ Stylemaster was little changed from its predecessor, the most notable visual difference being a new radiator grille with a more horizontal theme. ==1948== The 1948 Series 1500 FJ Stylemaster was again little changed from the previous year. There were no significant body alterations, however the radiator grille featured a vertical centre bar. A Club Coupe was now offered [http://www.oldcarbrochures.com/static/NA/Chevrolet/1948_Chevrolet/1948_Chevrolet_Brochure/dirindex.html 1948 Chevrolet sales brochure, www.oldcarbrochures.com] Retrieved on 22 February 2013 replacing the 5-Passenger Coupe of 1947.[http://www.oldcarbrochures.com/static/NA/Chevrolet/1947_Chevrolet/1947_Chevrolet_Brochure/dirindex.html 1947 Chevrolet sales brochure, www.oldcarbrochures.com] Retrieved on 22 February 2013 File:1946 Chevrolet Stylemaster sedan (6712966883).jpg|1946 Chevrolet Stylemaster Town Sedan File:1946 Chevrolet Stylemaster Coupe (12400606644).jpg|1946 Chevrolet Stylemaster Coupe File:Chevrolet Stylemaster Deluxe (1947) (owner Brian Irving) pic6.JPG|1947 Chevrolet Stylemaster Town Sedan File:Chevrolet Stylemaster.jpeg|1948 Chevrolet Stylemaster Sport Sedan ==Replacement== For the 1949 model year the Stylemaster was replaced by the 1500 GJ Series Chevrolet Special, offered in Styleline and Fleetline sub-series. {{-}} ==Australia production== The Chevrolet Stylemaster was also produced by [[General Motors-Holden's]] in [[Australia]]. As Holden had carried over the body tooling from its 1942 models, the Australian sedan differed from its US counterpart in having a different body with rear-hinged back doors and a larger trunk.Norm Darwin, The History of Holden in Australia since 1917, page 62 The grilles fitted to the Australian models were the same as those used on the US models.The Post-war Chevrolet, 1946-1948, Restored Cars No 156, Jan-Feb 2003, pages 20 to 23 Australian production included a [[coupe utility]], which was, like the sedan, produced in 1946, 1947 and 1948 models. File:1947 Chevrolet Stylemaster coupe utility (7141134467).jpg|Australian 1947 Chevrolet Stylemaster Coupe Utility File:Chevrolet Stylemaster 1948.jpg|Australian produced 1948 Chevrolet Stylemaster 4-door Sedan File:Chevrolet Stylemaster Utility 1948.JPG|Australian produced 1948 Chevrolet Stylemaster Utility {{-}} == References == {{reflist}} ==External links== {{commons category|Chevrolet_Stylemaster}} {{Chevrolet Vehicles}} {{Chevrolet cars timeline 1950-1979}} [[Category:Chevrolet vehicles|Stylemaster]] [[Category:Cars introduced in 1946]]

[[General_Motors_Europe|Antwerp, Belgium]] |predecessor = Chevrolet Special Deluxe |successor = [[Chevrolet Deluxe]] |platform=[[GM A platform]] |layout = [[FR layout]] |body_style = 2-door [[Sedan (car)|sedan]]
4-door [[Sedan (car)|sedan]]
2-door [[coupe]]
2-door [[convertible]]
4-door [[station wagon]] |engine = {{convert|216.5|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} [[Straight-six engine|I6]] |transmission = 3 speed [[Manual transmission|manual]] |wheelbase = {{convert|116|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} |length = {{convert|197.75|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} |related = [[Chevrolet Stylemaster]]
Pontiac Fleetleader (Canada) }} The '''Chevrolet Fleetmaster''' is an [[automobile]] which was produced by [[Chevrolet]] in the [[United States]] for the 1946, 1947 and 1948 model years. The Fleetmaster series included the [[Chevrolet Fleetline|Fleetline]] sub-series which was offered only in 2-door and 4-door "[[fastback]]" bodystyles. {{TOC_left}} {{-}} ==1946== [[File:1946ChevroletFleetmasterSedan IMG 1349.jpg|thumb|1946 Chevrolet Fleetmaster Sport Sedan. This example has the additional triple fender mouldings which were a feature of the Fleetline sub-series models]] The Series DK Fleetmaster was introduced as the top trim level model in the 1946 Chevrolet range, along with the lower level Series DJ Chevrolet Stylemaster. The Fleetmaster, which replaced the "prewar" Chevrolet Special Deluxe, was powered by a {{convert|216.5|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} [[Straight-six engine]] driving through a 3 speed [[manual transmission]]. It was offered in 2-door Town Sedan, 4-door Sport Sedan, 2-door Sports Coupe, 2-door Convertible and 4-door Station Wagon models. A Fleetline sub-series was available as the 2-door Aero Sedan and 4-door Sport Master Sedan, both of which featured "[[fastback]]" styling and additional triple mouldings on all fenders. {{-}} ==1947== [[File:1947 Chevrolet Fleetmaster Coupe.jpg|thumb|1947 Chevrolet Fleetmaster Sport Coupe]] The 1947 Series 2100 EK Fleetmaster was little changed from its predecessor, the most notable visual difference being a new radiator grille with a more horizontal theme. {{-}} ==1948== [[File:1948 Chevrolet Fleetmaster Coupe.jpg|thumb|1948 Chevrolet Fleetmaster Sport Coupe. This example has the additional triple fenders mouldings which were a feature of the Fleetline sub-series models]] The 1948 Series 2100 FK Fleetmaster was again little changed from the previous year. There were no significant body alterations, however the radiator grille featured a vertical centre bar. {{-}} ==Replacement== For the 1949 model year the Fleetmaster was replaced by the 2100 GK Series Chevrolet Deluxe, offered in Styleline and Fleetline sub-series. {{-}} ==Australia production== [[File:1947 Chevrolet Fleetmaster (Australia).jpg|thumb|[[Australia]]n produced 1947 Chevrolet Fleetmaster]] The Chevrolet Fleetmaster was also produced by [[General Motors-Holden's]] in [[Australia]]. As Holden had carried over the body tooling from its 1942 models, the Australian sedan differed from its US counterpart in having a different body with rear-hinged back doors and a larger trunk.Norm Darwin, The History of Holden in Australia since 1917, page 62 The grilles fitted to the Australian models were the same as those used on the US models.The Post-war Chevrolet, 1946-1948, Restored Cars No 156, Jan-Feb 2003, pages 20 to 23 Australian Fleetmasters were produced in 1946, 1947 and 1948 models. ==Belgium production== [[File:Musée de Tram, Brüssel, Belgien 10.jpg|thumb|Preserved 1948 Fleetmaster Brussels taxi]] General Motors Continental [[Antwerp]] plant assembled several Fleetmasters between 1946 and 1948. Taxi fleets purchased large numbers of them[https://i.pinimg.com/originals/30/cf/3f/30cf3fbdca93a27a612d7b323a61bbd0.jpg Taxis on place du Luxembourg, 1950s][http://bruciel.brussels/rest/proxy/thumbnail/5@@@config@@@layers@@@id@@@500@@@features@@@id@@@POSTCARDS.25955@@@attachments@@@POSTCARDS.25955.2017-11-03-01-43-35.229.jpg Taxis in front of South Station, Brussels][http://bruciel.brussels/rest/proxy/thumbnail/5@@@config@@@layers@@@id@@@500@@@features@@@id@@@POSTCARDS.29356@@@attachments@@@POSTCARDS.29356.2017-11-03-02-48-11.663.jpg Two Chevrolet 1949 and two Fleetmasters on place royale]. {{-}} == References == {{reflist}} ==External links== {{commons category|Chevrolet_Fleetmaster}} {{Chevrolet Vehicles}} {{Chevrolet cars timeline 1950-1979}} [[Category:Chevrolet vehicles|Fleetmaster]] [[Category:Cars introduced in 1946]]

revision.text:
[[File:1918 Chevrolet Baby Grand FA5.jpg|thumb|1918 Chevrolet Baby Grand (Model FA5)]]''' The Chevrolet Series FA''' (or Chevrolet FA) of 1917–1918 <ref name="a1" >{{cite book | last = W. R. Davis | first = Michael | title = Chevrolet: 1911–1960 | publisher = [[Arcadia Publishing]] | year = 2012 | page = 34 | isbn = 978-0-7385-9394-4}}</ref> is an American vehicle manufactured by [[Chevrolet]]. It was a replacement of the [[Chevrolet Series F|Series F]] (the successor of the [[Chevrolet Series H|Series H]]) which had improvements in engine capacity as well as other features. In this transformation of series, the pre-existing names of the H and F series cars, The Royal Mail and Baby Grand were dropped in favor of the names Roadster and Touring respectively. The FA Series was then replaced by the [[Chevrolet Series FB]] in 1919.<ref name="a2" >{{cite book | last1 = R. Kimes | first1 = Beverly | last2 = C. Ackerson | first2 = Robert | title = Chevrolet: A History from 1911 | publisher = Automobile Quarterly Publications | edition = 2nd | year = 1986 | pages = 22–27 | isbn = 0-915038-62-5}}</ref>
==Technical Improvements== The FA was mounted on the same [[chassis]] as the Series H and F and had the same [[wheelbase]] of 108 inches as the Series F, using the [[GM A platform]]. The FA had an improved version of the engines of its preceding two series. The stroke of the earlier four-cylinder engine was lengthened by 11/4 inches thereby enlarging displacement to 224 cubic inches and boosting horsepower to 37 for the FA. This new engine possessed a circulating oil pump and a water pump that replaced the [[thermosiphon]] cooling system. In addition, the gearbox was repositioned against the clutch to form a unit with the engine.<ref name="a2" />
==Engine Specifications== *Overhead-valve *Inline *Four-cylinder cast-iron block *Bore and stroke: 3 11/16 × 5 1/4 in *Displacement: 224 cid *Net hp: 36 BHP *Main bearings: three *Valve lifters: solid *Carburetor: Zenith double jet <ref>{{cite book | last = Gunnell | first = John | title = Standard Catalog of Chevrolet, 1912–2003: 90 Years of History, Photos, Technical Data and Pricing | publisher = [[Krause Publications]] |page=13 |isbn=978-1-4402-3051-6}}</ref>
==Models==
===The Chevrolet FA Sedan=== The Chevrolet FA sedan called FA-4, The Roadster FA-2 "Royal Mail", and an open Touring, FA-5 "Baby Grand", The 1917 car was larger than the [[Chevrolet Series 490]]. It had an easy access via the single right-hand door even without a folding forward right front seat. The flat floor of the car was a double step down to the ground. It was made of wood and had removable pillars for the roof of the car.<ref name="a1" />
=== The FA Series Touring Opera Sedan=== All weather sedans had been transformed into pillar-less "hardtop" sedans that were similar to the body styles Chevrolet and General Motors makes introduced between 1949 and 1956. This closed or "all season" model offered by Chevrolet in 1917–1918, the $1,475 FA series Touring Opera Car was identical to the sedan except that the pillars for the roof of the car were attached.<ref name="a1" />
===The New FA Sedan With An Openable Windshield=== The closed cars that [[Chevrolet]] had started offering lacked the fresh-air ventilation of topless roadsters and touring cars. As a response to this problem Chevrolet the new FA Series sedan in 1917–1918 that had an openable, horizontally split windshield. It was in a way the predecessor of artificial air conditioning that was introduced as an option 40 years later and is considered standard today.<ref name="a1" />
{{Chevrolet Vehicles}}

{{Use mdy dates|date=October 2017}} {{Infobox automobile | name = Chevrolet Onix | image = Chevrolet Onix II front Brazil.jpg | caption = | manufacturer = [[Chevrolet]] | aka = | production = 2013–present | class = [[Subcompact car]] | layout = [[Front-engine, front-wheel-drive layout|Front-engine, front-wheel-drive]] | related = | predecessor = [[Chevrolet Corsa]]
[[Chevrolet Celta]]
[[Chevrolet Celta|Chevrolet Prisma]] | successor = }} The '''Chevrolet Onix''' is a [[subcompact car]] launched by [[United States|American]] automaker [[Chevrolet]] in Brazil at the 2012 [[São Paulo International Motor Show]]{{cite web|title=Sao Paulo motor show 2012: Chevrolet Onix|url=http://www.autocar.co.uk/car-news/motor-shows/sao-paulo-motor-show-2012-chevrolet-onix|work=Autocar|accessdate=28 October 2013|date=22 October 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150712203049/http://www.autocar.co.uk/car-news/motor-shows/sao-paulo-motor-show-2012-chevrolet-onix#|archive-date=July 12, 2015|url-status=dead|df=mdy-all}} and the second generation in China at the 2019 [[Shanghai Auto Show]]. In Brazil, it was launched to succeed [[Chevrolet Corsa]] and some versions of [[Chevrolet Celta]]. Produced in [[General Motors do Brasil|General Motors Brazil]]’s plants in [[Gravataí]] and [[São Caetano do Sul]], the Onix is a five-door [[hatchback]]. A sedan version is sold as the '''Chevrolet Onix Plus''' in Brazil, and the Onix sedan in Colombia.http://gmauthority.com/blog/2018/12/gm-launches-chevrolet-onix-sedan-in-colombia/ The Onix was [[Latin America]]’s best selling car in the year 2018, with sales of over 249,552 units.{{Cite web|url=https://motorshow.com.br/os-20-carros-mais-vendidos-na-america-latina-em-2018/}} {{TOCleft}} {{clear}} ==First generation (2013–present)== {{Infobox automobile | name = First generation | image = Chevrolet Onix 20150814-DSC05650.JPG | caption = | manufacturer = [[General Motors]] | aka = {{unbulleted list | Chevrolet Prisma (sedan) | Chevrolet Joy (hatchback) | Chevrolet Joy Plus (sedan) }} | production = 2012–present | model_years = 2013–present | assembly = [[Gravataí]], Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil ([[General Motors do Brasil|GM Brazil]])
[[São Caetano do Sul]], São Paulo, Brazil ([[General Motors do Brasil|GM Brazil]]) | class = [[Subcompact car|Subcompact]] | body_style = 5-door [[hatchback]]
4-door [[sedan (automobile)|sedan]] (Prisma) | platform = [[GM Gamma platform|Gamma]] | related = | engine = {{unbulleted list | 1.0 L ''[[Family 1 engine#SPE/4|SPE/4]]'' [[Inline-four engine|I4]] ([[gasoline]]/[[ethanol]])| 1.4 L ''[[Family 1 engine#SPE/4|SPE/4]]'' [[Inline-four engine|I4]] ([[gasoline]]/[[ethanol]])}} | transmission = {{unbulleted list | 5-speed manual | 6-speed manual | 6-speed ''[[GM 6T40 transmission|6T40]]'' automatic}} | length = 2013–16: {{convert|3930|mm|in|1|abbr=on}}

[[Chevrolet Celta]]
[[Chevrolet Celta|Chevrolet Prisma]] }} ===Models=== The first generation Onix was available in three trim levels (LS, LT and LTZ) with two [[Inline-four engine|4-cylinder]] engines, the 1.0-liter producing {{convert|78|PS|kW bhp|0|abbr=on}} (gasoline)/{{convert|80|PS|kW bhp|0|abbr=on}} (ethanol) and 1.4-liter {{convert|98|PS|kW bhp|0|abbr=on}} (gasoline)/{{convert|106|PS|kW bhp|0|abbr=on}} (ethanol) offering [[automatic transmission|automatic]] or five-speed [[Manual transmission|manual]] transmission. In Brazil the 4-door sedan variant was known as the '''Chevrolet Prisma'''. For 2017, the Onix and Prisma received a [[facelift (automotive)|facelift]], along with interior improvements.http://gmauthority.com/blog/2016/07/2017-chevrolet-onix-ushers-in-more-green-and-technology-traits/ A touchscreen was added with Android Auto and Apple CarPlay support. The LS trim level kept the original front end and became known as the '''Onix Joy''' and '''Prisma Joy''', leaving the LT as the base trim for the updated Onix/Prisma. A crossover-like version called the '''Onix Activ''' was also added, with raised suspension, plastic body cladding, and roof rack. In late 2019, the Onix and Prisma were replaced in Brazil by the second-generation Onix and Onix Plus, respectively. However, the Onix Joy and Prisma Joy remained available, and were renamed '''Joy''' and '''Joy Plus''', respectively. ===Technical details=== Specs include front-wheel drive, [[MacPherson strut]] front and [[twist-beam rear suspension]], and (in the three versions shown) dual air bag, ABS and power steering. In February 2013, the new Prisma, the sedan version of the Onix, with a trunk of 500 liters, was launched.{{cite web|title=NOVO PRISMA 2013/ONIX SEDAN, PREÇO, FOTOS E FICHA TÉCNICA | url=http://www.magazinecarros.com/2013/02/novoprisma2013.html | work=Magazine Carros | accessdate=28 October 2013}} The 1.0 versions are fitted with 14" wheels, with 15" fitted to the 1.4 models. ===Safety=== In December 2014, the Chevrolet Onix was evaluated under the [[Latin NCAP]] assessment and achieved a 3-star safety rating for adults and 2-star safety rating for children:{{Cite web|url = http://www.latinncap.com/data/pdf/chevrolet_onix_2airbag_update_po_.pdf|title = Latin NCAP Assessment Chevrolet Onix|date = |accessdate = |website = |publisher = |last = |first = }} {| class="wikitable" !Test !Score !Points |- |Adult |62.76% (3-star) |10.67 out of 17 |- |Children |41.10% (2-star) |20.14 out of 49 |} In May 2017, the Chevrolet Onix was re-evaluated under the Latin NCAP assessment, using the 2016 Assessment Protocol, and achieved a 0-star safety rating for adults and 3-star safety for children.{{Cite web|url=http://www.latinncap.com/po/resultado/89/chevrolet-onix-+-2-airbags|title=Resultados oficiais da avaliação de segurança doChevrolet Onix + 2 Airbags 2017|website=LATIN NCAP - PARA AUTOS MAS SEGUROS|language=Portuguese|access-date=2017-05-11}} {| class="wikitable" !Test !Score !Points |- |Adult |0.00% (0-star) |0.00 out of 34 |- |Children |55.88% (3-star) |27.38 out of 49 |} ===Gallery=== Chevrolet Onix 20150902-IMG 20150902 153010.JPG|Chevrolet Onix rear view Chevrolet Prisma in Santiago, Chile.JPG|Chevrolet Prisma File:Chevrolet Prisma II in Punta del Este 2015.JPG|Chevrolet Prisma rear view {{-}} ==Second generation (2019–present)== {{Infobox automobile | name = Second generation | image = Chevrolet Onix 006.jpg | caption = Chevrolet Onix sedan | manufacturer = [[SAIC-GM]] (China)
General Motors (Latin America) | aka = Chevrolet Onix Plus (sedan, South America) | production = 2019–present | model_years = 2020–present (Latin America) | assembly = [[Gravataí]], Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil ([[General Motors do Brasil|GM Brazil]])
Dong Yue Motors, [[Yantai]], Shandong, China
[[San Luis Potosi]], [[Mexico]]https://noticias.autocosmos.com.mx/2019/09/19/chevrolet-onix-inicia-ventas-en-2020-y-sera-fabricado-en-mexico | class = [[Compact car|Compact]] | body_style = 4-door [[sedan (automobile)|sedan]]
5-door [[hatchback]] | platform = GM GEM platform | related = [[Buick Excelle]] (Second generation) | engine = {{unbulleted list | 1.0 L EcoTec 325T [[Inline-three engine|I3]]-[[turbocharger|T]] ([[gasoline]]/[[ethanol]]) | 1.2 L EcoTec [[Inline-three engine|I3]]-[[turbocharger|T]] ([[gasoline]])}} | transmission = {{unbulleted list | 5-speed manual | 6-speed manual | 6-speed automatic}} | length = Sedan: {{convert|4474|mm|in|1|abbr=on}}
Hatchback: {{convert|4160|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | width = {{convert|1730|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | height = {{convert|1471|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | weight = {{convert|1120|kg|lb|abbr=on}} | wheelbase = Sedan: {{convert|2600|mm|in|1|abbr=on}}
Hatchback: {{convert|2550|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | designer = | predecessor = [[Chevrolet Cavalier]]
[[Chevrolet Sonic]] }} In April 2019, a new sedan named the Onix was launched in China, different from both the Onix and Prisma from Brazil.http://gmauthority.com/blog/2019/03/this-is-the-all-new-2019-chevrolet-onix-sedan/ The Onix replaces both the [[Chevrolet Sonic|Sonic]] and [[Chevrolet Cavalier|Cavalier]] in the Chinese market, and is slightly larger than the Prisma/Onix sedan. It uses the GEM (Global Emerging Markets) platform. The Onix is offered in China with a turbocharged, direct-injected 1.0-liter 3-cylinder engine, rated at {{convert|92|kW|hp|abbr=on}} and {{convert|180|Nm|lbft|0|abbr=on}} torque. Fuel economy is rated at {{convert|4.9|L/100 km|mpgus|abbr=on}}. A naturally aspirated 1.0 L 3-cylinder engine is due to follow. Brazilian versions resort to port-injection for both the turbocharged and the naturally aspirated versions. ===Chevrolet Onix Redline=== [[File:Chevrolet Onix 007.jpg|thumb|left|Chevrolet Onix Redline rear]] The first version of the Onix to debut was the Onix Redline. It features black exterior trim with red accents, and a two-tone interior.http://gmauthority.com/blog/2019/04/all-new-chevrolet-onix-redline-launches-in-china/ ===Brazilian market=== [[File:Chevrolet Onix II front Brazil.jpg|thumb|left|Chevrolet Onix front]] [[File:Chevrolet Onix II rear Brazil.jpg|thumb|left|Chevrolet Onix hatchback rear]] In Brazil, the new sedan debuted in September 2019 as the Onix Plus, while the hatchback went on sale in November 2019. http://gmauthority.com/blog/2019/09/gm-introduces-all-new-chevrolet-onix-in-south-america/ In addition to the LT and LTZ trim levels from the previous generation, a new top-level Premier level was added. The Onix Plus was rated 5 stars by Latin NCAP.https://www.motorpasion.com.mx/industria/chery-tiggo-3-reprueba-chevrolet-new-onix-obtiene-5-estrellas-pruebas-latin-ncap All versions of new Onix and Onix Plus have 6 airbags, ABS brakes and electric stability control. In 2019, the Chevrolet Onix was the best-selling car model in Brazil, for the fifth consecutive year, with a total of 268,066 sales.https://gmauthority.com/blog/2020/01/chevrolet-onix-sets-new-sales-record-in-brazil/ It was also the best-selling model in Latin America. ===Mexican market=== The Onix will be launched in the Mexican market in spring of 2020 as well to place itself between the [[Chevrolet Cavalier|Cavalier]] and the [[Chevrolet Sail|Sail]], the latter being known as Aveo in that country.https://www.motorpasion.com.mx/industria/chevrolet-onix-2020-primeros-detalles-mexico Two new motors were announced for the Onix by GM of Mexico for the Mexican market prior to its March 2020 launch. LT and LS trim lines will use a 1.0-litre motor able to generate 85 kW (114 hp) and 120 lb-ft, with an option of a 5-gear manual transmission or a 6-speed automatic transmission. Its top trim line, Premier, will use a 1.2-litre motor able to generate 96 kW (130 hp) and 141 lb-ft, only offered with a 6-speed automatic transmission. All motors are turbo-powered. All versions will have 6 airbags, ABS brakes and electric stability control. In addition, other things are included, such as a 7" (17cm) infotainment system screen, OnStar services, reverse sensor with camera, leather interior skin, and others.https://www.motorpasion.com.mx/industria/chevrolet-onix-confirma-dos-motores-para-mexico-ambos-turbo {{clear}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{commons category}} {{commons category|Chevrolet Prisma MkII}} * {{YouTube|cmUrCmfmbsM|Chevrolet Onix México}} * [https://www.chevrolet.com.br/carros/onix Official Chevrolet Onix page {{in lang|pt}}] * [https://www.chevrolet.com.cn/onix/ Official Chevrolet Onix sedan page {{in lang|zh}}] {{Chevrolet vehicles}} [[Category:Cars introduced in 2012]] [[Category:Cars of Brazil]] [[Category:Chevrolet vehicles|Onix]] [[Category:2010s cars]] {{modern-auto-stub}}

{{distinguish|Opel Astra|Vauxhall Astra|Holden Astra|GMC Astro}} {{Refimprove|date=January 2009}} {{Infobox automobile | name = Chevrolet Astro/GMC Safari | image = 1995 Chevrolet Astro -- 03-31-2011.jpg | manufacturer = [[General Motors]] | production = 1985–2005 | class = [[Van]] | layout = [[Front-engine design|Front engine]], [[Rear-wheel drive]] / [[All-wheel drive]] | aka = GMC Safari | body_style = 3-door cargo van
3-door passenger van | transmission = 4-speed [[Automatic transmission|automatic]]
4-speed [[Manual transmission|manual]]
5-speed manual | assembly = [[Baltimore Assembly]], [[Baltimore, Maryland]] | successor = [[Chevrolet Uplander]] (Astro, passenger van)
[[Chevrolet Traverse]] (Astro, passenger van)
[[GMC Acadia]] (Safari, passenger van)
[[Nissan NV200|Chevrolet City Express]] (Astro and Safari, cargo van)
[[Chevrolet Express]] (Astro and Safari, both cargo and passenger) }} The '''Chevrolet Astro''' is a [[van]] that was manufactured and marketed by the [[Chevrolet]] division of American auto manufacturer [[General Motors]] from 1985 to 2005. Sold alongside the '''GMC Safari''', the Astro was marketed in multiple configurations, including [[Minivan|passenger minivan]] and cargo van. The Astro and Safari are GM M-body vehicles, using a rear-wheel drive chassis; all-wheel drive became an option in 1990. For its entire production, the Astro and Safari were produced by [[Baltimore Assembly]] in [[Baltimore|Baltimore, Maryland]]; the vans would be the final model line produced by the facility. In total, approximately 3.2 million Astros and Safaris were produced from 1985 to 2005. ==Background== The Astro and Safari were introduced for 1985 as the first minivan from General Motors. While marketed as a response to the [[Chrysler minivans (S)|first-generation Chrysler minivans]], GM adapted a rear-wheel drive layout, sizing the Astro and Safari closely to the short-wheelbase [[Chevrolet van|Chevrolet G10 van]]. Similar to the [[Ford Aerostar]], to reduce production costs, GM adapted light-truck powertrain components; engines and transmissions were sourced from the [[Chevrolet S-10]], allowing for a towing capacity of up to {{convert|5500|lb|abbr=on}}. Prior to its use on a minivan, the Astro nameplate was used twice by General Motors; in 1967 (for the Chevrolet Astro 1 concept car){{cite web|url=http://www.ultimatecarpage.com/car/2409/Chevrolet-Astro-I-Concept.html|title=Chevrolet Astro I Concept car|work=ultimatecarpage.com|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303210130/http://www.ultimatecarpage.com/car/2409/Chevrolet-Astro-I-Concept.html|archivedate=March 3, 2016|url-status=live|accessdate=February 28, 2016}}{{cite journal|last=Keefe|first=Don|date=December 2005|title=1967 Chevy Astro I|url=http://www.hemmings.com/magazine/hcc/2005/12/1967-Chevy-Astro-I/1281650.html|url-status=live|journal=Hemmings|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170105094844/https://www.hemmings.com/magazine/hcc/2005/12/1967-Chevy-Astro-I/1281650.html|archivedate=January 5, 2017|accessdate=February 28, 2016}} and from 1969 to 1987 (on the [[Chevrolet Titan|GMC Astro]] COE semitractor). GMC sourced the Safari nameplate from Pontiac (used by the latter to denote woodgrained station wagons). As GMC was half of the Pontiac/GMC Division (later including Buick), from 1985 to 1989, both GMC and Pontiac Safaris were simultaneously offered through the same dealership network. {{clear}} ==First generation (1985–1994)== {{Infobox automobile |name=First generation |image=1st Chevrolet Astro.jpg | production = 1985–1994 |related=[[Chevrolet S-10]] |engine=2.5 L [[Iron Duke engine#Tech IV|Tech IV]] {{convert|98|hp|abbr=on}} [[Straight-4|I4]]
4.3 L [[General Motors 90° V6 engine#4.3L (262 CID)|4300]] {{convert|165|hp|abbr=on}} [[V6 engine|V6]]
4.3 L 4300 {{convert|200|hp|abbr=on}} [[V6]] |wheelbase={{convert|111.0|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} |length=STD: {{convert|176.8|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}
EXT: {{convert|186.8|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}
1992–94 Astro Cargo Van STD: {{convert|177.9|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}
1992–94 Astro Cargo Van EXT: {{convert|187.9|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} |width={{convert|77.0|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}
1992–94 Safari & Astro Cargo Van: {{convert|77.5|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} |height=1985–89: {{convert|73.7|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}
1985–89 Cargo Van STD: {{convert|74.5|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}
1990–91 STD: {{convert|74.9|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}
1990–91 STD: {{convert|74.1|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}
1992–94 Astro: {{convert|76.2|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}
1992–94 Safari Cargo Van: {{convert|76.1|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}
1992–94 Safari SLX: {{convert|76.4|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}
1992–94 Safari 2WD EXT: {{convert|76.6|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}
1992–94 Safari Cargo Van AWD STD: {{convert|75.7|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}
1992–94 Safari Cargo Van AWD EXT: {{convert|76.0|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} }} [[File:1st-GMC-Safari.jpg|thumb|left|1st-gen GMC Safari]] Initial advertising boasted that it was a vehicle that will "make you realize that life is too big for a [[minivan]]", referring to the [[Chrysler minivans]]. The van can have a seating configuration between two and eight passengers. Engine choices ranged from a {{convert|98|hp|kW PS|0|abbr=on}} 2.5 L four-cylinder to a {{convert|200|hp|kW PS|0|abbr=on}} 4.3 L V6, depending on options and/or model year. The 4-cylinder engine was only offered in cargo versions of the Astro; it was dropped after 1990. Much like the second-generation [[GM F platform|GM F-body]] 1970-1981 and [[GM X platform (1962)|X-body]] vehicles, the GM M-van (Astro/Safari) had a bolt-on subframe. For the M-van, the front suspension shares most components with the [[GM B platform|GM B-body]] station wagon ([[Chevrolet Caprice]], [[Oldsmobile Custom Cruiser]] and larger variants of the [[Pontiac Safari]] and [[Buick Estate Wagon]]) with a leaf-spring rear suspension. The lower ball joints were larger than their [[GM B platform|B-body]] counterparts (similar to 1977-96 Cadillac D platform vehicles, e.g., Fleetwood limousines). These ball joints were later used in the final Chevrolet Caprice 9C1 (police package) cars manufactured in 1995 and 1996. They also shared many mechanical similarities to the [[GM GMT platform|GMT 325/330]] midsize S/T pickups and utility vehicles. Digital dashboards were offered in the first generation Astro; this option did not continue after 1994. 1989 was the final year that the [[Borg-Warner T-5 transmission|Borg Warner T-5]] manual transmission was made available. All subsequent models were equipped with 700R4/4l60 automatic transmissions through 1993. In 1990 a new [[all-wheel drive]] (AWD) system (the first U.S.-built minivan to do so),{{cite book|last=Gunnell|first=John|title=Standard Catalog of 4x4's 1945-1993|year=1993|publisher=Krause Publications}} designed and developed by [[FF Developments]] (FFD),{{cite web |title=No giant here — FF Developments Ltd. — company profile |date=December 1999 |publisher=Ward's Auto World |url= http://www.findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_m3165/is_n12_v25/ai_8255861}} {{Dead link|date=September 2010|bot=RjwilmsiBot}} was made optional. The AWD models had a lower fuel economy: 17 miles per gallon highway versus 20 to 21 miles per gallon for rear-wheel drive vans. AWD Astros used a Borg Warner 4472 transfer case. Also in 1990, a new analog dashboard was introduced along with the availability of an extended body option, sharing its wheelbase with the shorter version. The 1990 model year also introduced the hydroboost braking system, a system using the same accessory belt driven pump to supply the power steering and brakes. In 1992, a new optional door form was introduced, colloquially known as Dutch doors. This form was two bi-parting doors with a flip-up window above. Previously, Astro and Safari vans were equipped only with bi-parting doors. An optional 4.3 L (RPO L35) engine with central port injection and a balance shaft was phased in. In 1993, the electronically controlled 4L60E 4-speed automatic transmission with overdrive became standard as the sole transmission offering. As with many other 1993 model year GM vehicles, [[Scotchgard]] fabric protection also became a standard feature on Astro vans equipped with cloth seats. 1994 also saw the addition of three new exterior paint colors. These colors were Indigo Blue Metallic (#39), Light Quasar Blue Metallic (#20), and Medium Quasar Blue Metallic (#80). For the 1994 model year, GM started manufacturing most of their vehicles, including the Astro and Safari, with CFC-free air-conditioning systems, which used R134a refrigerant instead of R-12 refrigerant. {{clear}} ==Second generation (1995-2005)== {{Infobox automobile |name=Second generation |image=Chevrolet-Astro-cargo.jpg |production = 1995–2005 |related=[[GMC Safari]] |engine=[[General Motors 90° V6 engine#4.3L (262 CID)|4.3 L]] {{convert|190|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} [[V6]] |wheelbase=1995–96: {{convert|111.0|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}
1997–2005: {{convert|111.2|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} |length={{convert|189.8|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} |width={{convert|77.5|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} |height=1995–96 Astro: {{convert|75.9|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}
1997–98 Astro: {{convert|76.0|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}
1995–96 Safari: {{convert|76.2|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}
1997–98/2002–03 Safari Cargo Van & 1999–2001 Astro Cargo Van 2WD: {{convert|75.3|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}
1997–2005 Safari & 2002–05 Astro: {{convert|75.0|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}
1999–2001 Astro 2WD: {{convert|74.9|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}
1999–2001 Astro Cargo Van AWD: {{convert|75.2|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}
1999–2001 Astro AWD: {{convert|74.8|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} }} [[File:GMC Safari.JPG|thumb|left|1996-2005 GMC Safari]] [[File:Astro lt 4wd luxury touring 1998.jpg|thumb|left|1998 Chevrolet Astro LT ]] In 1995, the model was facelifted with an extended nose that resembled the then-new full-size Express vans; while the original square sealed beam headlights were retained for use on the cargo vans, the passenger-carrying variants now used horizontally-mounted rectangular headlights that had debuted on the full-size trucks in 1992, and would eventually appear on the smaller trucks in 1998. Also for 1995, the shorter length body was dropped. In 1996, a redesigned dash received a passenger side air-bag. The vans remained mostly unchanged until the end of production in 2005. In 2003, GM upgraded the chassis of both the Astro and Safari with certain suspension components, larger brakes, and six-lug, 16 inch wheels from the full-size Chevrolet and GMC half-ton pickup trucks. The Chevrolet Astro and GMC Safari twins were originally scheduled to be discontinued after 2002, but they soldiered on because of good sales; the last Astro and Safari rolled off the assembly line on May 13, 2005. === Safety and crash testing === The [[Insurance Institute for Highway Safety]] (IIHS), gave the Astro a "Poor" rating in 1996 because of a display of [[structural failure]] in the Institute's {{convert|40|mi/h|km/h|abbr=on}} [[crash test]] into a fixed, offset barrier. The underbody of the test van buckled, pitching both front seats forward and shoving the crash [[mannequin|dummy]] into the dashboard and [[steering wheel]], and resulting in a broken left leg, leading the Institute to comment that "[t]he collapse of the occupant compartment left little survival space for the driver."{{cite web|url= http://www.iihs.org/ratings/rating.aspx?id=66 |title=Vehicle ratings - Chevrolet Astro 1996-2005 models |work=Insurance Institute for Highway Safety, Highway Loss Data Institute |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20060602105543/http://www.iihs.org/ratings/rating.aspx?id=66 |archivedate=June 2, 2006 |accessdate=February 28, 2016}} In testing performed by the [[National Highway Traffic Safety Administration]] (NHTSA), however, the Astro and Safari fared better, improving from a single-star rating in 1991 to a three-star (driver) and four-star (passenger) rating by 2000. In side impacts, the Astro and Safari both received the highest, five-star rating in every year that the test was administered. In 2007, the IIHS reported that the 2001–2004 model year Chevrolet Astro recorded during calendar years 2002–2005 the least number of killed drivers of all passenger vehicles in the United States, as calculated per every million units on the road. Driver's habits and vehicle usage might have influenced this result.{{cite journal|url=http://www.iihs.org/externaldata/srdata/docs/sr4204.pdf |title=Drivers deaths by make and model: fatality risk in one vehicle versus another |publisher=Insurance Institute for Highway Safety |journal=Status Report |volume=42 |issue=4 |date=April 19, 2007 |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20140117080040/http://www.iihs.org/externaldata/srdata/docs/sr4204.pdf |archivedate=January 17, 2014 |accessdate=February 28, 2016}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[https://www.gmheritagecenter.com/docs/gm-heritage-archive/vehicle-information-kits/AstroVan/1985-Chevrolet-Astro-Van.pdf 1985 Chevrolet Astro handbook] *[https://www.gmheritagecenter.com/docs/gm-heritage-archive/vehicle-information-kits/AstroVan/1986-Chevrolet-Astro-Van.pdf 1986 Chevrolet Astro handbook] *[https://www.gmheritagecenter.com/docs/gm-heritage-archive/vehicle-information-kits/AstroVan/1987-Chevrolet-Astro-Van.pdf 1987 Chevrolet Astro handbook] *[https://www.gmheritagecenter.com/docs/gm-heritage-archive/vehicle-information-kits/AstroVan/1988-Chevrolet-Astro-Van.pdf 1988 Chevrolet Astro handbook] {{Refimprove|date=October 2009}} {{Infobox automobile | image = 2007 Chevrolet Avalanche LS.jpg | name = Chevrolet Avalanche | manufacturer = [[General Motors]] | production = July 2001 – April 2013 | class = [[Full-size]] [[pickup truck]] | body_style = 4-door [[pickup truck]] | assembly = [[Silao]], [[Mexico]] | layout = [[Front-engine design|Front engine]], [[rear-wheel drive]] / [[Four-wheel drive]] | wheelbase = {{convert|130.0|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} | designer = Marc R. Asposito | related = [[Cadillac Escalade EXT]]
[[Chevrolet Suburban]]
[[Chevrolet Silverado]] }} The '''Chevrolet Avalanche''' is a four-door, five or six passenger [[pickup truck]] sharing [[General Motors|GM's]] long-wheelbase chassis used on the [[Chevrolet Suburban]] and [[Cadillac Escalade EXT]]. Breaking with a long-standing tradition, the Avalanche was not available as a [[GMC (automobile)|GMC]], but only as a [[Chevrolet]]. Production of the Avalanche started in September 2001 and ended April 2013; producing two generations in its lifespan. {{TOC left}} {{clear}} ==2001–2006== {{Infobox automobile | name = First generation | transmission = {{ubl | 4-speed ''[[GM 4L60-E transmission|4L60-E]]'' automatic | 4-speed ''[[GM 4L80-E transmission|4L80-E]]'' automatic}} | image = 1st-Chevrolet-Avalanche.jpg | production = September 2001 – December 2005 | model_years = 2002-2006 | engine = {{ubl | 5.3 L ''[[LS based GM small-block engine#LM7|LM7]]'' [[V8 engine|V8]] ([[gasoline]]) | 5.3 L ''[[LS based GM small-block engine#L59|L59]]'' [[V8 engine|V8]] (gasoline/[[E85]]) | 8.1 L ''[[Chevrolet Big-Block engine#L18|L18]]'' [[V8 engine|V8]] (gasoline)}} | related = [[Chevrolet Silverado|Chevrolet Silverado/GMC Sierra]]
[[Chevrolet Suburban|Chevrolet Suburban/GMC Yukon XL]]
[[Cadillac Escalade ESV]]
[[Cadillac Escalade EXT]] | length = 2002–03: {{convert|221.7|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}
2004–06: {{convert|221.6|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} | width = {{convert|79.8|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} | height = 2002–03: {{convert|73.3|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}
2004–06: {{convert|73.6|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} | weight = 2002-04: {{convert|6,642|lb|kg|0|abbr=on}} | platform = [[GM GMT platform#GMT 800|GMT805]] }} The Avalanche was launched in September 2001 as a 2002 model on the [[GMT800]] platform. First year Avalanches featured light gray plastic body cladding, intended to provide visual distinction from the [[Chevrolet Suburban|Suburban/Yukon XL]]. Avalanche also gave the public an advance look at the next generation of front fascia designs for the entire GM line. A full-length chrome strip splits each lamp assembly and the grille, with a gold Chevrolet "bow tie" in the center. The hood and fenders featured aggressive folds, in contrast to the soft box of the other GMT800 models. [[File:2003-06 Chevrolet Avalanche WBH.jpg|thumb|left|GMT800 Chevrolet Avalanche WBH]] 2003 models featured a darker cladding, but GM's new president, [[Rick Wagoner]], demanded the removal of this "unpopular" trim (as did certain elements of the public). From mid-year, Avalanche could be ordered without the cladding. The uncladded model, known as the Without Body Hardware (or better by its acronym "WBH"), and alternatively called "slicksides" by GM marketers, resembles the '03-'05 [[Chevrolet Silverado|Silverado]] in the front. Avalanche was nominated for the ''[[North American Car of the Year|North American SUV of the Year]]'' award and was ''[[Motor Trend]]'' magazine's [[Car of the Year|Truck of the Year]] for 2002.{{cite web|url=http://www.motortrend.com/oftheyear/truck/truck_of_the_year_winners/index.html |title=Motor Trend Trucks of the Year Winners List |publisher=Motortrend.com |date=2009-02-24 |accessdate=2009-08-08}} There were two engine choices: * A [[GM small-block engine|Vortec]] 5.3 L [[V8 engine|V8]] producing 285 hp (216 [[Kilowatt|kW]]), for the half-ton 1500 series; * A [[Chevrolet Big-Block engine#8100|Vortec]] 8.1 L V8 with 340 hp (253 kW) and the [[GM 4L80-E transmission#4L85-E|4L85-E]] four-speed transmission, for the three-quarter-ton 2500 series. The drive train is [[rear-wheel drive]] or available with selectable high/low [[four-wheel drive]]. The Avalanche was originally marketed as being able to "change from an SUV to a super SUV". This was made possible by a plastic cover and an exclusive "midgate", called the Convert-a-Cab system by GM, which could open and close. The midgate was a divider behind the second row of seats that could be folded down, with the seats, to create a longer bed area, or folded up to make a larger cab area. A similar midgate was found on the Cadillac Escalade EXT, Hummer H2 SUT and the GMC Envoy XUV.https://www.gmheritagecenter.com/docs/gm-heritage-archive/vehicle-information-kits/Avalanche/2002-Chevrolet-Avalanche.pdf For those who planned to go off-road in their Avalanche, a Z71 Off-Road package was available that added off-road suspension, GM's AutoTrac full-time, push-button four-wheel-drive system, all-terrain P265/70R17 white-lettered [[Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company|Goodyear]] tires, seventeen-inch alloy wheels, leather seating surfaces with waterproof accents, front dual power bucket seats, cloth door panel inserts, GM's OnStar telematics system, all-weather rubber floor mats, Chevrolet bowtie emblems embedded into the backrests of the seats (for 2002 models), dual-zone automatic climate controls with rear HVAC vents and remote controls, remote radio controls with headphone jacks for two pairs of headphones, a security system, gray-finished side running boards, power-adjustable, heated, side view mirrors, SRS side impact airbags, and more. Aside from these details, a Z71 Off-Road decal on the rear side panels identified an Avalanche equipped with this package. Full leather seating surfaces were an available option, also removing the cloth door panel inserts, and also added heated front seats. For those who liked the styling of the Z71 Off-Road package but did not plan to take their Avalanche off-road, a Z66 Premium On-Road package was also available. The Z66 On-Road package featured all the equipment that the Z71 Off-Road package offered, but replaced the off-road suspension with sport on-road suspension, and did not offer four-wheel-drive. Aside from these details, a Z66 On-Road sticker on the rear side panels identified an Avalanche equipped with this package. As with the Z71 Off-Road package, full leather seating surfaces without the cloth accents were an available option, also removing the cloth door panel inserts, and also added heated front seats. To further distinguish it from its Silverado siblings, the Avalanche was practically fully equipped and only came with bodyside cladding. The Avalanche included features such as sixteen-inch [[alloy wheels]] and tires (chromed steel on the 2500 model), an AM/FM stereo with single-disc CD player and six speakers, cloth seating surfaces, front bench seat with power front driver's seat, power windows, power door locks, [[keyless entry]], full instrumentation, dual front [[airbags]], and [[air conditioning]]. Options included [[OnStar]] [[telematics]] system, [[cassette player]], [[leather]] seating surfaces, front dual power bucket seats that could be heated, and side [[airbags]] for the front seats. A [[The North Face|North Face]] Edition, in partnership with the North Face brand included limited exterior color options, a unique Ebony/Green [[leather]] interior, special exterior ornamentation and decals, white-faced gauges, [[OnStar]] [[telematics]] system, specially colored door panel inserts and speaker grilles, and more. For 2003, the Avalanche was slightly changed. A new interior, shared with the [[Chevrolet Tahoe]] and [[Chevrolet Suburban]], added a new, larger steering wheel with subsequent audio system and [[OnStar]] controls and cruise and speed controls, an optional six-speaker premium [[Bose Corporation|Bose]] sound system with external [[amplifier]], a new gauge cluster with information center, memory for the front driver's seat, brake and accelerator pedals and side view mirror position (on some models), new radio [[head units]], which included an AM/FM stereo with single-disc CD/MP3 player and [[Radio Data System]] or an AM/FM stereo with six-disc CD/MP3 changer and [[Radio Data System]], optional [[XM Satellite Radio]], standard [[OnStar]] [[telematics]] system, optional rear audio controls with [[heaphone]] jacks, an optional rear [[DVD]] entertainment system by [[Panasonic]] with wireless headphones, new warning chimes that played through the vehicle's audio system instead of through a separate speaker behind the dashboard, and newly available seventeen-inch [[alloy wheels]] and tires. ===Cladding trouble=== Soon after the release of the Chevrolet Avalanche, customers began to notice cosmetic problems with the [[cladding (metalworking)|cladding]] on their vehicles. Over time exposure to heat and sunlight would cause a chalky faded appearance. It was especially noticeable on the cargo bed panels, and sail-panel windows where "Zebra Striping" would appear. Customer reaction to this problem resulted in General Motors agreeing to a one time treatment of a product called ArmorDillo. This product would temporarily restore the cladding for a period of about 6 months. After that it would wear off then need to be re-applied. Realizing this was not a permanent solution, GM, together with Gatorback Coatings, developed a coating that could be applied to the cladding to restore it to a like-new shine. This product was designed to etch into the plastic and bond a new layer of tinted acrylic over the faded plastic. Customers within the 3yr/36,000 original factory warranty could go to their dealership to have it restored under their original warranty under GM TSB:04-08-111-001C. General Motors did not use side body cladding on the second generation model. General Motors has also identified the original source of the faded cladding. {{clear}} == 2007–2013 == {{Infobox automobile | name = Second generation (GMT900) | image = 07-Chevrolet-Avalanche.jpg | production = April 2006 – April 2013 | model_years = 2007–2013 | engine = {{ubl | 5.3 L ''[[LS based GM small-block engine#LY5|LY5]]'' [[V8 engine|V8]] ([[gasoline]]) | 5.3 L ''[[LS based GM small-block engine#LMG|LMG]]'' [[V8 engine|V8]] (gasoline/[[E85]]) | 5.3 L ''[[LS based GM small-block engine#LC9|LC9]]'' [[V8 engine|V8]] (gasoline/[[E85]])| 6.0 L ''[[LS based GM small-block engine#L76|L76]]'' [[V8 engine|V8]] (gasoline)}} | transmission = {{ubl | 4-speed ''[[GM 4L60-E transmission]]'' automatic (2007–08)| 6-speed ''[[GM 6L80 transmission|6L80]]'' automatic (2009–2013)}} | platform = [[GM GMT platform#GMT 900|GM GMT900 platform]] (Series GMT940: GMT941) | length = {{convert|221.3|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} | width = {{convert|79.1|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} | height = {{convert|76.6|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} | weight = 5,840 lb (2649 kg) | related = [[Cadillac Escalade EXT]]
[[Cadillac Escalade ESV]]
[[Chevrolet Silverado|Chevrolet Silverado/GMC Sierra]]
[[Chevrolet Suburban|Chevrolet Suburban/GMC Yukon XL]] }} The [[GMT900]] Avalanche was introduced at the [[Chicago Auto Show]] in February 2006. Production of the redesigned Avalanche began at the [[Silao Assembly]] in April 2006. The Avalanche maintained the styled front end much like its sister vehicles, the [[Chevrolet Tahoe|Tahoe/Yukon]] and Suburban/Yukon XL, yet it still had the distinct midgate and integrated bed as found on the previous incarnation. It had all the same standard and available features as the Suburban and the Tahoe. The 2500 model of the previous generation was discontinued. A special Z71 package was offered for the second generation Avalanche. This off-road package consisted of a suspension tuned for rough terrain, an exclusive automatic locking rear differential, aluminum under body skid plates (visible from the front of the pickup truck), wheel flares, badges, wheels and tires. Later models introduced another version of the Vortec 5.3-liter V8 as the engine is now capable of running on E85 ethanol. When the 5.3 is running on normal gasoline, it produces {{convert|320|hp|0|abbr=on}} and {{Convert|335|lbft|Nm|abbr=on}} of torque whereas its output rises to {{convert|326|hp|0|abbr=on}} and {{convert|348|lbft|Nm|abbr=on}} of torque on E85, up from {{convert|310|hp|0|abbr=on}} and {{convert|335|lbft|Nm|abbr=on}} in 2009. For the 2010 model year, the 6.0-liter was dropped from the Avalanche lineup which left the 5.3 V8 as the only engine available for the SUV. In its final year, the 6.0-liter produced {{convert|366|hp|0|abbr=on}} and {{convert|376|lbft|Nm|abbr=on}} of torque. A 2007 Avalanche was given away to the Most Valuable Player of the [[2006 in baseball|2006]] [[Major League Baseball All-Star Game]], [[Michael Young (baseball player)|Michael Young]]. An Avalanche is regularly featured on the popular US crime drama [[CSI: New York]] and is driven by some members of the team. In addition, a 2007 Z-71 Avalanche placed second in [[Speed TV]]'s reality TV series '[[Bullrun (TV series)|Bullrun]]' in 2009. ===Trim Levels=== The second-generation Avalanche came in three well-equipped trim levels: The '''LS''' served as the base model Avalanche. It included seventeen-inch [[alloy wheels]] and tires, cloth seating surfaces, power front driver's bucket seat, [[OnStar]] [[telematics]] system, an AM/FM stereo with single-disc CD/MP3 player and auxiliary audio input jack with six speakers, [[keyless entry]], and black door handles, tailgate handle, and side mirrors, aluminum interior trim, front and side [[airbags]], [[traction control]], [[StabiliTrak]], and more. The '''LT''' served as the midlevel model Avalanche. It added power dual front bucket seats, [[remote start]], [[XM Satellite Radio]], [[Bluetooth]] hands-free telephone system, and exterior color-keyed door handles, tailgate handle, and side mirrors, wood interior trim, as well as other features. The '''LTZ''' was the top-of-the-line model Avalanche. It added leather seating surfaces, [[security alarm]], an AM/FM stereo with six-disc CD/MP3/DVD changer, an eight-speaker premium [[Bose Corporation|Bose]] CenterPoint amplified [[surround sound]] system, memory for the front driver's seat, twenty-inch polished [[alloy wheels]] and tires, and rear seat audio and video system controls, and the LTZ exclusive self-leveling Auto Ride suspension. ===Black Diamond Edition=== 2013 marked the Avalanche's last year of production. For 2013, all Avalanches, regardless of trim level, featured the '''Black Diamond Edition Package''', which added '''Black Diamond Edition''' emblems to the rear pillars, replacing the previous trim level designation emblems, and also adding unique emblems inside the Avalanche commemorating its production from 2002 to 2013. The 2013 Avalanche was produced in limited numbers. Each 2013 Avalanche buyer received a limited-edition coffee table book with photographs of the owner's 2013 Avalanche, a copy of the [[window sticker]] from their vehicle, and a complete history of the Avalanche from 2002 to 2013. The book was shipped to either the [[Car dealership|dealership]] or owner's home after the owner took delivery of their new 2013 Avalanche. In addition, a newly available color, named Fairway Green Metallic, commemorated the last year of production for the Avalanche (2013). Engines: * 5.3-liter [[GM small-block engine#5300|Vortec 5300]] [[V8 engine|V8]] with [[Active Fuel Management]], {{convert|320|hp|0|abbr=on}} * 6.0-liter [[GM small-block engine#HO 6100|VortecMAX]] V8 with [[variable valve timing|VVT]] and [[Active Fuel Management]], {{convert|367|hp|0|abbr=on}} (late 2006) ===Discontinuation=== In April 2012, GM announced that production of the Avalanche would end after the 2013 model year, after 2011 saw a sales decline of 2.6% to 20,088 vehicles.{{cite web|url=http://www.autoblog.com/2012/04/13/gm-announces-end-of-chevy-avalanche-with-black-diamond-edition/ |title=GM announces end of Chevy Avalanche with Black Diamond edition |publisher=Autoblog |date=13 April 2012 |accessdate=13 April 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120416024256/http://www.autoblog.com/2012/04/13/gm-announces-end-of-chevy-avalanche-with-black-diamond-edition/ |archivedate=16 April 2012 |url-status=dead }} Production of the Cadillac Escalade EXT also ended after the 2013 model year. [[File:Chevrolet Avalanche Z71 Black Diamond Last Edition 2013.jpg|thumb|2013 Avalanche Z71 Black Diamond Last Edition]] ==Yearly American sales== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Calendar Year ! Total American sales |- | 2001{{cite web|url=http://media.gm.com/news/sales/030103_decsales.html |title=GM Reports Best December Sales Since 1979 |publisher=Media.gm.com |date=January 3, 2003 |accessdate=2009-08-08 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20090423151018/http://media.gm.com/news/sales/030103_decsales.html |archivedate=April 23, 2009 }} | 52,955 |- | 2002 | 89,372 |- | 2003 | 93,482 |- | 2004{{cite web |url=http://www.theautochannel.com/news/2006/01/05/205609.html |title=GM Reports December 2005 and Year Results |work=The Auto Channel |date=January 5, 2006}} | 80,566 |- | 2005 | 63,186 |- | 2006{{cite web|url=http://media.gm.com/servlet/GatewayServlet?target=http://image.emerald.gm.com/gmnews/viewmonthlyreleasedetail.do?domain=6&docid=31596 |title=GM Reports 341,327 Deliveries In December |publisher=GM Communications |date=January 3, 2007 |accessdate=2009-08-08 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20090423152022/http://media.gm.com/servlet/GatewayServlet?target=http://image.emerald.gm.com/gmnews/viewmonthlyreleasedetail.do%3Fdomain=6&docid=31596 |archivedate=April 23, 2009 }} | 57,076 |- | 2007 | 55,550 |- | 2008{{cite web|url=http://media.gm.com/servlet/GatewayServlet?target=http://image.emerald.gm.com/gmnews/viewpressreldetail.do?domain=2&docid=51161 |title=GM Reports 221,983 Deliveries In December; 2,980,688 Vehicles Sold In 2008 |publisher=GM Communications |date=January 5, 2009 |accessdate=2009-08-08 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20090423151551/http://media.gm.com/servlet/GatewayServlet?target=http://image.emerald.gm.com/gmnews/viewpressreldetail.do%3Fdomain=2&docid=51161 |archivedate=April 23, 2009 }} | 35,003 |- | 2009http://media.gm.com/content/Pages/news/us/en/2010/Jan/0105_Dec_Sales/_jcr_content/iconrow/textfile/file.res/Deliveries%20December%2009.xls | 16,432 |- | 2010{{cite web|url=http://www.cheersandgears.com/topic/74944-december-2010-sales-general-motors/ |title=December 2010 Sales: General Motors - Cheers & Gears Forums |publisher=Cheersandgears.com |date= |accessdate=2011-01-04}} | 20,515 |- | 2011http://media.gm.com/media/us/en/gm/news.detail.html/content/Pages/news/us/en/2012/Jan/gmsales.html | 20,088 |- | 2012 | 23,995 |- | 2013http://media.gm.com/dld/content/dam/Media/gmcom/investor/2014/jan/Deliveries-December-2013.pdf | 16,986 |} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.chevrolet.com/avalanche/ Chevrolet Avalanche official site] *{{dmoz|/Recreation/Autos/Makes_and_Models/Chevrolet/Trucks/|Chevrolet Trucks}} {{Commons category}} {{Chevrolet trucks timeline 1980 to date}} {{Chevrolet vehicles}} [[Category:All-wheel-drive vehicles]] [[Category:Chevrolet vehicles|Avalanche]] [[Category:Flexible-fuel vehicles]] [[Category:Sport utility trucks]] [[Category:Rear-wheel-drive vehicles]] [[Category:2010s cars]] [[Category:Cars introduced in 2001]]

{{Infobox electric vehicle | name = Chevrolet Volt
(second generation) | image = Chevrolet Volt WAS 2017 1739.jpg | caption = 2017 Chevrolet Volt | manufacturer = [[Chevrolet]] ([[General Motors]]) | aka = Buick Velite 5 (China) | production =
